Hello everybody,
I’m Sophea, English teacher and director of the Asean International English School in Angkor Borei, 70 km south of Phnom Pehn.

I was born in 1990 into a poor family close to Takeo town. I started my primary school in 1997 and graduated from high school in 2009. Unfortunately my family couldn’t support me so I could start the university just in 2011.

I start studying English in Our Objective Organization, a very valid school. In the meanwhile I began the English Literature course at university just in the week-ends. In 2012 I got my first job as English teacher and interpreter in Hope Agency Organization. I was overworking and doing manual jobs not in my tasks for little money and not enough for paying my studies. So I was obliged to look for another job and after months I found a teaching position in a private school in Angkor Borei. However, soon I realized that the manager didn’t care about the education of the children, neither about paying the bills of the school or the salaries of the teachers. I was exhausted of working for not honest people so I decided to take the control of the situation, I became the new director of the school, I paid all the debts the former manager left by selling the only possession my parents could give me, and I founded the Asean International English School in April 2014. One year later I was graduated from my university.

That’s how our school was born. At the beginning was very difficult and now I’m still paying some of the old debts but I’m positive. This year we have one hundred students from four to sixteen years old. We are an NGO so we don't get any help from the government. The monthly fee for children is based upon the income of their family, if they are very poor we try to get some scholarship for them. At present we have twenty children who doesn't pay anything and we will like to help more families but it is not easy to find external helps. Our school provide for each student English courses three hours per day every day. We have five teachers and they need to be paid as well. The history of our country is not helping us, Cambodia is trying to get up after years of war and a very dark period in the Seventies’. Education doesn't get enough money from the government and to be fluent in English will be an important base in the education of the children. We would like to help much people possible because the highest percentage of poor people is located in the countryside.

For the moment I rent the space where I create the school. There are just three classrooms, soon four, and we really need money for school supplies of any type, new blackboards, a printer, fans, new computers, felt pens, books, notebooks, pencils and intelligent toys for the youngest kids, projectors and many other basic things for a good teaching place. My project now is to make the space more suitable for the kids, I would like to build a library with many books, dictionaries, material for listening course and movies with subtitles. My idea is to construct a playground for the youngest and to provide uniforms for all the students. So far we relied on the volunteers help as well. At present we don’t have much to offer, just one shared room and bathroom and good meals together. Because we count on them, we need to build some rooms or bungalows, and to buy some bicycles in order to make their stay more pleasant.

Update: 

As this campaign expired and the boys are still on their way to Ulan Ude, there is still time to raise some more money for the two causes!

If you wish to donate, please follow this link: https://igg.me/at/pabloandgustavo2 

To all the good people, may Karma serve you well!

 

What's It All About?

Let’s begin by satisfying your vast curiosity about Mongol Rally. Described by the organizers as the greatest motoring adventure on the planet, the Mongol Rally is a cross-continental car journey for charity that thunders 10,000 miles across the mountains, desert and steppe of Europe and Asia each summer.

Once we leave Romania, we'll have no backup, no support and no fixed route. In other words and according to the rally motto, we have to grab our summer by the balls and hope we’ll get to the finish in a very crappy 1 liter engine car. We must say we are very excited to visit almost all the local repair shops!

As passing through some of the former Soviet states, we expect a constant decrease of gas prices along with the cost of vodka until both are cheaper than clean water. We'll also get to meet a bunch of awesome people and smile politely when we don't understand what they're saying.

And yes, we are full grown men.

 

Who are we helping?

The trip is in aid of two major social and environmental causes.

The first, Cool Earth, is the official charity of the Mongol Rally and is supported by every team taking part in the race. They work to save the world’s rainforests by purchasing land and then leaving it in a local trust which they support with education, employment, and volunteers to protect the rainforest. To find out more about Cool Earth check out their website.

 

The foundation of our choosing is called Friends For You Foundation (Fundatia Prieteni Pentru Tine). Their main goal is to assure and support the social and educational development of children and young people at risk, as well as to prepare and support the social and professional integration of young people from residential centers.

Mission: To give children and young people the practical and emotional support they need to help them thrive and build the skills they need for adulthood.

“One-Step Forward” Project is a Multifunctional Center that supports the social and professional integration of 8 young people/year, aged 18 to 26 and coming from the child protection system. Direct spending costs with a young person over a 6-month period + support with the rent for another 3 months are around 3000 Euros.

All 11 young people who have been included in the program so far managed to integrate into society and currently have decent jobs. In return, some of them became mentors for the newcomers, this being the ultimate purpose of the project.

At the moment, the recruitment of the next 4 young people has begun and, with your help, Friends For You Foundation will offer them a chance to life.

We are extremely proud to be raising money for such a wonderful charity.

 

Where Does The Money Go?

Luckily we will manage to cover the costs of the trip by ourselves and with the help of some sponsors to whom we are very grateful. So we will equally divide each donation, half going to Cool Earth and half going to Friends for You. There will be some commissions so, in the name of transparency, here is what will happen to your donation:

For example, if you select “Gift Gratitude"" perk, your money is broken down as follows:
• Perk Cost                                                                            €100
• Indiegogo Fee - 5%                                                          €5
• PayPal Fee - 3.4%                                                            €3.23
• Total Contribution                                                            €91.77
• Total Donation to Cool Earth                                        €45.89
• Total Donation to Friends for You Foundation       €45.89

Who Are We? 

We are Paul Badea and Francesco del Aglli and we are the only two members of the team that goes by the name Pablo &
column2:
Gustavo.

We felt the need to set our spirits free in a true adventure so we started looking for a challenge to test ourselves and see the world.

The famous Mongol Rally has been on our radar for a few years and it now seemed like a perfect opportunity to really throw ourselves into the unknown and raise money for charities along the way.

 

What Are The Costs?

As you may think, no one in the right mind would be undertaking such a trip where you have to travel along some very harsh environments and literally put your life in danger. Besides, there will be massive amount of planning and preparation and a significant amount of money spent on stuff like visas, insurances, buying the car, shipping the car back home, equipment, food, gas, paying off dirty cops, bail money, etc.

column1:
What Is The Route? 

For all you geographically illiterate or for those without hawk-vision to see that map, the 10 countries we're driving through are: UK, Belgium, Germany, Hungary, Bulgaria, Turkey, Iran, Turkmenistan, Uzbekistan, Kazakhstan and Russia.

We can’t wait to learn how to say ""Which way to Ulan Ude?"" in 10 different languages!

 

Share!

If some of you can’t contribute it doesn’t mean you can't be a part of the journey. Share it on Facebook, Tweet it, Instagram it, Email it, talk to strangers about it, and, you know, shout it from higher grounds...any way will help!

 

Questions?

Please email rciuca@badsi.ro

Who Are We? We are Paul Badea and Francesco del Aglli and we are the only two members of the team that goes by the name Pablo & Gustavo.We felt the need to set our spirits free in a true adventure so we started looking for a challenge to test ourselves and see the world.The famous Mongol Rally has been on our radar for a few years and it now seemed like a perfect opportunity to really throw ourselves into the unknown and raise money for charities along the way. What Are The Costs?As you may think, no one in the right mind would be undertaking such a trip where you have to travel along some very harsh environments and literally put your life in danger. Besides, there will be massive amount of planning and preparation and a significant amount of money spent on stuff like visas, insurances, buying the car, shipping the car back home, equipment, food, gas, paying off dirty cops, bail money, etc.

What Is The Route? For all you geographically illiterate or for those without hawk-vision to see that map, the 10 countries we're driving through are: UK, Belgium, Germany, Hungary, Bulgaria, Turkey, Iran, Turkmenistan, Uzbekistan, Kazakhstan and Russia.We can’t wait to learn how to say ""Which way to Ulan Ude?"" in 10 different languages! Share!If some of you can’t contribute it doesn’t mean you can't be a part of the journey. Share it on Facebook, Tweet it, Instagram it, Email it, talk to strangers about it, and, you know, shout it from higher grounds...any way will help! Questions?Please email rciuca@badsi.ro",4.0,0,"2 Campaigns
|","Bucharest, Romania",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/pablo-gustavo-in-mongol-rally-charity-run/pica

0,"

(photo by Lynda L. Ciaschini)

So Get This...

To preface: the opinions here are expressed by me and my like-minded friends who are fans.

If you walk into a crowd at any Supernatural convention, chances are a good portion of said crowd will be female-presenting. But while the audience at conventions is primarily made up of women, there is a lack of female talent at conventions and the portrayal of women on the show remains problematic. Fellow fans who desire the opportunity to interact with our favorite female characters are driven to set a plan in motion that calls for change. We want to meet our “Ladies of SPN,” but don’t have enough opportunity to do so.We want to have a conversation about the roles of women on SPN and support female characters in hopes that they can find their way to stronger and longer story lines. We all desire positive change in the media as a whole. This is a change we hope “Ladies of SPN” can garner.

We love watching SPN, but many of us pine for more female driven storylines and ideas. Rarely are we given a female character with a recurring role who survived a single episode. We want female hunters that have taken up their jobs because they wanted to and had been interested in it. We want male side characters that would be equal to them instead of bumbling idiots that made the female leads look competent through their own failings. We want female character development instead of repeated cycling through same-ole-same-ole issues, without unnecessary drama and suffering — All of which is well within our SPN Family’s reach, but only if we unite and call for change.

That’s basically the spark behind “Ladies of SPN Con.” We want the opportunity to talk to all these amazing female actresses: to ask them about their characters, why they chose to play them, how they approached the roles, how they felt about the way the characters ended up, what they hoped to accomplish. Going even further, I found myself wanting to ask questions of the female crew involved with the show as well: what brought them into Supernatural, what kept them there, what they loved about their roles in making the show come alive on screen, what they hoped would improve. In short, we wanted to open a dialogue, not only with the cast and crew of the show we’ve spent the last 10 years fully engrossed in, but with the fan community as a whole. We wanted to give people the opportunity they so obviously craved.

With all this said, there is a lot of work ahead. We’ve spoken with at least a dozen past and recent actresses, all of whom are eager and anticipating us giving them set-in-stone information. Academic types and crew are also on standby. People have assembled to make this happen and are just as driven as we are. This is going to happen if it’s the last thing we do. Let’s all unite to take this idea and see it flourish. Our favorite female actresses and industry ladies need our support! Tweet about it, tumble about it, tell your facebook friends and your coworkers!

And to quote Kim Manners: let’s kick it in the ass, shall we?
column10:
What You Get

Ultimately, the money raised will cover the cost of attaining the space, hiring any professional staff for security and tech, as well as paying to get our lovely talent here.  Any and all remaining funds raised will be donated to charity.  Some of the amazing charities we will be supporting as follows:

column1: And many more!

But here's the thing -- these marvelous charities won't get much if we have an empty house.  That's where you come in.  Not only do you get to meet some of your favorite actress and the amazing, talented female crew who work behind the scenes, but you get to do it all while supporting charity!  And you decide whether or not this convention takes place!
<span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0)

$15,000 — ALL backers get into the Dealers Room 5 minutes early each day!

$17,500 — The best kind of karaoke party!  Not only can we get the machine, the speakers, and someone to run it, but we will also have a SING-A-LONG with the 200th episode playing in the background ala Rocky Horror Picture Show. Make sure to bring your pajamas~!

$20,000 — Additional pages get added to our Program Book where we will recognize ALL of our Backers. All backers, at any level, may choose to include their name, a nickname, favorite profile name, or remain anonymous, in this special Thank You section.

$25,000 — More guests will be invited!  Who would you like to see? As a member, we invite you to tell us, when we send out the survey after the campaign ends.

$30,000 — A new feature gets added... A pie social! We can now obtain the needed function space from the hotel, just so that we are able to offer this experience at all. We will complete the plans for this feature as soon as we have guests booked. And, as space for meal events like this is always limited, we will be sure to give all Backers here the first access to the passes once we make them available.

We also have a few Stretch Goals triggered by how many people join us during this campaign. These counts are for the number of Adult Memberships selected via the Rewards.

• 100 MEMBERSHIPS — All Backed Members receive the code and link to book the hotel room 24 hours before we announce it to the world. It is possible that this code will be revealed while the campaign is still going — so keep an eye out for our Updates here.
• 250 MEMBERSHIPS — We step up from a Basic Program Book to a Deluxe Program Book including full color covers and graphics. This upgrade will be for everyone attending LoSCon!

• 400 MEMBERSHIPS — This unlocks a reward that benefits more than just you, but the entire planet as well! Instead of a cheap plastic bag, all Backer Members attending LoSCon will get an environmentally-friendly, reusable Tote (like you might use for groceries) for their Goodie Bag that is picked up at the door.
• 500 MEMBERSHIPS — We will make the whole convention available LIVE on the INTERNET with a special broadcast.  Keep your eyes peeled for information as it develops.

<div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe class=""embedly-embed"" height=""326"" src=""https://cdn.embedly.com/widgets/media.html?src=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fembed%2Fmea10vDJ_4I%3Ffeature%3Doembed&amp
<h3>Risks &amp

The biggest risk is going to be with the Celebrity Guests that we will soon line up for SPNLadiesCon. Guests appearances are always subject to their prior commitments. That means even a confirmed, announced guest may have to cancel an appearance, sometimes at the last minute, to meet obligations they may have with other work assignments.

All conventions have challenges, and ours will be no exception. Thankfully, we have lots of people working together on this, with all kinds of experience working on a huge number of other conventions. Whatever hurdles may come our way, we will overcome them! We will complete this project! And it will be such a success, that you won't be able to wait for the next one!

Yes we did.  We made our original campaign with high hopes that we could raise the $15k in the allotted time and because of that, we set it to a fixed fund.  What that means is, the money was refunded back to our original donors.  We can only hope they are inclined to help us again! This time we'll make it count.

If you donated to one of the Nicki Aycox meet and greets, they can be found here as auction items.  They are listed as ""Brunch and Bitch"" on May 13 starting at $130, and ""Dining with Demons"" on May 14 starting at $250.  ""Sunday Funday"" is a special meet and greet only available as a perk item on the right side of the screen!
When and where will this convention take place?

So as best to allow for some flexibility to our esteemed guests and their busy work/leisure schedules, our plan is to run the convention May 2016 in the Seattle Metro Area!  This makes it very easy for those in North Hollywood (BC) and California to get to us without blowing out our budget.  And don't worry, all you International hopefuls -- we are not planning to compete with any of the conventions on your side of the pond.
I'm so excited! How can I help?

Aside from making even the smallest donation, tell everyone you know! Use our hashtag #SPNLadiesCon on twitter, and follow us while you're there ! Follow our facebook page too, and invite your friends to join!

If you are a maker -- someone who crafts, sews, paints, makes music, any of that -- and have something you'd like to donate to the cause for our goodie bags, please let us know! You'll automatically qualify for an additional Backer's bracelet!

***Legal Stuff: Our Conventions are unofficial, for-fans, by-fans projects and not endorsed by the copyright/trademark holders (including Warner Bros and related companies). All characters and likenesses therein belong to Warner Brothers and The CW. We welcome enthusiastic ideas from fans with the understand that the opinions and ideas stated by no means reflect the opinions of the Supernatural cast, crew, or its parent companies.

Images used are for illustrative and nominative purposes only. Copyright infringement is not intended nor should be inferred. If you believe any image belongs to you and is copyrighted please don't hesitate to get in contact.
All profits raised that are not used to fund the convention itself will be donated to charity.

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div> <h3><span style=""font-weight: normal
column5: >It's all very well to want to help shelter refugees and asylum seekers, but have you thought about what their lives in the UK would be like after the visa?

column1: The UK government apparently have not, and have just taken away all of the funding reserved for further education colleges providing essential ESOL (English to speakers of other languages) courses to some of the most vulnerable members of our society. What will the future be for these refugees and those who are already here? ESOL courses succeeded in integrating people into their local communities and British society as a whole. They gave people freedom in the form of literacy skills, often to people who had never learnt to read or write in their own languages let alone English. ESOL gave people opportunities to improve their living situations by getting them better jobs or getting them off benefits and many parents were able to use what they learnt to become involved in their children's education. ESOL is ultimately a way out of poverty above all else. Its impact on all of our local communities should not be underestimated. It can help reduce crime, improve the economy or increase local business and lead to better academic achievement in schools.

On removing the funding, further education providers have been told to find money for ESOL from elsewhere, which is, in my opinion, disgusting. It is hard to believe that people in the UK in 2015, are not being granted equal rights to education.
TO FIND OUT MORE PLEASE VISIT: http://www.educatetoliberate.co.uk
<div>

My name is Aliyah and I am a very passionate English teacher! I am a rebellious advocate for adult education. I have run off to Egypt, much to my family's dismay, to teach English to street women so that they can sell their wares to tourists. I have taught academic English skills to the most amazing young Iraqis I have ever met in Syria so that they can secure scholarships at prestigious US universities and ultimately get opportunities they can't safely have in their own war-torn country. I ran off again to teach Syrians English during the war so that they had opportunities to gain residential and academic visas for the UK. I can't stand the thought that Syria (a country I lived in for almost four years) might lose an entire generation's access to education. I BELIEVE EDUCATION IS FREEDOM AND FREEDOM IS THE GREATEST GIFT IN THE WORLD.

When I am not giving my mother a heart attack, I teach English (ESOL) in London in the further education sector. I have over ten years experience with a degree in clinical psychology and a post-graduate certificate (PGCE) in teaching English to speakers of other languages. I feel that I am ready to put all the knowledge I have accumulated over the years into running my own projects to support people, especially female learners, whose needs I have become particularly familiar with in England and abroad.
<div>
<figure style=""margin: 0px
<div>
<div>
CREATE A CAFE THAT DOUBLES UP AS AN EDUCATION SERVICE PROVIDER.
THE CAFE WILL:
BE NON-PROFIT
BE COMMUNITY-ORIENTATED
FULFILL THE ROLE OF A SOCIAL ENTERPRISE
IMPLEMENT ACTION RESEARCH METHODS IN ORDER TO CREATE COURSES THAT MEET THE NEEDS OF THE PEOPLE USING THEM
WHY IS THIS PROJECT IMPORTANT?

column2: >Risk factors promoting poor educational attainment in children are said to be deprivation, poor housing, family conflict, parents with low educational qualifications and low family income.

column1:
Not surprisingly, these are the same factors that come into play when identifying youth who are at risk of offending and being unemployed in their adult lives. And that's how families and communities get stuck in a cycle of poverty.
So how can we mitigate these risk factors and their effects? 
I think we can focus on mothers and women in general. 
I want to do this by establishing a cafe premises that doubles up as a classroom on some days and is open to the general public on others. The community can be involved by helping out, buying a coffee and watching their money get put straight back into the educational services that the cafe provides.
If we can educate, integrate and support mothers, with a strong focus on female refugees and asylum seekers, we can create more prosperous, peaceful communities.

I feel that a gender-based approach is important because our diverse society is made up of a lot of different cultures. Some do not encourage women to work or go to school. Sometimes education is not possible in a war torn country. There are many women who are illiterate in their own languages let alone English. Some do not have the English skills necessary to be independent in the UK. I hope to address the needs of these women holistically and to acknowledge them as individuals by first researching what problems they have encountered and how they think these problems can be solved. I am fed up with perpetuating an educational system that tells people what they need rather than involving them. It is time to shake things up a little.
PROVISION THE CAFE AIMS TO OFFER:
<div>
<span style=""font-size: 24px
<div>

My vision is to provide hard-to-reach women with the confidence to access local services and educational services. From healthy eating, financial literacy to 'know your rights' workshops, I aim to embody a holistic approach to education. We will liaise with local GPs, other charitable organisations and schools to enable referrals. We will also take groups of women for trips to engage with health providers for instance, to learn what support or care they have access to in London. Many hard-to-reach women are simply not confident enough, misinformed or unable to access this support, mainly due to lack of English. We would concentrate on barrier-removal for women experiencing the issues indicated above or any others they may face, the objective being to integrate these women into the local community and to provide them with opportunities that can improve their day-to-day lives.
2. EDUCATION
<div>
<span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column2: >There are many more factors that have been identified as being ‘barriers’ experienced by women who are hard-to-reach or ‘disadvantaged’. These barriers could be anything from stigma of being a refugee or migrant to social isolation to lack of literacy skills. Women unable to read and write are more likely to be homeless than men and more likely to earn less. In response, We
column3: >will run courses in English as a second language (ESOL), skills for life and literacy. We will also offer pre-entry mother and young child ESOL classes. We understand the importance of parental involvement in a child's academic attainment and we want to give mothers the tools they need to be involved. In addition to our regular courses, we aim to offer 'Do homework with your child' workshops. If a mother can participate in her child's education, that child has a stronger chance of achieving, gaining employment in the future and breaking the family poverty cycle, in turn creating more prosperous communities.

column1: <div>
3. EMPLOYABILITY
<div>
<span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column2: >Sixty percent of Somali, Turkish, Pakistani and Bangladeshi women are economically inactive. In turn, these ethnic groups experience exceptionally high levels of deprivation. Children from these backgrounds also tend to produce lower levels of achievement at school, possibly due to having English as a second language but highly likely to be the result of living in domestic conditions classed as ‘deprived’. My
column3: > mission is to provide women with a route to paid employment through gaining experience, volunteering in local charity shops. I
column4: > believe that education and learning occurs not only within the classroom but outside. Furthermore I believe in providing opportunities to break the poverty cycle so many families in the UK are finding themselves stuck in. We will offer CV writing and cover letter writing classes and assist women with applying for jobs.

column1: <div>

We need about 30,000 pounds to start-up within a London borough. Possibly Islington/Finsbury Park/Waltham Forest. Due to the nature of the project and the people I want to work with, having a regular, stable place to go to for assistance is vital. I had considered pop-ups but this is a community-based venture that will require the involvement and investment of the locals and that can't happen if we are moving all the time. The money will go toward renting a cafe premises, buying resources and materials such as books and an interactive white board for the academic side of things as well as food. I aim to start small, serving hot drinks, cakes and ready-made sandwiches and then possibly work up to meals.
All expenses and the journey of setting up the cafe will be documented on my blog: http://www.educatetoliberate.co.uk/blog/

I am very confident in dealing with the educational aspect of this project and I have a lot of amazing people with experience willing to assist me in the business side of things. We all have to start somewhere and the idea of regretting not trying this scares me more than the idea of failing.

If I don't manage to raise enough money, any donation you make will go towards the people of Syria in some form. Whether it will be donated to refugees or fund a smaller project, I will of course keep you informed.
If more money is raised it will all go toward the cafe.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this project with your friends!
","It's all very well to want to help shelter refugees and asylum seekers, but have you thought about what their lives in the UK would be like after the visa?

The UK government apparently have not, and have just taken away all of the funding reserved for further education colleges providing essential ESOL (English to speakers of other languages) courses to some of the most vulnerable members of our society. What will the future be for these refugees and those who are already here? ESOL courses succeeded in integrating people into their local communities and British society as a whole. They gave people freedom in the form of literacy skills, often to people who had never learnt to read or write in their own languages let alone English. ESOL gave people opportunities to improve their living situations by getting them better jobs or getting them off benefits and many parents were able to use what they learnt to become involved in their children's education. ESOL is ultimately a way out of poverty above all else. Its impact on all of our local communities should not be underestimated. It can help reduce crime, improve the economy or increase local business and lead to better academic achievement in schools.

On removing the funding, further education providers have been told to find money for ESOL from elsewhere, which is, in my opinion, disgusting. It is hard to believe that people in the UK in 2015, are not being granted equal rights to education.
TO FIND OUT MORE PLEASE VISIT: http://www.educatetoliberate.co.uk
ABOUT ME

My name is Aliyah and I am a very passionate English teacher! I am a rebellious advocate for adult education. I have run off to Egypt, much to my family's dismay, to teach English to street women so that they can sell their wares to tourists. I have taught academic English skills to the most amazing young Iraqis I have ever met in Syria so that they can secure scholarships at prestigious US universities and ultimately get opportunities they can't safely have in their own war-torn country. I ran off again to teach Syrians English during the war so that they had opportunities to gain residential and academic visas for the UK. I can't stand the thought that Syria (a country I lived in for almost four years) might lose an entire generation's access to education. I BELIEVE EDUCATION IS FREEDOM AND FREEDOM IS THE GREATEST GIFT IN THE WORLD.

When I am not giving my mother a heart attack, I teach English (ESOL) in London in the further education sector. I have over ten years experience with a degree in clinical psychology and a post-graduate certificate (PGCE) in teaching English to speakers of other languages. I feel that I am ready to put all the knowledge I have accumulated over the years into running my own projects to support people, especially female learners, whose needs I have become particularly familiar with in England and abroad.
MISSION:
CREATE A CAFE THAT DOUBLES UP AS AN EDUCATION SERVICE PROVIDER.
THE CAFE WILL:
BE NON-PROFIT
BE COMMUNITY-ORIENTATED
FULFILL THE ROLE OF A SOCIAL ENTERPRISE
IMPLEMENT ACTION RESEARCH METHODS IN ORDER TO CREATE COURSES THAT MEET THE NEEDS OF THE PEOPLE USING THEM
WHY IS THIS PROJECT IMPORTANT?
Risk factors promoting poor educational attainment in children are said to be deprivation, poor housing, family conflict, parents with low educational qualifications and low family income.

Not surprisingly, these are the same factors that come into play when identifying youth who are at risk of offending and being unemployed in their adult lives. And that's how families and communities get stuck in a cycle of poverty.So how can we mitigate these risk factors and their effects? I think we can focus on mothers and women in general. I want to do this by establishing a cafe premises that doubles up as a classroom on some days and is open to the general public on others. The community can be involved by helping out, buying a coffee and watching their money get put straight back into the educational services that the cafe provides.If we can educate, integrate and support mothers, with a strong focus on female refugees and asylum seekers, we can create more prosperous, peaceful communities.

I feel that a gender-based approach is important because our diverse society is made up of a lot of different cultures. Some do not encourage women to work or go to school. Sometimes education is not possible in a war torn country. There are many women who are illiterate in their own languages let alone English. Some do not have the English skills necessary to be independent in the UK. I hope to address the needs of these women holistically and to acknowledge them as individuals by first researching what problems they have encountered and how they think these problems can be solved. I am fed up with perpetuating an educational system that tells people what they need rather than involving them. It is time to shake things up a little.
PROVISION THE CAFE AIMS TO OFFER:
1. LIFE SKILLS

My vision is to provide hard-to-reach women with the confidence to access local services and educational services. From healthy eating, financial literacy to 'know your rights' workshops, I aim to embody a holistic approach to education. We will liaise with local GPs, other charitable organisations and schools to enable referrals. We will also take groups of women for trips to engage with health providers for instance, to learn what support or care they have access to in London. Many hard-to-reach women are simply not confident enough, misinformed or unable to access this support, mainly due to lack of English. We would concentrate on barrier-removal for women experiencing the issues indicated above or any others they may face, the objective being to integrate these women into the local community and to provide them with opportunities that can improve their day-to-day lives.
2. EDUCATION

There are many more factors that have been identified as being ‘barriers’ experienced by women who are hard-to-reach or ‘disadvantaged’. These barriers could be anything from stigma of being a refugee or migrant to social isolation to lack of literacy skills. Women unable to read and write are more likely to be homeless than men and more likely to earn less. In response, We will run courses in English as a second language (ESOL), skills for life and literacy. We will also offer pre-entry mother and young child ESOL classes. We understand the importance of parental involvement in a child's academic attainment and we want to give mothers the tools they need to be involved. In addition to our regular courses, we aim to offer 'Do homework with your child' workshops. If a mother can participate in her child's education, that child has a stronger chance of achieving, gaining employment in the future and breaking the family poverty cycle, in turn creating more prosperous communities.
3. EMPLOYABILITY

Sixty percent of Somali, Turkish, Pakistani and Bangladeshi women are economically inactive. In turn, these ethnic groups experience exceptionally high levels of deprivation. Children from these backgrounds also tend to produce lower levels of achievement at school, possibly due to having English as a second language but highly likely to be the result of living in domestic conditions classed as ‘deprived’. My mission is to provide women with a route to paid employment through gaining experience, volunteering in local charity shops. I believe that education and learning occurs not only within the classroom but outside. Furthermore I believe in providing opportunities to break the poverty cycle so many families in the UK are finding themselves stuck in. We will offer CV writing and cover letter writing classes and assist women with applying for jobs.
What We Need

We need about 30,000 pounds to start-up within a London borough. Possibly Islington/Finsbury Park/Waltham Forest. Due to the nature of the project and the people I want to work with, having a regular, stable place to go to for assistance is vital. I had considered pop-ups but this is a community-based venture that will require the involvement and investment of the locals and that can't happen if we are moving all the time. The money will go toward renting a cafe premises, buying resources and materials such as books and an interactive white board for the academic side of things as well as food. I aim to start small, serving hot drinks, cakes and ready-made sandwiches and then possibly work up to meals.
All expenses and the journey of setting up the cafe will be documented on my blog: http://www.educatetoliberate.co.uk/blog/
Risks & Challenges

I am very confident in dealing with the educational aspect of this project and I have a lot of amazing people with experience willing to assist me in the business side of things. We all have to start somewhere and the idea of regretting not trying this scares me more than the idea of failing.

If I don't manage to raise enough money, any donation you make will go towards the people of Syria in some form. Whether it will be donated to refugees or fund a smaller project, I will of course keep you informed.
If more money is raised it will all go toward the cafe.
Other Ways You Can Help Please share this project with your friends!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

Since it opened in 2005, the Anderson-Abruzzo Albuquerque International Balloon Museum has welcomed over 800,000
visitors from Albuquerque and many other communities in New Mexico, as well as
from across the country and around the world. The Balloon Museum's non-profit Foundation raises awareness of, and support for, the museum's exhibitions, educational programs, and collections.

column1: Through its extensive collection of artifacts, interactive
special exhibitions, and engaging educational programs, the Balloon Museum is <b>a
gateway to science, exploration, and discovery.
Now entering its second decade, the Balloon Museum seeks
to reach new and diverse audiences by increasing the relevance of its exhibitions and programs. <b>The Weather
Lab will be a major step toward the goal of becoming a go-to museum in
Albuquerque for S.T.E.M. (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics) education and engagement.
How You Can Help

Through this particular campaign, the Balloon Museum Foundation hopes to raise $48,000. These funds will go toward the fabrication of four weather-related ""pods"" that will be the foundation of major segments of The Weather Lab.
Each pod costs approximately $12,000. As money is raised through this campaign, donors will ""unlock"" the pods in this order:
<ul>
• The Sun
• Wind
• Clouds
• Precipitation
Funds raised in excess of $48,000 will be earmarked for the fabrication and development of other segments of The Weather Lab, such as ""The Box"" and touch-screen interactives.
For additional donor opportunities beyond this campaign, please contact the Balloon Museum Foundation or Paul Garver, Balloon Museum Manager, at 505-768-6030 or pgarver@cabq.gov.

Please Note: This campaign on Indiegogo has concluded. Many thanks to all who donated. If anyone still wishes to donate to this project, or to the Balloon Museum, please visit BalloonMuseum.com. Thank you!
<div>
<div>
Scheduled to open in 2016, The
Weather Lab will be a permanent, immersive, and interactive learning
experience. Students and other visitors will enter an enclosed exhibition space
that explains weather beginning with the sun, then moving through wind, clouds,
storms, and the Albuquerque “Box,” culminating with a hands-on experience in a simulated forecast center.
A range of other topics are also presented within The Weather Lab. These focus on
seasons, topography, front/pressure systems, and atmospheric levels, among
others.
A
nearby exterior space will feature a Kinetic Weather Garden, including a
fully-equipped Davis Instruments Vantage Pro II weather station that will
transmit local weather conditions to The Weather Lab and
elsewhere.

<div>

the most PhDs per capita and two national labs, New Mexico is already a

for young people to learn more about meteorology, and hopefully create a
lifelong passion and enthusiasm around S.T.E.M. -- Mayor Richard J. Berry, City of Albuquerque

column1: Understanding
weather has always been important to human civilization. From recognizing
seasons and their connection to farming practices, to identifying severe
weather threats in order to protect life and property, humans have an
inescapable relationship with weather.
In
addition, the study of weather and its many causes and effects, involves many
aspects of S.T.E.M., which stands for science, technology, engineering,
and math.
S.T.E.M.
education integrates concepts that are usually taught as separate subjects in
different classes and emphasizes the application of knowledge to real-life
situations. A lesson or unit in a S.T.E.M. class is typically based around
finding a solution to a real-world problem and tends to emphasize project-based
learning.

column1: exhibitions, programs, and resources to the S.T.E.M.-learning needs and

professionals
Contributors to the development of The Weather Lab number close to 200, with four principle participants who have helped shaped the content, design, science, and curriculum.
The lead scientific curator for The Weather Lab is Dr. David Gutzler, meteorologist and professor at the University of New Mexico.
Design and fabrication is in the capable hands of the UNM School of Architecture and Design's Fab Lab. The great crew there is: Matt, Dena, Donavan, Damien, Nick, and Vince.

Ultra-HD touch-screen, multi-function interactive elements for The Weather Lab are the creation of Ideum, a local high-tech design and fabricator of projects which can be found around the world, and in leading museums of the Smithsonian Institution.

Hands-on lesson plans and learning kits for students in multiple grade levels are being developed in cooperation with the Center for Hands-On Learning in Rio Rancho, a non-profit engaged in supporting learning by helping teachers and students have what is needed for effective engagement.

column1: ","Who We Are
Since it opened in 2005, the Anderson-Abruzzo Albuquerque International Balloon Museum has welcomed over 800,000
visitors from Albuquerque and many other communities in New Mexico, as well as
from across the country and around the world. The Balloon Museum's non-profit Foundation raises awareness of, and support for, the museum's exhibitions, educational programs, and collections.

Please Note: This campaign on Indiegogo has concluded. Many thanks to all who donated. If anyone still wishes to donate to this project, or to the Balloon Museum, please visit BalloonMuseum.com. Thank you!
Learn More About the Balloon Museum:
Plan a Visit
Education Programs
Volunteering
Stay In Touch by Email
Through its extensive collection of artifacts, interactive
special exhibitions, and engaging educational programs, the Balloon Museum is a
gateway to science, exploration, and discovery.
Now entering its second decade, the Balloon Museum seeks
to reach new and diverse audiences by increasing the relevance of its exhibitions and programs. The Weather
Lab will be a major step toward the goal of becoming a go-to museum in
Albuquerque for S.T.E.M. (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics) education and engagement.
How You Can Help

Through this particular campaign, the Balloon Museum Foundation hopes to raise $48,000. These funds will go toward the fabrication of four weather-related ""pods"" that will be the foundation of major segments of The Weather Lab.
Each pod costs approximately $12,000. As money is raised through this campaign, donors will ""unlock"" the pods in this order:
The Sun
Wind
Clouds
Precipitation
Funds raised in excess of $48,000 will be earmarked for the fabrication and development of other segments of The Weather Lab, such as ""The Box"" and touch-screen interactives.
For additional donor opportunities beyond this campaign, please contact the Balloon Museum Foundation or Paul Garver, Balloon Museum Manager, at 505-768-6030 or pgarver@cabq.gov.

Please Note: This campaign on Indiegogo has concluded. Many thanks to all who donated. If anyone still wishes to donate to this project, or to the Balloon Museum, please visit BalloonMuseum.com. Thank you!
What is The Weather Lab?
Scheduled to open in 2016, The
Weather Lab will be a permanent, immersive, and interactive learning
experience. Students and other visitors will enter an enclosed exhibition space
that explains weather beginning with the sun, then moving through wind, clouds,
storms, and the Albuquerque “Box,” culminating with a hands-on experience in a simulated forecast center.
A range of other topics are also presented within The Weather Lab. These focus on
seasons, topography, front/pressure systems, and atmospheric levels, among
others.
A
nearby exterior space will feature a Kinetic Weather Garden, including a
fully-equipped Davis Instruments Vantage Pro II weather station that will
transmit local weather conditions to The Weather Lab and
elsewhere.
With
the most PhDs per capita and two national labs, New Mexico is already a
national leader in science and technology. The new Weather Lab at the Balloon Museum will offer a unique opportunity
for young people to learn more about meteorology, and hopefully create a
lifelong passion and enthusiasm around S.T.E.M. -- Mayor Richard J. Berry, City of Albuquerque
Science and Weather, Together
Read Mayor Berry's Press Release Announcing The Weather Lab
View The Weather Lab Video
Understanding
weather has always been important to human civilization. From recognizing
seasons and their connection to farming practices, to identifying severe
weather threats in order to protect life and property, humans have an
inescapable relationship with weather.
In
addition, the study of weather and its many causes and effects, involves many
aspects of S.T.E.M., which stands for science, technology, engineering,
and math.
S.T.E.M.
education integrates concepts that are usually taught as separate subjects in
different classes and emphasizes the application of knowledge to real-life
situations. A lesson or unit in a S.T.E.M. class is typically based around
finding a solution to a real-world problem and tends to emphasize project-based
learning.
In
light of this, The Weather Lab will not only appeal to visitors in
general, but will also be an educational resource that features
professionally-developed pre-and post-visit curricula that correlate to the
Core Curriculum of the New Mexico State Standards and anticipate NextGen
Science Standards where applicable.
Another
highlight of The Weather Lab’s presence will be a webpage devoted to
information about S.T.E.M. education and career paths.
Also,
on-going public programs will be designed for students and adults, including a
“Family Science Series.”
The premise of the curriculum resources, which will
include hands-on kits, is to directly support teachers at multiple grade levels
in their Earth Science classes and during field trips to the Balloon Museum.
This includes public, private, and home school classrooms
Hands-on kits will also be available for family
visitors to The Weather Lab and others to practice meteorology in the
field, either at the Museum or at home
The goal is to connect the Balloon Museum’s
exhibitions, programs, and resources to the S.T.E.M.-learning needs and
interests of Albuquerque and New Mexico youth and aspiring S.T.E.M.
professionals
Key Partners and Creators
Contributors to the development of The Weather Lab number close to 200, with four principle participants who have helped shaped the content, design, science, and curriculum.
The lead scientific curator for The Weather Lab is Dr. David Gutzler, meteorologist and professor at the University of New Mexico.
Design and fabrication is in the capable hands of the UNM School of Architecture and Design's Fab Lab. The great crew there is: Matt, Dena, Donavan, Damien, Nick, and Vince.

Ultra-HD touch-screen, multi-function interactive elements for The Weather Lab are the creation of Ideum, a local high-tech design and fabricator of projects which can be found around the world, and in leading museums of the Smithsonian Institution.

Hands-on lesson plans and learning kits for students in multiple grade levels are being developed in cooperation with the Center for Hands-On Learning in Rio Rancho, a non-profit engaged in supporting learning by helping teachers and students have what is needed for effective engagement.
We need your help to bring this exciting, innovative and educational exhibit to the Balloon Museum. Remember, all donations are tax deductible!

Please Note: This campaign on Indiegogo has concluded. Many thanks to all who donated. If anyone still wishes to donate to this project, or to the Balloon Museum, please visit BalloonMuseum.com. Thank you!",14.0,0,"1 Campaign

S.P.R.I.N.T. Launches A genius pairing of youth and Empowerment
Lawrence has just released a new project called
“SPRINT Leadership, Mentoring and Life skills.” The project is now up on Indiegogo for everyone to see and be a
part of.  The goal of the curriculum is
to empower youth and point them away from destructive behavior and towards
positive activity.  S.P.R.I.N.T.
Leadership, Mentoring, and Life skills will help you focus on the areas that
will be most impactful for your personal growth and personal and professional
success. This campaign is showcasing the project in a unique way.  The backers are able to get an inside look at
how this idea came to realization and become part of the conversation on its
future.  Anyone who has a passion for a
stronger minded youth will be interested to see how this works.
To
realize growth and reach future users the creator has chosen crowdfunding as a
platform for to get the word out.<span>  The crowdfunding
process will allow the creator to see users reactions and help facilitate
societal involvement.  Crowdfunding is a
fantastic and relatively new way of gaining exposure but the team is positive
that this will be the key to their success. The goal of this campaign is to
reach those who share the vision of building up youth to achieve greatness, want
to share ideas, and create a community of like-minded individuals who are
interested in collaboration with the founders.
The team did a really good job at providing perks
that speak to their funders.<span> With this
campaign the backer can buy the book that goes along with the course, a one on
one with the founder or even a test run of the course itself.
The
founder says, “We’re confident that these efforts will bring to people
something they didn’t even know was missing.<span>
It will seamlessly fit into the building community culture. This will
guarantee that youth can be more than they ever imagined.”
""We’re really excited to be launching our
campaign"", says Lawrence Trice Jr.. ""With simple
features and an intuitive platform, Indiegogo is something anyone can use to
jumpstart this campaign.” Take a comprehensive look at what this groundbreaking
project is all about.<span>  For more
information contact lawrencetrice11@yahoo.com
And for those who cannot help with donations, they know how
far a Facebook “Like” or “Share” can travel.<span>
So every little bit counts. Thank you!
You are also free to contact Lawrence at lawrencetrice11@yahoo.com if you would

like to contribute in other ways or need more information.  They would love to hear from you!

Our imaginations has no restrictions. Neither should your t-shirt. We

limitations.

If you Cant Afford to Pay That Is Not the Only Way You Can Help

We know some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t
help at all. Here are some other ways you can play a role:
• Share on Twitter

• Go to lawrencetricejr.com and leave a comment on how you like the campaign and if you bought the book tell us how you liked it.
• Call, email, or text any friends who you think would be interested

Learning to Exhale has now trained nearly 2000 people through our six week mindfulness meditation programs. Our social enterprise has completed training in five hospitals and have been offering mindfulness training to communities at a significantly reduced rate. We have now trained more people than Google in mindfulness meditation.

To train many more we need your support to reach our goal of 10,000 people, families &
<div>

Our students have been able to reduce their stress levels, return to normal sleeping patterns, heal, transform, reduce blood pressure and empower themselves. As a result of the training they have an extra protection from some of the worst effects of stress
column2: cancer, heart disease, depression and nervous breakdowns. Some have even saved their marriages. Everybody who does the course repeatedly scores us 10/10.

column1: Lots of our students are nurses and they have learned a life skill through learning LTE mindfulness meditation to protect them from

We have been studied by an independent researcher at The University of Galway for one year. They saw that our training programs significantly reduce stress levels and significantly increase compassion. This is a unique evidence based European study.
Mindfulness meditation is being shown more and more to have a positive benefit on all areas of society where its practised and implemented
column2: healthcare, education, leadership and many, many workplaces.

column1: We have four social aims in the work we do with mindfulness
<ul>
• improve standards of mindfulness practice
• increase compassion, self compassion and self esteem in society
<i><b>enhance relationship experience &amp
• effect profound healings and transformations
Looking at the feedback forms from our clients we can tell you we are well on our way to achieving all of the above. Check out testimonials click here Learning to Exhale Testimonials - Mindfulness

Who We Are - Healer, Refuge Worker &

Our founder is best-selling author and health Guru Ralph Quinlan Forde. He wrote The Book of Tibetan Medicine which is now in 11 languages. Ralph does all the training instruction and has been featured on BBC, RTE, Newstalk and many newspapers &
column2: magazines. Suzanne Moran handles all the operations and finance after having worked as a case worker for 7 years in a Women's Refuge. Francis Lanuza is an artist architect turned social architect who has created all our graphics, designed &
column3: created our labels and is our top sales person. With your funding we could have some more light warriors here. We need about 10. Oh and Igor the retired guide dog who keeps us all calm and going in the right direction after having spent seven years working in a professional guidance capacity.

column1: Mindful Beauty Artisan Products

As part of how we try and fund ourselves we have launched a range of artisan cosmetics made with high quality aromatherapy essential oils and soothing natural Atlantic seaweed. Our founder used to work as a biotechnologist at The Body Shop HQ. These products have proven very popular when we have sold them at different festivals around Ireland. Ralph uses all his knowledge of herbal medicine, biotechnology, aromatherapy, Ayurveda &
column2: Tibetan Medicine, cosmetology and the latest skin science to make these products. Everyone says they are fantastic!

column1: You can only buy them from us at the moment. So the perks are unique.

There is 800 million Euros of cosmetics imported into Ireland each year where we are based. We would like to have some of this market and with the revenue run more of our courses that benefit more communities.

We would like to expand our brands success to get into retail chains all over the world and with your funding we will be able to accomplish this and become sustainable and offer even more training programs that help empower more people as a result. Plus reach more communities in more countries.
Discover Your Beautiful Mind With Us.
Our cosmetic line of 'Mindful Beauty' products is about the ethos that the ultimate beauty is kindness, compassion, spirituality and having wisdom. So our enticing marketing strapline is to
column2: 'Discover Your Beautiful Mind.' This is part of our ethos as too many people now suffer low self esteem and as part of our activities we also run <i><b>Self Esteem &amp
column3: Self Compassion Training Days. We wish to invite people to also discover their 'beautiful minds' through our LTE mindfulness training. We are also very passionate about encouraging people to transform humble weak and meek into valuable, dynamic &
column4: strong. We would like through our work for people who study with us to discover what is the difference about them that makes a difference.

column1: Facial Serum 22 - Rejuvenation
The Learning to Exhale Mindful Beauty SERUM is made with 22 natural ingredients each chosen for rejuvenation &
column2: regeneration. The effects are awesome and visible after just a few days. Fine lines and wrinkles reduced. Overall younger looking skin
column3: soft, supple and healthy. Made with botanical oils of rosehip, evening primrose, avocado, jojoba, organic pumpkin seed and essentials oils of rose, frankincense, myrrh and German chamomile to name just some of the ingredients. You can see where the effects of the serum come from -high quality natural ingredients.

column1: <b>Beauty Boxes, Aromatherapy Massage Oils &amp

Our aromatherapy massage blends are hugely popular. DREAM is made with essentials oils that encourage sleep and relaxation. ARTHRO is a blend made with essentials oils that are good for rheumatic complaints. SPORTS is a blend of essential oils for sore and tired muscles. We have lotions of Amalfi Lemon and Ylang ylang made with soothing Atlantic seaweed extract. Really lovely stuff. We also have a Spa Box for men.
Why We Need Your Support!
By ordering our high quality natural products through this crowd-funding page we hope
<ul>
• To go from training 2,000 people to 10,000 in mindfulness.
• To deliver more training programs to vulnerable groups in society such as homeless people and also refugees that have recently being arriving in Europe.
• To reach 700 young people out of 1000 who are waiting to see a psychiatrist in Ireland. We would like to help them with our training and life-skills.
• We would like to start delivering our training in cities and hospitals in the USA.
• We would like to travel and train survivors of hurricane Haiyan in the Philippines with a team of facilitators this January. Benefiting up to 2000 people.
• Start our training programs in hospitals in Australia.
• Our office really needs new computers and software. Plus a few chairs.
• We would like to publish a book about our training programs.
• In order to travel around Europe to do the training, promote our work in festivals we would also like to have a camper van and have that painted with our brand.
• Get our training CDs into schools, hospitals and hospices.
<li>Produce our <i><b>CD &amp
column2: book into Spanish open a Latino quarter.

column1: • Get the artisan cosmetic products listed by major retailers internationally.
• Finish producing our training app in mindfulness.

Why Your Support Will Help Us Succeed?
We have the track record, the independent research, fabulous natural products and the rave reviews. All of what we have achieved to date has been achieved with the skills that we have in house
column2: marketing, design, public relations, social media, sales, production, course materials. Long hours. Dedication. You name it we did it in house and on a small budget.

column1: All the products are developed, ready to go so we can deliver them quite fast to you. Whether the response is for 1000 or 20000 we can produce them all in house in a matter of weeks. Remember at the moment you can only get them from us making them unique.
As we have opted for flexible funding whether we reach the goal or not you still get your perk and benefit other peoples lives. We hope we will surpass the funding goal.

With your funding and support we can achieve all of this. With the support of all the people who came on the courses we have come this far. With your support we can now go further and benefit more people healing transforming and empowering them.
Lets Increase The CrowdFund with Match Funding.

When we reach this crowdfunding goal of $50,000 we will then approach the local enterprise supports here and could increase the funding by 25%-50%. In other words the government enterprise supports will match fund what you will have funded. We have already spoken with a number of government agencies with regard to this. So you get to support something truely meaningful, receive a wonderful Mindful Beauty perk and double your money by supporting us.
Only with your funding can we access these supports.
Please share this information to friends and on pages you think will be interested in supporting us.

Finally - thank you. Really. Only with your support can we grow as fast, can we reach more people to empower them, expand the natural cosmetics to channels that support more of our work with people, perhaps even transform society. From what we have done so far we think its possible. The secret to our success is your support.

I’m Gaius Kowene, a multimedia journalist based in Goma, eastern DRC. I love telling personal stories of ordinary people with extraordinary achievements
in a challenging environment.
I was trained in journalism and social media
at Yole!Africa during the 2012’s SKIFF festival. Few months later, I was able
to make more local voices being heard on international media with an authentic
perspective, changing the world’s perception of DRC.
I remember the first computer I could access
permanently was from a fundraising campaign Yole!Africa and SKIFF did. This
helped me improve my skills and use them for the benefit of the whole
community.
For me, this campaign is an opportunity to
contribute to an impactful initiative, changing a whole community’s resilience
abilities.
Your contributions will help Goma youth
sustain their struggle for an autonomous community, free from corporate,
political and NGO pressure. It will make it easy for them to contribute to a
new self-concept of who they are and build a brighter future from their
community’s priorities.

column2:
/>

(Gaius Kowene and Allason Leitz- VERY excited about Yole!Africa in 2014).

column1: This campaign is important to me, because in the four trips I've taken to the DRC every summer for the Salaam Kivu International Film Festival, I've seen the importance of organizations that work in their own communities. Yole!Africa and SKIFF in particular hold a place in the heart of this city in a way that inspires participants to not just learn but also to give back by volunteering at the festival. It's truly an organization with an impact.

Every penny you give to this campaign will go into getting more equipment for youth attending the center to tell their stories. I've worked with this organization for four years and have seen how every single penny we get is used in the most effective way possible for the youth. We're not partnered with International NGO's or for that matter with anyone who is going to tell us to put our energy into places that aren't going to serve the youth first and foremost. That's why we need your help today, to contribute, person to person, heart to heart to an organization that has effected the lives of over 23,000 youth annually in a region fraught by constant conflict and war.
<div>
Contributing to this Indiegogo is a chance for your
contribution to make both a local and a global impact. On a local level you’re
donation will give youth access to equipment and skills that the youth can
apply to their lives every single day. On a global level, the youth having the
resources to tell their stories will increase a humanist awareness about the
atrocities taking place in the region.
Some Background and What we're asking for!
<div>

Here are some more of the basics about what makes Yole!Africa and SKIFF unique and a great opportunity to be involved in through this Indiegogo! The festival and cultural center have been a cover story in the ART section of the New York Times (2014). We've been written up in Aljazeera (2014) and in the Economist (2010) among many, many other places. Our work hasn't gone unnoticed, and now it's your moment to join the movement.
Brief History of SKIFF:

The Salaam Kivu International Film Festival (SKIFF) was founded in 2005, when the war in the east of the Democratic Republic of the Congo was escalating and the region, as defined by international press outlets, was exclusively a place of violence and despair. To combat both the frustration of the local community and the misrepresentation of the international media, internationally acclaimed filmmaker and activist Petna Ndaliko Katondolo launched SKIFF, the first international film festival in the DRC. Since its inception, SKIFF has been a vehicle for peace, positive socio-political transformation, and has provided the wider world with an increasingly diverse vision of the east of Congo, one that includes exceptional talent, beauty, and joy despite the challenges of the region.

After nearly a decade of steady growth, SKIFF now regularly brings together more than 15,000 people from around the world, who want to participate in a meaningful event that,time and again, confirms the power of art and culture to change the world for the better.

When SKIFF began in 2005, it was the first event of its kind in many ways. Not only was it the first venue that brought a diverse selection of international films and videos to Congo, it was also the first time the local community gathered together with force around their artistic talents. Despite the backdrop of soldiers and tanks moving through the streets as rebel troops advanced within 5 kilometers of the city, even at the first edition of SKIFF thousands of people came together in a non-violent demonstration calling for peace. The collective effect of this gathering was a growing awareness among the community that art is central to the practice of peace. With this knowledge, the community has become increasingly empowered to speak out about social problems and advocate positive solutions.
Brief History of Yole!Africa:

Yole!Africa, founded in 2000 by internationally acclaimed Congolese filmmaker and activist Petna Ndaliko, is a center for creativity and cultural exchange based in Goma, in the east of the Democratic Republic of the Congo. Yole!Africa is based on the belief that offering local populations – and youth in particular – tools of non-violent self-expression and critical thought will allow them to participate actively in shaping their own realities.

The center’s mission is to promote peace through art and culture as well as to operate as a platform for exchange where young people from different backgrounds and social status can come together to express themselves through their talents.

Yolé!Africa is neither a political nor a denominational organization, through its programs it promotes and encourages value and respect for all human beings (regardless of race, origin, religion, ethnicity or gender), and stands against all forms of exploitation or violation of human rights. As an organization, Yole!Africa seeks to promote and encourage art. It supports artists and offers them a place conducive to creativity. It also links the community and its artists in order to strengthen the common culture and identity. Through trainings, workshops and community events, Yole!Africa promotes dialogue and respect for others and, through debate and reflection on current social and political issues, generates the awareness that everyone is an actor of her/his life and of the society in which she/he lives and has the right and duty to make of it a better place.
WHAT WE'RE ASKING FOR:
<h3><span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column8: >We're asking you for $23,252 to buy camera's, tripods, editing equipment (i.e. hardware/software) and a generator.

SD Cards: $500

Memory: 32GB 1600MHz DDR3 SDRAM - 4X8GB
Storage: 256GB Flash Storage

Adobe Creative Suite: http://adobe.ly/1H4UXFr

GRAND TOTAL: $23,252

column5: >While this is the total that we'll need to reach our goal. Obviously, if we don't, we'll use what we have to continue to build on the core elements of our lab. Depending on our total funding, we'll prioritize camera's and editing equipment as those are both essential components for the youth to get started.
>Remember what Gaius Kowene says in the video ""
column9: >SKIFF is a necessity for young people here in the region…

column1: for me [the festival] is an inspiration showing that we can do something great.” Let's work together to make this possible for more youth in the region.
The Challenges
<h3><span style=""background-color: initial
column6: >Yole!Africa has an outstanding reputation in the area and is at the heart of the community. Yet In a region where 8 million people have died in the last 25 years poverty and constant displacement are an issue security can at times be an issue. We have had one incident of theft in the past five years, yet we were able to recover majority of the equipment stolen. While theft is always an impending threat, by and large the organization has taken significant steps to prevent a second breach of security on the premises. We taken measures to prevent a
column13:
>  by heightening our security measures and hiring a guard to stay on the premises at all times. Additionally, the system for renting out equipment is more rigorous and requires more strict identification now than it did before. All of this helps us to control (without hindering youth from access) who is on the premises at all times.

Other Ways You Can Help

What are the chances you read all of this and felt so inspired you went to open your wallet only to remember there isn't much green inside? Well not to worry! We are always looking for in-kind donations and all sorts of different contributions.

column1: Are you on social media? CLICK SHARE!!! It's probably one of the best things you can do to help us get the word out about this campaign!
Are you a professional artist interested in teaching a class at the center?
Have you had your own idea of how you want to get involved? Contact us!
