Who We Are

My name is Jacques Sebisaho and I'm the founder and CEO of Amani Global Works, a non-profit that works in public health on the island of Idjwi in the DRC. I grew up on Idwji Island and when I went back to visit as an adult, I could no longer stand by and watch an entire community struggle and suffer due to the lack of basic public health services. In only 5 years, I founded Amani Global Works and we have since built a fully equipped hospital on the island, staffed with qualified local doctors and nurses, began an agricultural community program, a daily nutrition program where local children could come twice a day to receive a free nutrient-rich porridge to supplement their normal diet and ensure that the children could escape the vicious cycle of malnourishment and disease, and a family planning program to confront the exponential population growth in Idjwi.

However, shortly after beginning the nutrition program we encountered a problem. Because it was often a long journey from the children's homes to our hospital, many children dropped out of school, came to the hospital in the morning for the morning porridge, then simply waited around the hospital grounds until the afternoon for their second porridge. Of course we couldn't allow all the children on Idjwi Island to drop out of school for health's sake, so we decided to start a small school on the hospital grounds. What we discovered was that the rate of girls not attending school on the island was much higher than that of boys not attending school, so because we had very limited resources and couldn't accept all the children, we decided to open our school to the girls of Idjwi.

Since the opening, we have had 140 girls enroll, but we still do not even have a school building for them! We have been meeting in an old church building with dirt floors and old, dilapidated walls that is not a suitable space for a school. We have hired qualified teachers, and direct some of our budget from the hospital to buy school supplies for them, but we are making plans to build a fully equipped school for the girls with enough room to accommodate 400 students!
From UNESCO:

column14: >Educated women are less likely to die in childbirth:

column1: If all mothers completed primary education, maternal deaths would be reduced by two-thirds, saving 98,000 lives
In sub-Saharan Africa, if all women completed primary education, maternal deaths would be reduced by 70%, saving almost 50,000 lives.

column2: >Educating girls can save millions of lives:

column1: If all women had a primary education, there would be 15% fewer child deaths.
If all women had a secondary education, child deaths would be cut in half, saving 3 million lives.
Mothers’ education improves child nutrition
If all women had a primary education, 1.7 million children would be saved from stunting from malnutrition.
If all women had a secondary education, 12 million children would be saved from stunting from malnutrition

column14: >Girls with higher levels of education are less likely to have children at an early age

column1: 10% fewer girls would become pregnant under 17 years in sub-Saharan Africa            and South and West Asia if they all had a primary education
Almost 60% fewer girls would become pregnant under 17 years in sub-Saharan          Africa and South and West Asia if they all had a secondary education.

column5: >Educating girls is a key factor in hastening the demographic transition to lower birth rates.

column1: In sub-Saharan Africa, women with no education have 6.7 births, on average.              The figure falls to 5.8 for those with primary education and more than halves,              to 3.9, for those with secondary education.

column5: >Girls with higher levels of education are less likely to get married at an early age

column1: If all girls had a primary education, there would be 14% fewer child marriages
If all girls had a secondary education, there would be two-thirds fewer child                  marriages

column5: >Education narrows pay gaps between men and women

column1: In Pakistan, women with a primary education earn 51% what men earn. With a            secondary education, they earn 70% what men earn
In Jordan, women with a primary education earn 53% what men earn. With a              secondary education, they earn 67% what men earn

column5: >Educated women are more likely to find work:

column1: In Brazil, only 37% of women with less than primary education are in work. This          rises to 50% if they have a primary education, and 60% with a secondary                      education
The Project
<ul>

• Our budget to build the school is $100,000. This cost will include the building materials, labor costs, and furnishing the school. At Amani Global Works we believe in paying our workers a fair wage, and we operate in good faith in partnership with the community. The quoted price reflects those attitudes in our construction.
Our Experience

Amani Global Works has been working with the community on Idjwi Island officially since 2005. However, our founder grew up on the island and has had strong community ties there all his life. In 2012 we began construction on a hospital in Idjwi that we completed in 2014. That hospital is now fully functional and fully staffed and proves our experience on Idjwi Island and our ability to drive projects to completion. Our close connection with the community allows us to complete projects more easily and quickly than many non-profit organizations.
<ul>
What are the risks?

The only risk we anticipate is the project taking longer than envisioned due to a lack of funding or various other delays. However, we have decided and are fully committed to building a school, so the only eventuality to consider is the time frame and funds available (which dictates how fast we can build).
<ul>
How can I help without donating?
If you don't have the funds to donate but want to help you can:
<ul>
• Check us out on social media and like our pages!

I am here because I want to ask for your support on my path of achieving  my dream to study Climate Change Mitigation and Adaptation at one of the world's best universities- Copenhagen University  Denmark.

I was studying Geography but 4 years ago I took one of the best decisions in my life. I decided to leave Romania and go study Environmental Science in one of the most green, innovative  and progressive countries in the world . A decision that completely changed my life and I am very happy for that. The idea behind my class was that students from many different countries live together and study to become agents of change in the field of Sustainability and Climate Change.

After 4 years I find myself facing another decision that is going to change my life. I recently got offered a place in the Master of Science in Climate Change Mitigation and Adaptation by the University of Copenhagen  . I was keeping my eyes on this master programme in the last 3 years and of course that I am  very happy to see the acceptance letter knowing that there were over 300 applicants on 60 available places.  It was not easy to get in but competition is always good !

I believe that Climate Change is one of the biggest challenges that humanity has to face and it is going to affect people, plants and animals and the way we are used with living on the planet. It is maybe the greatest moral, economic and social challenge of our time.  It is therefore important to understand the processes and the dynamics of the change in order to find the best way of mitigating and adapting to the problems that we are going to face altogether.
The best way of dealing with the climate change is to invest in education and raise environmental awareness.

Copenhagen is one of the most expensive cities in the world and the rent in some of the student dorms can go up to 1000 $. It is actually the most expensive city in EU and  this is why I decided to ask you for help.  I was lucky to get room in one of the cheapest dorms that will cost me only 6000 $ per year.
My parents passed away and I have nobody to support me. Being in such a difficult position, I had no choice but to work every weekend in the last couple of years in order to pay for my studies.

By doing this campaign I will not have to work during weekends anymore and I in this way will have more time to invest in my studies. The money from this campaign will be used to pay for my accommodation for the next 2 years and I will try to cover the rest of my expenses from my own savings or by working during summer time. If I don't reach my goal, there will be no option but to work in the nights and in weekends knowing that this is going to affect my studies.

I was worried about how could I make it real until one friend gave me the idea of trying to crowdfund it. It is not easy for me to ask for personal support from other people as I like to be independent just like everybody else. It always felt a bit embarrassing and it requires a lot of courage  but at the same time I believe that there are a lot of people that care about climate change and even more people that would support someone’s education.
By supporting me you are giving me the possibility to have more free time that I could allocate to my studies. My commitment to you is that I will do my best !
How can you help

1. Make a donation.  The good news is that I don't have to pay tuition fee. For my expenses, a donation of $50 could make all the difference. In fact, we will reach our fundraising goal if 240 people give $50 each !

2. Spread the word. If this isn’t the right time for you to give money, you can still support my studies by telling your friends about this campaign. Just emailing this video to 10 friends, reposting on your Facebook page, or Tweeting about it could make a significant difference.

How can you help

1. Make a donation.  The good news is that I don't have to pay tuition fee. For my expenses, a donation of $50 could make all the difference. In fact, we will reach our fundraising goal if 240 people give $50 each !

2. Spread the word. If this isn’t the right time for you to give money, you can still support my studies by telling your friends about this campaign. Just emailing this video to 10 friends, reposting on your Facebook page, or Tweeting about it could make a significant difference.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Iasi, Romania",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/study-climate-change-at-copenhagen-university/pica

Short Summary
Greetings. Thank you for stopping by.

My name is Chido Musasiwa-Gutu and I am the founder of LET THEM TRUST – a child-oriented creative, educational and cultural initiative that is a platform for young Zimbabweans to develop and showcase artistic talent and learn who they are along the way.

Founded in 2010, LET THEM TRUST was conceived to preserve traditional and cultural heritage through Ngano (traditional storytelling) plays in schools, but has now evolved into a thriving and diverse kids-centred arts organization.

Zimbabwe is a culturally rich nation with proud and valuable traditions and heritage. But, the reality of the modern world sees our youth increasingly look elsewhere for stimulation, role models, answers … We don’t object to this per se, we simply attempt to redress the balance.

Incorporating workshops and discussion, LET THEM TRUST gives our participants a voice, we lend an ear, and we provide options for how young people can navigate the specific issues that affect them as Zimbabweans in the 21st century. We address HIV/AIDS, child labour, sex (and sex for exchange), teenage pregnancy, loneliness, children’s rights, peer pressure, physical and mental abuse, substance abuse, environmental education, culture, heritage and so much more.
LET THEM TRUST currently carries out the following activities:

1. Annual school arts festival
2. Arts workshops in schools
3. Capacity-building workshops in schools
4. Training in artistic disciplines
5. Career pathways

So far, LET THEM TRUST has conducted music, theatre, dance, poetry, fashion and heritage workshops in over 300 schools, impacting the lives of more than 180,000 students. Our flagship event is the LET THEM FESTIVAL – 2017 will be our fifth anniversary. The LET THEM FESTIVAL is the only one of its kind, attracting schools from around the country to share in our ideals and share the fun. What we have achieved so far has been with the help of government and corporate partners. But, we are neither political nor corporate. Instead, we are hopeful. The LET THEM TRUST VILLAGE will enable us to become a self-sustaining enterprise built on the finance of hope – our hope for Zimbabwe, our hope for our future, our hope for our children.
LET THEM TRUST VILLAGE

We have a 40-acre site on the outskirts of Harare in the beautiful Mazowe Hills, perfectly suited for the LET THEM TRUST VILLAGE. The construction will include administration block, dining hall (and indoor performance space), dormitories for 200 kids, music and visual arts studios, and professional kitchen. The LET THEM TRUST VILLAGE will offer the following activities to schools, youth visitors and tour groups:
* Music workshops
* Theatre workshops
* Poetry workshops
* Heritage tours in Gomba Intangible Heritage Landscape
* Visits to Tengenenge Sculpture Village
* Recording facilities
* Ngano (storytelling) workshops
* Hiking and mountain biking in the hills
* Fishing in nearby dams
WE NEED YOU

The need is obvious, the vision is clear, the site is ours. But, we can’t do this alone. We need you. We need your money. We need to build a dream that will change realities. We need to make the Mazowe hills echo with children’s voices. Because it takes a village to raise a child …
FINANCES
We are looking for US$450,000 to construct the LET THEM VILLAGE:
<ul>
• Architectural plans                             US$2,600
• Engineering plan                                  US$6,000
• Ground levelling                                  US$5,000
• 28 Dormitory huts                              US$126,000
• Bean-shaped Huts                              US$28,000
• Roads                                                  US$2,000
• Main auditorium                                 US$120,000
• Bridge construction                             US$2,500
• Retaining walls                                    US$18,000
• Toilet huts                                          US$35,000
• Labour                                                 US$20,000
• Solar power system                            US$44,000
• Water system                                      US$20,000
• Kitchen/dining equipment                   US$20,000
• Total                                                   US$449,100

We have already started our local fundraising campaign alongside Indiegogo. If we do not reach our Indiegogo target, we will commence construction of the LET THEM TRUST VILLAGE nonetheless. However long it takes, we will make this happen.
IMPACT

The impact of your contribution will be felt in years to come, but also into the past … because you are not just helping develop Zimbabwean children’s hope in where they’re heading, but also their pride in where they come from. What’s more, the LET THEM VILLAGE will enable us to open our programmes beyond Zimbabwe and invite the participation of international schools and youth groups to experience and celebrate our rich and unique cultural heritage.

LET THEM TRUST’s contribution to arts and heritage and in the lives of Zimbabwe’s children has already been recognized by our many partners, including – the National Arts Council of Zimbabwe, the Ministry of Education, the Culture Fund, Shoko Festival, the Zimbabwe Agricultural Society, the EU, Commercial Bank of Zimbabwe, ZiFm Stereo, SOS Childrens Village, Africad, Brands Africa, Dendairy, Code Teens, Ster Kinekor, Spar Community Benefit and Bakers Inn.
YOUR HELP

Any financial support you can offer the LET THEM VILLAGE, large or small, is greatly appreciated. We also value any efforts you make to help us get the word out. Please share this page with your electronic networks – on E-mail, Facebook, Twitter and Instagram. We need to be noticed.

Here in Zimbabwe, we have a saying: “Kupa kuturika” – “To give is to bank”. I am asking you to invest in our future. Wherever you are in the world, it is OUR future – yours and mine. Because, these days it takes a global village to raise a child …
Go to Facebook to find out more about the LET THEM VILLAGE, see more images and send us a message.

https://www.facebook.com/LTTVillageGomojena/

column2:
>You can discover more about a person in an hour of play than in a year of conversation.  
~ Plato 

The field of drama therapy thrives on dramatic play and creativity: ritual, improvisation, theater games, role, masks, puppets, embodied and projective play are all core elements of our work. Dramatic play enhances therapeutic alliances and creates empathy
column3:
it inspires cooperation, flexibility and growth. Creativity allows us to express our repertoire of emotions and inspires our imagination. Our community is coming together to actively explore how the benefits of dramatic play and creativity facilitate change and improve overall health and wellbeing. You can help make this possible! 

With your donation we can create enriching conversation, critical investigation, inspiring collaboration, synergetic sharing, nurturing connection, and playfulness we will learn from each other, expand the umbrella, and generate global enthusiasm for drama therapy. THANK YOU! 

We Need You!

We have invited 50 people to commit to finding 10 people to donate $10.00/each. Our goal is to raise $5,000 dollars. $5,000 may seem like a large goal to reach in 10 days but with 50 committed team leaders and lots of enthusiasm we will be there in no time. Thank you for helping make this possible!

Who is ChefPV?

Culinary thought leader Don Peavy—also known professionally as “ChefPV”—is transforming what we eat and what we think about what we eat.  His is a platform of sustainability, Entomophagy (the consumption of insects), and social and political awareness.  As a full-spectrum chef, and progressive voice in the food industry, Peavy is making profound change more digestible and delicious for everyone.
Why Entomophagy?

Don Peavy first learned about Entomophagy near the end of 2014 when his pal GOOGLE showed him the United Nations FAO-sanctioned report Edible insects: Future prospects for food and feed security.  This 201-page document paints a bleak picture of how strained global food systems are:

• Trends towards 2050 predict a steady population increase to 9 billion people, forcing an increased food/feed output from available agro-ecosystems resulting in an even greater pressure on the environment. Scarcities of agricultural land, water, forest, fishery and biodiversity resources, as well as nutrients and non-renewable energy are foreseen.
and recommends the promotion and support of edible bugs to help tackle these pressing issues:

<ul><li><a href=""http://www.fao.org/edible-insects/en/"" rel=""noopener nofollow""><i>Edible insects contain high quality protein, vitamins and amino acids for humans. Insects have a high food conversion rate, e.g. crickets need six times less feed than cattle, four times less than sheep, and twice less than pigs and broiler chickens to produce the same amount of protein. Besides, they emit less greenhouse gases and ammonia than conventional livestock. Insects can be grown on organic waste. Therefore, insects are a potential source for conventional production (mini-livestock) of protein, either for direct human consumption, or indirectly in recomposed foods (with extracted protein from insects)
column2: and as a protein source into feedstock mixtures.

column1: ChefPV was instantly activated towards the U.N.'s call seeking help promoting Entomophagy from food industry professionals.  Days after reading the report, he was in communications with key figures in Entomophagy and started a personal journey into the exciting world of eating bugs.  Almost 4 months later, ChefPV passionately laid out the Entomophagy Saga to Director Justin Noto which led to a one-year journey producing
column3: '>Buggin'Out w/ChefPV, a new educational series dedicated to the art and science of eating bugs.

column1: The series is a fun way to get people on the Entomophagy bandwagon, however few opportunities exist for the students of America to engage with edible bugs and ChefPV recognizes the positive impact eating bugs can have for present and future food security so he's taking his message to the people to let them know eating bugs are fun and delicious :)

With your help, ChefPV will tour America's schools and engage grades 5th - 12th in a discussion about Entomophagy while providing hands-on-experience preparing bug dishes culminating in the most awesomely delicious edible bugs taste test EVER.

We are SOOOOO EXCITED to have Little Herds  (a 501c3 Charitable Nonprofit educating communities about the use of insects for food) coming on as our Educational Partner to assist us in creating the curriculum we'll use with students on the tour.  Little Herds is also providing logistics counsel and administrative assistance thanks to their years of experience producing educational events globally for students to learn about the future of food.  Little Herds is also arming the tour with
column2: w=1"" rel=""noopener nofollow"">Educator Kits to leave with each school, allowing teachers to share the joys of edible insects with their students with tasting samples, curriculum, activities, pictures, videos and online resources for educators to use for free.

column1: The first wave of the tour is planned for the following cities: Atlanta - Detroit - San Francisco - Washington, D.C. - Asbury Park - Philadelphia - Portland - Seattle - Memphis - Austin - Dallas - Miami - Los Angeles - Boston - Phoenix - Chicago - San Diego - Las Vegas - Mesa - New Orleans - St. Petersburg - Reno - NYC - Denver
The Buggin' Out w/ChefPV Tour begins in NYC, has stops in 24 cities and provides 48 schools with a 1.5 hour Entomophagy Exploration.
Your Funding Support will provide the following needs of the 6-week tour :
<ul>
• Fuel-efficient Rental Vehicle (and associated costs i.e. insurance, gas)
• Accommodation support for Team in host cities (ChefPV, Project Liaison, Social Media Manager/Documentarian)
• Edible Bug and other Entomophagy ingredients to provide eating experience
• $250/week salary for Project Liaison and Social Media Manager/Documentarian
<li>Discounted costs for Perks &amp
• Funds raised in excess of our $8000 goal will be used to add additional cities/schools to the next wave of tours

Nearly 80% of the world enjoys edible bugs as a daily part of their diets and they LOVE IT!  Don't let our American students get left behind in this global movement.  Help ChefPV support the future of our kids and planet by opening their minds to this fierce food supply!
","Who is ChefPV?

Culinary thought leader Don Peavy—also known professionally as “ChefPV”—is transforming what we eat and what we think about what we eat.  His is a platform of sustainability, Entomophagy (the consumption of insects), and social and political awareness.  As a full-spectrum chef, and progressive voice in the food industry, Peavy is making profound change more digestible and delicious for everyone.
Why Entomophagy?

Don Peavy first learned about Entomophagy near the end of 2014 when his pal GOOGLE showed him the United Nations FAO-sanctioned report Edible insects: Future prospects for food and feed security.  This 201-page document paints a bleak picture of how strained global food systems are:

Trends towards 2050 predict a steady population increase to 9 billion people, forcing an increased food/feed output from available agro-ecosystems resulting in an even greater pressure on the environment. Scarcities of agricultural land, water, forest, fishery and biodiversity resources, as well as nutrients and non-renewable energy are foreseen.
and recommends the promotion and support of edible bugs to help tackle these pressing issues:

Edible insects contain high quality protein, vitamins and amino acids for humans. Insects have a high food conversion rate, e.g. crickets need six times less feed than cattle, four times less than sheep, and twice less than pigs and broiler chickens to produce the same amount of protein. Besides, they emit less greenhouse gases and ammonia than conventional livestock. Insects can be grown on organic waste. Therefore, insects are a potential source for conventional production (mini-livestock) of protein, either for direct human consumption, or indirectly in recomposed foods (with extracted protein from insects)
column2: and as a protein source into feedstock mixtures.

column1: ChefPV was instantly activated towards the U.N.'s call seeking help promoting Entomophagy from food industry professionals.  Days after reading the report, he was in communications with key figures in Entomophagy and started a personal journey into the exciting world of eating bugs.  Almost 4 months later, ChefPV passionately laid out the Entomophagy Saga to Director Justin Noto which led to a one-year journey producing Buggin'Out w/ChefPV, a new educational series dedicated to the art and science of eating bugs.

The series is a fun way to get people on the Entomophagy bandwagon, however few opportunities exist for the students of America to engage with edible bugs and ChefPV recognizes the positive impact eating bugs can have for present and future food security so he's taking his message to the people to let them know eating bugs are fun and delicious :)

With your help, ChefPV will tour America's schools and engage grades 5th - 12th in a discussion about Entomophagy while providing hands-on-experience preparing bug dishes culminating in the most awesomely delicious edible bugs taste test EVER.

We are SOOOOO EXCITED to have Little Herds  (a 501c3 Charitable Nonprofit educating communities about the use of insects for food) coming on as our Educational Partner to assist us in creating the curriculum we'll use with students on the tour.  Little Herds is also providing logistics counsel and administrative assistance thanks to their years of experience producing educational events globally for students to learn about the future of food.  Little Herds is also arming the tour with Educator Kits to leave with each school, allowing teachers to share the joys of edible insects with their students with tasting samples, curriculum, activities, pictures, videos and online resources for educators to use for free.
Your Support

The first wave of the tour is planned for the following cities: Atlanta - Detroit - San Francisco - Washington, D.C. - Asbury Park - Philadelphia - Portland - Seattle - Memphis - Austin - Dallas - Miami - Los Angeles - Boston - Phoenix - Chicago - San Diego - Las Vegas - Mesa - New Orleans - St. Petersburg - Reno - NYC - Denver
The Buggin' Out w/ChefPV Tour begins in NYC, has stops in 24 cities and provides 48 schools with a 1.5 hour Entomophagy Exploration.
Your Funding Support will provide the following needs of the 6-week tour :
Fuel-efficient Rental Vehicle (and associated costs i.e. insurance, gas)
Accommodation support for Team in host cities (ChefPV, Project Liaison, Social Media Manager/Documentarian)
Edible Bug and other Entomophagy ingredients to provide eating experience
$250/week salary for Project Liaison and Social Media Manager/Documentarian
Discounted costs for Perks & Shipping of Perks
Funds raised in excess of our $8000 goal will be used to add additional cities/schools to the next wave of tours

Nearly 80% of the world enjoys edible bugs as a daily part of their diets and they LOVE IT!  Don't let our American students get left behind in this global movement.  Help ChefPV support the future of our kids and planet by opening their minds to this fierce food supply!",1.0,0,"1 Campaign

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div>

About me
Hi, my name is Weiwen. I'm a Singaporean food and wine journalist with 10 years of journalism experience. I’m always looking out for great food, top wines and the ultimate bowl of ramen.

How the book idea began
The first Japanese wine I had tried was a bottle of Koshu from Katsunuma winery—I had bought it from a wine shop in Tokyo Station in 2009. It was an easy-drinking wine. It wasn’t love at first sip but it was appealing enough to make me buy a couple of bottles whenever I was in Tokyo.

The seed for this book idea, however, was planted—rather unconsciously—in November 2015. I was at the Hong Kong International Wine &
column2: Spirits Fair, attending as a journalist. The Japanese wine exhibitors drew curious visitors, myself included. Some of their wines were decent, some had me going for seconds, and others tasted too fruity for my palate. I felt there was a story idea worth exploring there. But I filed the idea into my mental KIV box.

column1: Two weeks later, I was in Japan for my yearly holiday in the country. I was in a pensive mood. I had been thinking of how to combine my love for Japan with my profession. I knew I’d like to write a book about Japanese food but I didn’t want to do one about sushi or sake—there are already hundreds of such books out there, written by authors who are more knowledgeable than me. What aspect of Japanese culture or food has not been published into a book yet? What’s new?
In between bowls of ramen, showers of autumn leaves, and glasses of beer and wine, the book idea crystallised. Japanese wines. Why not?  I started doing my research…
Fast forward to early August 2016. I had left my job as editor of Wine&
column2: Dine magazine and was busy preparing for my two-month (mid-August to mid-October 2016) trip across Japan. My plan was to visit 30 wineries in Nagano, Yamanashi, Kyushu and Hokkaido, interviewing the winemakers at each stop.

column1: I ended up visiting 36 wineries. Along the way, I was lucky to miss a few typhoons and escape some severe weather. In all, it was a great field trip.

What will the book be like?
This isn’t going to be a coffee table book, neither will it be a totally geeky book that delves into the molecular structures of malic and lactic acids. It will be part travel narrative, part educational wine book, with wineries grouped into their respective regions. It is my hope that this book will inform and entertain not just oenophiles but also those who are interested in Japan.
This will also be the very first English book on Japanese wines in the world of wine books! Your funds will help create a little history.
Book specifications: 13.97cm X 21.59cm, soft cover, approx. 200 pages* with text and full colour photographs.

The next five months will be spent transcribing hundreds of hours of interviews and writing the book. I will be self-publishing this book via Amazon’s CreateSpace publishing service. CreateSpace prints on demand, a method that keeps their printing costs low.
This book will be published by April or May 2017.**

*The number of pages is an estimation and may change once the content has been edited and finalised.
** Any change to the date of publication will be highlighted here and on the book's complementary Facebook page.

What will your funding cover?
Funds received for this campaign would go towards covering:

1) The costs already incurred for the hiring of translators and the accommodation arranged for translators during the trip. (Approx. US$3,180 (S$4,400) was spent on their services and accommodation. This figure does not include their meals).
2) The costs already incurred for my flights, accommodation and intercity rail transport during the two-month trip. (Approx. US$5,280 (S$7,300) was spent. This figure does not include my meals).
3) Production costs for the book such as design and image editing services. (Approx. budget of US$1,600 (S$2,300) )

I am looking forward to your support. Thank you! If you can't fund or back any of the perks, please share this page with friends whom you think would be interested. Please visit the Facebook page of my book! http://fb.me/journeyintojapanesewine

I would also like to thank Orihara Shoten, a Japanese wine &
column2: spirits importer and bar in Singapore, for supplying the wines for my perks. Arigatou gozaimasu!

column1: Note: Because of the complicated nature of shipping booze to other countries, the Read and Sip combo perks (book+ bottle of wine) will only be delivered to addresses in Singapore.

It is my hope that this book will inform and entertain not just oenophiles but also those who are interested in Japan.
This will also be the very first English book on Japanese wines in the world of wine books! Your funds will help create a little history.
Book specifications: 13.97cm X 21.59cm, soft cover, approx. 200 pages* with text and full colour photographs.

The next five months will be spent transcribing hundreds of hours of interviews and writing the book. I will be self-publishing this book via Amazon’s CreateSpace publishing service. CreateSpace prints on demand, a method that keeps their printing costs low.
This book will be published by April or May 2017.**

*The number of pages is an estimation and may change once the content has been edited and finalised.** Any change to the date of publication will be highlighted here and on the book's complementary Facebook page.
What will your funding cover?Funds received for this campaign would go towards covering:

1) The costs already incurred for the hiring of translators and the accommodation arranged for translators during the trip. (Approx. US$3,180 (S$4,400) was spent on their services and accommodation. This figure does not include their meals).
2) The costs already incurred for my flights, accommodation and intercity rail transport during the two-month trip. (Approx. US$5,280 (S$7,300) was spent. This figure does not include my meals).
3) Production costs for the book such as design and image editing services. (Approx. budget of US$1,600 (S$2,300) )

I am looking forward to your support. Thank you! If you can't fund or back any of the perks, please share this page with friends whom you think would be interested. Please visit the Facebook page of my book! http://fb.me/journeyintojapanesewineI would also like to thank Orihara Shoten, a Japanese wine & spirits importer and bar in Singapore, for supplying the wines for my perks. Arigatou gozaimasu!
Note: Because of the complicated nature of shipping booze to other countries, the Read and Sip combo perks (book+ bottle of wine) will only be delivered to addresses in Singapore.",2.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Singapore, Singapore",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/a-journey-into-japanese-wine/pica

column6: >We are inviting you to
column10: >the Mongolian Young Leaders Program

column5: >Challenges and Opportunities in the Electric Power Industry in Mongolia
column8:
> 

About MYLP

Mongolian Young Leader Program (MYLP) was founded with a mission to provide opportunities for Mongolian students &
column9:
professionals to meet and network with one another, exchange their views on present and future issues concerning the prosperity of Mongolia.

Since its establishment in 2009, MYLP has grown to be one of the most influential networks for young Mongolian leaders educated in top universities all over the world and employed in corporations globally.

Ultimately, this program motivates them to become the Future Leaders of the country in diverse fields and join a network of 100+ young professionals all across the globe.

 

 

 2015 Program Participants at Facebook HQ, Menlo Park CA

 

MYLP Chicago 2017

This year's program in Chicago will bring together 15-20 distinguished Mongolian young leaders from diverse academic and professional backgrounds to discuss the challenges and opportunities facing Mongolia in becoming a regional energy player and lifting the living standards of the population.

 

During our program, participants will:

column1: <li>Visit iconic landmarks &amp
column2: institutions such as the University of Chicago or the CME

column1: • Network with other young Mongolian leaders and renowned keynote speakers
• Pitch their group presentations for a chance to secure a seed fund for their project which will launch within a year

How You Can Support Our Mission  

We are providing for the incidentals during the two days of the program, including food, hotel accommodation, and transportation. In order to cover these costs, we are asking for your support. We depend on funding from our sponsors to connect promising Mongolian young leaders all around the world. 

Partnering with our Network is a great way for private companies and organizations to create a positive public image and demonstrate corporate social responsibility. Most important of all, your support is a direct investment towards future leaders of Mongolia and an indirect investment towards the development of Mongolia.

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div>
(En español más abajo , detrás del texto en inglés)
Hi! My name is Jose Ramón Espinosa Muñoz.

More than 10 years ago, when I was a music language teacher, I noticed that something was changing in the students.  The old ways of teaching music no longer worked. They needed a more imaginative side: To live the musical language with more passion . For that reason, I remembered the old Pythian Games and decided to adapt the musical contents to athletic tests.
Everything was class games, paper results and chocolate medals.My work was exciting again  . A few days ago, talking to an old student, he told me that he missed the time. I do also.

This project, Solfegic Games, will be the natural evolution of that old project:  More music teachers involved, more realism with a 3D gaming platform,  more passion with an international competition of musical language students.  Will you join us?
<div>
<div>
<div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/V69Fs3doeKU?autohide=1&amp

This project is designed by music teachers and can be used only by students of those teachers and music schools that collaborate with Solfegic Games. It will not be a platform open to everybody. There are many ways to collaborate with the project (translations, adapting methodologies, sharing content and others.) but the most important one right now is to collaborate in this crowdfunding campaign.
Rescuing cherubim...

Solfegic Games wants to be a fair project and to give greater capacity of decision in the project to those who collaborate more. For this we have invented a ""measure"" of collaboration: The Cherubim (Q). And why the Cherubin? Because ""Solfegic Games intends to save from the Solfeggio Purgatory to all those cherubim who have suffered their torment for centuries"" (That's a joke that circulates among collaborators) The more Q's,  the more decisions can be influenced. That's why we added Q's to each perk.
Let's go deeper into the project
2018 Solfegic Games
...will be the first annual competition among students of musical language.
The final phase will take place in July 2018, but starting April of that same year classification tests will be carried out, first in the music schools and later in each country or zone.
<div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/Rjzosas91fQ?autohide=1&amp
Thanks to the 3D gaming platform, participants will not have to be physically together. From the ""cloud"", they will be able to compete from very far away as if they were next to each other.
We want this event to be a music festival, with streaming connections with all participants, awards ceremony, etc. Our students deserve it after so much effort.
The 3D gaming platform
Solfegic Games is also a 3D gaming platform that makes music language classes more fun as well as supporting teachers.  This platform also serves as the referee in the annual competitions.
Being a 3D gaming platform, we wanted the musical teaching to look like a video game. Here is an example of reading a simple music staff:

Other musical contents that we already have adapted to Solfegic games are ""reading music with accents"" (100 metres hurdles ), ""reading music in Bass Clef"" (Swimming), or ""intonation of intervals"" (Archery), like this example:
<div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/9Cy819gQPi0?autohide=1&amp

The realism of the graphics will be improved, also the power and its adaptation to all the existing devices. But all these is the goal of phases 2 and 3 of the project (Phases for which we ask for help in this campaign).
In addition, Solfegic Games is also a support platform for teachers. The student plays, but the teacher obtains quantitative results of that game. Here are some examples of these features:
<div>
Features for students
<div>
<div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/SD4gcUSFWek?autohide=1&amp
Features for parents
<div>
<div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/Hn5VRwj7iW0?autohide=1&amp
Features for teachers
Contact with parents
<div>
<div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/tBDWs3C24gQ?autohide=1&amp
Competitions
<div>
<div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/3uwm-xkFlzU?autohide=1&amp
Course Editor
<div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/jE3PnvgBwhU?autohide=1&amp
The Team
<div>

The team that forms Solfegic Games grows every day because, being a collaborative project, everyone interested in music education has a voice in it. There are currently people from more than 25 countries involved in one way or another. For the moment, and to make the first project decisions easier, we have differentiated the initial collaborators from those who are joining each day.
All those who collaborate in this campaign will become collaborators and therefore will have decision capacity in the future afairs about Solfegic Games. The project will grow with all of us.
Initial colaborators
Jose Ramón Espinosa Muñoz
<div>
Founder of Solfegic Games. Classic Guitar and Musical Language Teacher. Programmer and videogame designer.
<div>
Marco DiRenzo
<div>
Solfegic Games collaborator: Piano, flute and sax teacher. 3D designer
<div>
Verónica Martinez Quismondo
<div>
Solfegic Games collaborator: Web management, social networks.
<div>
Other collaborators:
Miguel García Ferrer: Concert guitar and teacher. Pedagogical consultant.
Lucía del Saz: Classic Guitar. Translation.
(We would like you to write your name below this line. Collaborate!)
<ul>
•
•
•
•
•
What we need.

This campaign is a Flexible goal campaign.  This means that, even if we do not reach the proposed objective, we will use the proceeds for the project. The difference will be in the time it will take to complete it. Higher amount collected, less time. Less amount collected, more time. As explained in the following video:
<div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/xIDUXqDSfcI?autohide=1&amp
The campaign budget has been divided in two. 65% for the conclusion of the platform and 35% for the celebration of the 2018 Solfegic Games.
<div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/A8v5vexWlwY?autohide=1&amp
If you can not see the budget clearly, you can see it directly on Youtube through this link:
https://youtu.be/A8v5vexWlwY
Risks and challenges

column3: '>Everything in our world is being digitized at high speed. But that does not ensure quality in human activities. This project tries to modernize the strategies of musical learning, to carry it as we know it to the next decade.
'>Look at this link and you understand it:    https://youtu.be/AJQdQgI1EC0

column1: <div>
<div><div>
Other ways to collaborate with Solfegic Games
There are many other ways to be part of this great family that is Solfegic Games. The main thing is to share this campaign. Use the tools provided by IndieGogo.
Thanks in advance.
Hola, mi nombre es Jose Ramón Espinosa Muñoz.

Hace más de 10 años, cuando era profesor de Lenguaje Musical, advertí que algo estaba cambiando en los alumnos. Las viejas formas de enseñar música no funcionaban. Se necesitaba un lado más imaginativo. Por eso, recordando los antiguos Juegos Píticos, decidí adaptar los contenidos musicales a pruebas atléticas como si fuera una olimpiada.
Todo eran juegos de clase, clasificaciones en papel, medallas de chocolate, etc. Hace unos días, hablando con un antiguo alumno, me dijo que echaba de menos esos años. Yo también.

Este proyecto Solfegic Games será la evolución natural de aquel antiguo proyecto: Más profesores de música implicados, más realismo con una plataforma de juego 3D, más ilusión gracias a una competición internacional de carácter anual. ¿Te unes a nosotros?
<div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/u5nBb9aezO8?autohide=1&amp

Este proyecto está diseñado por profesores de música y puede ser usado sólo por estudiantes de aquellos profesores o escuelas de música que colaboran con Solfegic Games. No será una plataforma abierta a todo el mundo. Hay muchas formas de colaborar con el proyecto (traducciones, adaptación de metodologías, compartir contenidos de Solfegic Games, etc.) pero la más importante ahora es colaborar en esta campaña de crowdfunding.
Salvando querubines...

Solfegic Games quiere ser un proyecto justo y dotar de mayor capacidad de decisión en el proyecto a aquellos que más colaboran. Para ello hemos inventado una ""medida"" de la colaboración: El Querubín (Q). ¿Y por qué el Querubin? Porque ""Solfegic Games pretende salvar del purgatorio del Solfeo a todos aquellos querubines que sufren su tormento desde hace siglos"" (Es un chiste que circula entre los colaboradores a raíz de una de las promos que hay al principio de esta Historia) A más Q, en más decisiones se puede influir. Por eso hemos añadido las Q en cada recompensa.
<div>
Vamos a profundizar en el proyecto
Solfegic Games 2018
Será la primera competición anual entre alumnos de Lenguaje Musical.

La fase final tendrá lugar en Julio de 2018, pero dese Abril de ese mismo año, se irán celebrando las pruebas de clasificación, primero en las escuelas de música y después en cada país o zona geográfica.
<div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/lpKklPhjd6g?autohide=1&amp
<div>
Gracias a la plataforma de juego 3D, los participantes no tendrán que estar físicamente juntos. Desde la nube, serán capaces de competir a gran distancia como si estuvieran juntos.

Queremos que este evento sea una fiesta de la música, con conexiones en directo via streaming con los participantes, ceremonia de entrega de premios, etc. Nuestros alumnos se lo merecen después de tanto esfuerzo.
La plataforma de juego  3D

Solfegic Games es también una plataforma de juego 3D que hace que las classe de Lenguaje Musical sean más divertidas y también de apoyo en la docencia a los profesores. Esta plataforma  también sirve como árbitro en las competiciones anuales.
<div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/POhBG1fPexU?autohide=1&amp
Siendo como es una plataforma de juego 3D, queríamos que la enseñanza musical se pareciera a un videojuego.  He aquí un ejemplo de Lectura de un pentagrama sencillo.
<div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/CwKE9679Srk?autohide=1&amp

Otros contenidos musicales ya adaptados a Solfegic GamesOther son ""Lectura con acentos"" (100 metros vallas) ""Lectura en clave de Fa en 4ª"" (Natación) o ""Entonación de intervalos"" (Tiro con arco) , como en este ejemplo:
<div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/04exf7MnUBA?autohide=1&amp

El realismo de los gráficos puede ser mejorado, así como la potencia y su adaptación a todos los dispositivos existentes. Pero todo esto es el objetivo de las fases 2 y 3 del proyecto. (Fases por las que os pedimos ayuda en esta campaña)

Además, Solfegic Games es también una plataforma de apoyo para docentes. El alumno juega, pero el profesor recibe resultados cuantitativos de ese juego. Aquí algunos ejemplos de esas capacidades operativas de la plataforma.
<div>
Operativa para alumnos
<div>
<div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/i3-njLubXPY?autohide=1&amp
Operativa para padres
<div>
<div>
<div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/Q1NjpabNNNg?autohide=1&amp
Operativa para profesores
Alumnos y contacto con los padres
<div>
<div>
<div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/gR1BbI67hy0?autohide=1&amp
Competiciones
<div>
<div>
<div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/XgEHftIVNsc?autohide=1&amp
Editor de cursos
<div>
<div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/WKZDu0zpWRQ?autohide=1&amp
El equipo
<div>

El equipo que forma Solfegic Games se incrementa cada dia porque, siendo un proyecto colaborativo, cualquier interesado en la educación musical tiene voz en él. Hay actualemente gente de más de 25 paises involucrados de una u otra manera. Por el momento, y para hacer más sencilla las primeras decisiones del proyecto, hemos diferenciado entre colaboradores iniciales y los que se están uniendo cada día.
Todos los que colaboren con esta campaña, serán colaboradores del proyecto y tendrán capacidad de decisión en futuras cuestiones sobre Solfegic Games. El proyecto crecerá con todos nosotros.
Colaboradores iniciales
Jose Ramón Espinosa Muñoz
Fundador y creador de Solfegic Games. Profesor de Guitarra Clásica y Lenguaje Musical. Programador y diseñador de Videojuegos.
<div>
Marco DiRenzo
Colaborador de Solfegic Games. Profesor de Piano, Flauta travesera y Saxofón. Diseñador de objetos 3D.
<div>
Verónica Martinez Quismondo
Colaboradora de Solfegic Games. Gestión web, redes sociales y comunicación.
<div>
Otros colaboradores:
Miguel García Ferrer: Concertista, Profesor de Guitarra Clásica. Consultoría pedagógica.
Lucía del Saz: Guitarra clásica. Traducción.
(Nos gustaría que escribieras tu nombre debajo de esta línea. Colabora!)
<ul>
•
•
•
•
•
Qué necesitamos.

Esta campaña es una campaña de meta flexible.  Esto significa que aunque no alcancemos el objetivo propuesto, usaremos lo recaudado para el proyecto. La diferencia radicará en el tiempo que nos llevará terminarla. A mayor cantidad recaudada, menos tiempo. A menor cantidad recaudada, más tiempo.  En este video se explica mejor.
<div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/JPgWguW1LUM?autohide=1&amp
El presupuesto de la campaña ha sido dividido en dos.  Un 65% para la conclusión de la plataforma y un 35% para la celebración de los Solfegic Games 2018.
<div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/-5K9PWIt_to?autohide=1&amp
Si no puedes ver con claridad el presupuesto, puedes verlo directamente en Youtube a través de este enlace:
<div>
https://youtu.be/-5K9PWIt_to
Riesgos y desafíos.

column3: '>Todo está siendo digitalizado a gran velocidad. Pero esto no asegura la calidad en las actividades humanas. Por ello, este proyecto intenta modernizar las estrategias del apredizaje musical, para llevarla tal y como la conocemos al siglo XXII.

column1: <div>
<div><div>
<div><span style='font-family: ""Benton Sans"", Helvetica, sans-serif
<div><div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/sdtmXVvKCTo?autohide=1&amp
Otras formas de colaborar con Solfegic Games
<div>
Hay muchas formas de ser parte de esta gran familia que es Solfegic Games. La principal es compartir esta campaña usando las herramientas que dispone Indiegogo.
Muchas gracias por adelantado..

We want this event to be a music festival, with streaming connections with all participants, awards ceremony, etc. Our students deserve it after so much effort.
The 3D gaming platform
Solfegic Games is also a 3D gaming platform that makes music language classes more fun as well as supporting teachers.  This platform also serves as the referee in the annual competitions.
Being a 3D gaming platform, we wanted the musical teaching to look like a video game. Here is an example of reading a simple music staff:

Other musical contents that we already have adapted to Solfegic games are ""reading music with accents"" (100 metres hurdles ), ""reading music in Bass Clef"" (Swimming), or ""intonation of intervals"" (Archery), like this example:

The realism of the graphics will be improved, also the power and its adaptation to all the existing devices. But all these is the goal of phases 2 and 3 of the project (Phases for which we ask for help in this campaign).
In addition, Solfegic Games is also a support platform for teachers. The student plays, but the teacher obtains quantitative results of that game. Here are some examples of these features:
Features for students
Features for parents
Features for teachers
Contact with parents
Competitions
Course Editor
The Team

The team that forms Solfegic Games grows every day because, being a collaborative project, everyone interested in music education has a voice in it. There are currently people from more than 25 countries involved in one way or another. For the moment, and to make the first project decisions easier, we have differentiated the initial collaborators from those who are joining each day.
All those who collaborate in this campaign will become collaborators and therefore will have decision capacity in the future afairs about Solfegic Games. The project will grow with all of us.
Initial colaborators
Jose Ramón Espinosa Muñoz
Founder of Solfegic Games. Classic Guitar and Musical Language Teacher. Programmer and videogame designer.
Marco DiRenzo
Solfegic Games collaborator: Piano, flute and sax teacher. 3D designer
Verónica Martinez Quismondo
Solfegic Games collaborator: Web management, social networks.
Other collaborators:
Miguel García Ferrer: Concert guitar and teacher. Pedagogical consultant.
Lucía del Saz: Classic Guitar. Translation.
(We would like you to write your name below this line. Collaborate!)
What we need.

This campaign is a Flexible goal campaign.  This means that, even if we do not reach the proposed objective, we will use the proceeds for the project. The difference will be in the time it will take to complete it. Higher amount collected, less time. Less amount collected, more time. As explained in the following video:
The campaign budget has been divided in two. 65% for the conclusion of the platform and 35% for the celebration of the 2018 Solfegic Games.
If you can not see the budget clearly, you can see it directly on Youtube through this link:
https://youtu.be/A8v5vexWlwY
Risks and challenges

Everything in our world is being digitized at high speed. But that does not ensure quality in human activities. This project tries to modernize the strategies of musical learning, to carry it as we know it to the next decade.
Look at this link and you understand it:    https://youtu.be/AJQdQgI1EC0
Other ways to collaborate with Solfegic Games
There are many other ways to be part of this great family that is Solfegic Games. The main thing is to share this campaign. Use the tools provided by IndieGogo.
Thanks in advance.
Hola, mi nombre es Jose Ramón Espinosa Muñoz.

Hace más de 10 años, cuando era profesor de Lenguaje Musical, advertí que algo estaba cambiando en los alumnos. Las viejas formas de enseñar música no funcionaban. Se necesitaba un lado más imaginativo. Por eso, recordando los antiguos Juegos Píticos, decidí adaptar los contenidos musicales a pruebas atléticas como si fuera una olimpiada.
Todo eran juegos de clase, clasificaciones en papel, medallas de chocolate, etc. Hace unos días, hablando con un antiguo alumno, me dijo que echaba de menos esos años. Yo también.

Este proyecto Solfegic Games será la evolución natural de aquel antiguo proyecto: Más profesores de música implicados, más realismo con una plataforma de juego 3D, más ilusión gracias a una competición internacional de carácter anual. ¿Te unes a nosotros?

Este proyecto está diseñado por profesores de música y puede ser usado sólo por estudiantes de aquellos profesores o escuelas de música que colaboran con Solfegic Games. No será una plataforma abierta a todo el mundo. Hay muchas formas de colaborar con el proyecto (traducciones, adaptación de metodologías, compartir contenidos de Solfegic Games, etc.) pero la más importante ahora es colaborar en esta campaña de crowdfunding.
Salvando querubines...

Solfegic Games quiere ser un proyecto justo y dotar de mayor capacidad de decisión en el proyecto a aquellos que más colaboran. Para ello hemos inventado una ""medida"" de la colaboración: El Querubín (Q). ¿Y por qué el Querubin? Porque ""Solfegic Games pretende salvar del purgatorio del Solfeo a todos aquellos querubines que sufren su tormento desde hace siglos"" (Es un chiste que circula entre los colaboradores a raíz de una de las promos que hay al principio de esta Historia) A más Q, en más decisiones se puede influir. Por eso hemos añadido las Q en cada recompensa.
Vamos a profundizar en el proyecto
Solfegic Games 2018
Será la primera competición anual entre alumnos de Lenguaje Musical.

La fase final tendrá lugar en Julio de 2018, pero dese Abril de ese mismo año, se irán celebrando las pruebas de clasificación, primero en las escuelas de música y después en cada país o zona geográfica.
Gracias a la plataforma de juego 3D, los participantes no tendrán que estar físicamente juntos. Desde la nube, serán capaces de competir a gran distancia como si estuvieran juntos.

Queremos que este evento sea una fiesta de la música, con conexiones en directo via streaming con los participantes, ceremonia de entrega de premios, etc. Nuestros alumnos se lo merecen después de tanto esfuerzo.
La plataforma de juego  3D

Solfegic Games es también una plataforma de juego 3D que hace que las classe de Lenguaje Musical sean más divertidas y también de apoyo en la docencia a los profesores. Esta plataforma  también sirve como árbitro en las competiciones anuales.
Siendo como es una plataforma de juego 3D, queríamos que la enseñanza musical se pareciera a un videojuego.  He aquí un ejemplo de Lectura de un pentagrama sencillo.

Otros contenidos musicales ya adaptados a Solfegic GamesOther son ""Lectura con acentos"" (100 metros vallas) ""Lectura en clave de Fa en 4ª"" (Natación) o ""Entonación de intervalos"" (Tiro con arco) , como en este ejemplo:

El realismo de los gráficos puede ser mejorado, así como la potencia y su adaptación a todos los dispositivos existentes. Pero todo esto es el objetivo de las fases 2 y 3 del proyecto. (Fases por las que os pedimos ayuda en esta campaña)

Además, Solfegic Games es también una plataforma de apoyo para docentes. El alumno juega, pero el profesor recibe resultados cuantitativos de ese juego. Aquí algunos ejemplos de esas capacidades operativas de la plataforma.
Operativa para alumnos
Operativa para padres
Operativa para profesores
Alumnos y contacto con los padres
Competiciones
Editor de cursos
El equipo

El equipo que forma Solfegic Games se incrementa cada dia porque, siendo un proyecto colaborativo, cualquier interesado en la educación musical tiene voz en él. Hay actualemente gente de más de 25 paises involucrados de una u otra manera. Por el momento, y para hacer más sencilla las primeras decisiones del proyecto, hemos diferenciado entre colaboradores iniciales y los que se están uniendo cada día.
Todos los que colaboren con esta campaña, serán colaboradores del proyecto y tendrán capacidad de decisión en futuras cuestiones sobre Solfegic Games. El proyecto crecerá con todos nosotros.
Colaboradores iniciales
Jose Ramón Espinosa Muñoz
Fundador y creador de Solfegic Games. Profesor de Guitarra Clásica y Lenguaje Musical. Programador y diseñador de Videojuegos.
Marco DiRenzo
Colaborador de Solfegic Games. Profesor de Piano, Flauta travesera y Saxofón. Diseñador de objetos 3D.
Verónica Martinez Quismondo
Colaboradora de Solfegic Games. Gestión web, redes sociales y comunicación.
Otros colaboradores:
Miguel García Ferrer: Concertista, Profesor de Guitarra Clásica. Consultoría pedagógica.
Lucía del Saz: Guitarra clásica. Traducción.
(Nos gustaría que escribieras tu nombre debajo de esta línea. Colabora!)
Qué necesitamos.

Esta campaña es una campaña de meta flexible.  Esto significa que aunque no alcancemos el objetivo propuesto, usaremos lo recaudado para el proyecto. La diferencia radicará en el tiempo que nos llevará terminarla. A mayor cantidad recaudada, menos tiempo. A menor cantidad recaudada, más tiempo.  En este video se explica mejor.
El presupuesto de la campaña ha sido dividido en dos.  Un 65% para la conclusión de la plataforma y un 35% para la celebración de los Solfegic Games 2018.
Si no puedes ver con claridad el presupuesto, puedes verlo directamente en Youtube a través de este enlace:
https://youtu.be/-5K9PWIt_to
Riesgos y desafíos.

Todo está siendo digitalizado a gran velocidad. Pero esto no asegura la calidad en las actividades humanas. Por ello, este proyecto intenta modernizar las estrategias del apredizaje musical, para llevarla tal y como la conocemos al siglo XXII.
Mira este video y lo comprenderás:
Otras formas de colaborar con Solfegic Games
Hay muchas formas de ser parte de esta gran familia que es Solfegic Games. La principal es compartir esta campaña usando las herramientas que dispone Indiegogo.

Now it’s time again for the White Busses.

But this time, we go by sea.
Svensk översättning längre ner på sidan.
By the end of WWII many courageous and
fantastic efforts were carried out to help people. Not just those who were
directly fleeing but also those caught in an impossible and unliveable
situation. The White Busses from Sweden became world renowned for giving people
a speedy and safe transportation to safety from the hell of the Nazi
concentration camps. It was a government initiative, carried out by the Red
Cross. Because of it, thousands of people’s lives could be saved.
Today, not such government initiative
exists. That is why we are forced to fundraise.
The White Boats will do for refugees what
the White Busses did 70 years ago.<span>  While
authorities and politicians remain passive, private individuals and
organisations are forced to take matters into our own hands to help those
forced to flee from war and political violence. We have started this
fundraising effort to arrange a direct sea route with the Eastern Mediterranean
because neither Sweden nor the EU are currently standing up for refugee rights.
From safe places in Europe, we aim to go
via sea with humanitarian supplies and personnel to those organisations and
people in Greece in acute need of food, healthcare and shelter.
On our way back we will bring Syrian
refugees standed outside the EUs outer border back with us to Sweden to seek
asylum.
For more information please check our site:
www.whiteships.org
NOTE: The collection will not be halted
after 30 days.
We have budgeted a cost of 1 million
Swedish Krona ( US$ 120,000) to procure a vessel for the first journey. The
ambition is to continue for as long as it takes until the EU change their
border policies and allow safe routes for refugees into Europe. Therefore the
fundraising will continue even after the first 30 days have passed. It is
Indiegogo’s own rules that force us to set an initial time limit.
If we failed to reach our fundraising goals
or if for whatever reason the project becomes unnecessary,
all funds raised will be donated to UN organisations working in refugee camps in
Lebanon. Lebanon, which has 4.5 million inhabitants, has taken roughly 2
million refugees since the war in Syria started.
This project is completely volunteer run
and no one involved will claim a salary with raised funds. We are an initiative

of private citizens from Sweden with the support of Refugees Welcome Sweden.
___________________________________________________________________________

Andra sätt att bidra
Bankgiro: 5042-9166 (Uppdaterat saldo: 6200 SEK)
Nu är det
dags för De Vita Bussarna igen. Men vi får ta sjövägen.
Vid 2:a
världskrigets slutskede utförde många en fantastisk insats för att hjälpa
människor, inte bara de som direkt var på flykt utan även dem, som av olika
skäl satt fast i en omöjlig situation. De Vita Bussarna blev världsberömda
genom att ge människor en rask och säker transport till räddningen från
koncentrationslägrens helvete. Det var ett regeringsinitiativ, som förmedlades
genom Röda Korset. Tusentals människors liv kunde därmed räddas.
Idag finns inte något sådant initiativ från vår regering.
De Vita
Båtarna ska göra det för flyktingar som De Vita Bussarna gjorde för 70 år
sedan. När beslutsfattare är passiva, tvingas privatpersoner ta saken i egna
händer för att hjälpa dem som tvingats fly från krig och politiskt våld. Vi
startar nu en insamling för att ordna direkt sjöförbindelse med östra
Medelhavet därför att varken Sverige eller EU står upp för flyktingar i
dagsläget.
Från säkra
platser i Europa ska fartyg gå med förnödenheter och personal till de människor
och organisationer i Grekland som är i akut behov av mat, värme, sjukvård och
skydd.
På vägen
tillbaka tar vi med syriska flyktingar som avser att söka asyl i Sverige, men
som idag är strandsatta utanför EU:s yttre gräns.

För mer info: www.vitabatarna.se

OBS! Insamlingen kommer inte att avbrytas efter 30 dagar.
Vi har budgeterat med en kostnad av 1 miljon kronor för att köpa eller chartra
ett fartyg till den första färden. Ambitionen är dock att fortsätta så länge
det behövs och därför kommer insamlingen att fortsätta även efter att de första
30 dagarna har passerat. Det är insamlingsplattformen Indiegogos regler som gör
att vi måste sätta en initial tidsgräns.

Om vi misslyckas med att nå våra insamlingsmål eller om projektet av någon anledning blir onödigt, kommer alla kvarvarande medel som donerats, att skänkas till FN-organisationer som arbetar i flyktingläger i Libanon. Libanon, som har 4,5 miljoner invånare, har tagit cirka 2 miljoner flyktingar sedan kriget i Syrien började.

Detta projekt drivs helt på volontärsbasis. Inga inblandade i projektet kommer att få betalt för sin medverkan genom insamlade medel.
Vi är ett initiativ av privatpersoner med stöd av Refugees Welcome Sweden.

Changing the World, One Bite at a Time
Childhood
obesity has more than doubled in the past 30 years, with more than one-third of
all children are overweight or obese. Americans are not cooking and eating
together, both of which are vital components in resolving obesity, hunger and
poor nutrition and establishing good health and good habits.
ChopChop, The Fun Cooking Magazine for Families is changing the world one bite at a time. A
non-profit, our mission is to inspire and teach kids to cook real food with
their families. And we’re succeeding:

will provide a place for local kids to build confidence and life-long skills. A
kitchen where we can teach cooking classes to kids and workshops to adults. A
place where we can nurture a culture of health and wellness.

A 50-cent dinner to them is a luxury. Let’s change that

To many people, the thought of a decent 50-cent dinner is impossible. To a few underprivileged families, the reality of a regular 50-cent dinner is also impossible but for very different reasons.

Meet Saidi and Alfino

Saidi, 13, and Alfino, 12, are just two of the beneficiaries of Stag Match* Student Care Centre’s MSF subsidized scheme created to support children coming from families experiencing financial difficulties. Apart from heavily subsidized student care, the program also provides subsidized meals costing only 50 cents.

However, both Saidi and Alfino can’t even afford the subsidized meals due to more pressing problems at home.

Saidi is left to the care of his grandmother due to special family circumstances. Saidi’s grandma, the sole breadwinner, works as a cleaner and supports not only Saidi but also his cousin who’s still in school and uncle who’s unfit to work. The tight budget of the family can’t afford to regularly cover Saidi’s dinner.

Similar to Saidi, Alfino also misses most of his meals. Alfino’s parents are too busy juggling between making ends meet for the family – although barely – and taking care of his handicapped brother and other younger siblings. According to Stag Match staff, Alfino is a very good boy and always makes full use of his time in the student care centre to ask questions and clarify on subjects he has problems with.

How can you help?

We are working with Stag Match* to raise S$132 for each of them, a total of S$264 (US$ 190) which will contribute to one (1) year’s worth of meal allowances for Saidi and Alfino. 

S$132 might be a small sum for many but it can make a lot of difference in both Saidi and Alfino’s quality of life for a year. With better nutrition and love from you and me, we can help bring these boys closer to their dreams.

There are many students like Saidi and Alfino, for every additional S$132 raised, we'll support another student one year worth of meal allowances. 

*www.CutOffPoint.SG has been granted permission from Saidi and Alfino’s families to tell their stories and to raise fund for them. US$190 of the funds raised from Indiegogo will be handed over to them when the Campaign target is met. The remaining amount after Indiegogo service charge and payment gateway service charges
column2:
will be donated to other students one year worth of meal allowance. All monetary issues will be communicated to Saidi and Alfino’s families with full transparency.

Imagine an 11th grade science classroom ...

On the laboratory tables, instead of beakers and Bunsen burners, there are cutting boards and induction cooktops. Students huddle in groups of three, chopping, mixing, tasting and discussing the best method for preparing carrot top pesto as part of their unit on food waste. The classroom is a purposeful buzz as carrot tops fly. Food journals are being filled with sketches and notes. The instructor floats from group to group, answering questions, making occasional suggestions, and reminding students to reflect in their journals in preparation for their culminating Mindful Meal project. The students hurry to complete their pesto before settling down for a long-distance chat over Skype with a farmer or chef about food waste and culinary creativity.
About Mobile Kitchen Classroom

A program of Stone Barns Center for Food and Agriculture in collaboration with SHFT, Mobile Kitchen Classroom empowers a generation of Food Citizens – individuals who understand that their food choices have a meaningful impact and are empowered to advocate for change. Mobile Kitchen Classroom engages high school students, who are soon to be independent decision makers, by making connections between food and issues that they care about – culture, power, the environment. Hands-on cooking lessons connect ingredients to ideas and give students the skills they need to prepare fresh farm-driven food. Students who have participated in Mobile Kitchen Classroom find themselves transformed from passive consumers to confident and activated Food Citizens – the program is life changing.
<div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe class=""embedly-embed"" height=""326"" src=""https://cdn.embedly.com/widgets/media.html?src=https%3A%2F%2Fplayer.vimeo.com%2Fvideo%2F147361034&amp
What You're Funding

Your donation today will be doubled! Thanks to a generous donor, campaign contributions will be matched up to $50,000! Give today and know that your support will go even farther to help fund this exceptional program!

This winter and spring, Mobile Kitchen Classroom is expanding to three additional high schools in New York City and your funds will directly benefit those programs — providing fresh ingredients, high quality instruction, and both virtual and in-person field trips.

With your help, we can reach hundreds more students in New York City schools by putting ingredients and equipment on a specially designed truck (which we are in the process of designing) and bringing cooking lessons and curriculum to more classrooms.

Beyond New York, Mobile Kitchen Classroom has the power to virtually engage hundreds of thousands of students. Through online teacher training, downloadable lessons and resources, and virtual field trips, our hope is to take the Mobile Kitchen Classroom curriculum national. Your funding will support our efforts to build scalable, digital classrooms that can help transform a generation of eaters into active Food Citizens.
Other Ways to Support Our Mission

We appreciate all forms of support so if you can't donate financially help us by donating your voice! Share our campaign link with the person who taught you how to cook or who leads by example in the kitchen.

Thanks for helping us grow!

column4:
Agriculture

Stone Barns Center for Food and Agriculture is an innovative nonprofit organization working to change the way America eats and farms. Stone Barns is creating positive change in our food system by operating a catalytic on-farm laboratory for sustainable farming practices

column6: training farmers in resilient, restorative farming techniques

and educating children about the sources of their food.


About SHFT

SHFT is a lifestyle platform founded by film producer Peter Glatzer and actor-filmmaker Adrian Grenier. Their mission is to convey a more sustainable approach to the way we live through film, design, art and food.

About FAWEZA (Forum for African Women Educationalists - Zambia)

FAWEZA is a leading NGO in Zambia working to eliminate gender disparities at all levels of education, enabling women to participate in national development.

We believe that through education of women and girls, livelihoods are improved for entire communities and civic education and liberties are enhanced. Educated girls become educated women who have the knowledge, skills and opportunity to play a role in governance and democratic processes and to influence the direction of their societies.
We work hand-in-hand with communities, schools, civil society, Non-Governmental Organisations and ministries to achieve gender equity and equality in education through targeted programmes.
For more information please visit our facebook page or our FAWEZA page:
https://www.facebook.com/Forum-for-African-Wome...

http://www.fawe.org/region/southern/zambia/index.php

Girls Negotiation Skills Curriculum 

FAWEZA has partnered with Innovations for Poverty Action (IPA) (www.poverty-action.org) to implement Girls Arise! A Girl's Negotiation Skills Curriculum in four provinces in Zambia. We have trained teachers in over 200 schools in the past four months (since June 2015) to teach life skills and negotiation skills to students.
We encourage you to learn more about the Girls Arise! Curriculum through this NPR article that aired on October 8, 2015. 

http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2015/10/08/446237057/can-t-afford-school-girls-in-zambia-learn-to-negotiate-the-harvard-way-15girls

More information about the Girls Arise! curriculum and study can be found here:
http://www.poverty-action.org/study/negotiating-better-future-impact-teaching-negotiation-skills-girls-health-and-educational
Girls Endowment Fund

Contributions to this fund will enable us to continue helping vulnerable girls pursue their education. Not only will we be able to expand the girls negotiation skills curriculum, but we will also provide scholarships and bursaries for girls that want to attend school, buy books for school, and provide other necessary materials.
Since 2005 we have awarded over 57,000 scholarships for children from poor families by paying their schools fees and other education related costs at primary, upper basic, high school and college.

This is my daughter Layla, she is 7 years old. She suffers from Pustular Psoriasis, Psoriatic Arthritis, and severe Eczema. The combination of these three conditions in a child is incredibly rare and the symptoms are often extremely painful. She was diagnosed as an infant, and over the past 7 years she has been through many medical trial, and experimental medications. Many of which have caused more harm than good, but at the time we didn't know what else to do. We had some good experiences with certain medication that were able to give her a great quality of life for a little while. Unfortunately those medications have all stopped working. In the past 2 months we have tried the final medication know to help with these conditions and she has experienced major negative side effects, and has had 2 emergency surgeries to stabilize the effects. We have run out of medical option in the state of Texas at this time, However there is a clinical trial that she can participate in Colorado and is her last option for a better quality of life. We are desperate to raise enough financially to get our family relocated to get Layla this treatment. Please help us Help Layla!                


This project is sponsored by Green Cooperative on Resource Education (EIN 46-5317877).  All donations are tax-deductible under Internal Revenue Code 501(c)3.  Donors can deduct contributions made to this project under IRC Section 170.
