My name is Dino Costa, and for a 5 year period I hosted the most irreverent and opinionated, no holds barred, sports radio SHOW in America, over the airwaves of SiriusXM Radio. 

For further information please reference my website at: http://dinocostaradionetwork.com/index.aspx

My SHOW is scheduled to be re-broadcast starting on November 9, 2015 at the above website indicated.

This is truly a radical departure from the stats-quo, featuring a SHOW beholden to nobody but my audience across America and around the world. The SHOW is uncensored, and it comes equipped with an archived library allowing the consumer to play back previous SHOWS at anytime.

I have spent my own dollars in constructing a corporation, purchasing equipment, building a studio, and developing a website.

I am asking you to help me by contributing whatever is within your means -- in a benevolent fashion, and assisting me during this launch period, to insure that The SHOW not only gains a successful lift-off, but that The SHOW positions itself for sustained growth.

There is no question that this is a new media paradigm that will be listener supported through monthly subscription packages I am offering - as well as fundraisers such as this that I will debut a few times a year.

With the consistent application of The SHOW, it is my sincere hope that over time there will be no need for any kind of supplemental funding programs such as this one.

What people get with The DINO COSTA Show is a multi-pronged presentation that is not only not available anywhere on commercial or network channels...but it is also a SHOW that is quite frankly not allowed under the tenants of today's increasingly politically correct system that has scrubbed the industry clean of any programs that dare run counter to today's societal edicts.

The sports media in America is exclusively left of center. However, my SHOW, is an extreme exception to that rule.

This is sports radio done with serious push-back, I eschew all PC methodology, and I present a unique sports radio theater of the mind that promotes an unapologetic and non-negotiable, conservative-minded, ideology, that is simply not allowable under today's environment.
column5: >The SHOW features an extemporaneous delivery at all times, conversational in flavor, highly opinionated, and organic as it weaves its way through each 3 hour affair.
column9: >I am asking your help in achieving a form of sports media that will not be found anywhere else, fearless, independent, and without question belonging to, and answering to, nobody, with the exception of its loyal and passionate fan base.
column13:
>I thank you in advance for all of your consideration.

Kindest regards,
column17:
>Dino Costa

Short Summary

""Find what it is you're good at and do that."" We've all received and even given this advice before. The thing that I am very good at is explaining things. I can take a very complex concept and make it very easy to understand.

column5: >At the end of my college career, I came up with an idea that I needed to share with as many people as possible. Unfortunately, the idea described Everything and, as you'd imagine, it's hard to explain everything in a short amount of time. I thought to write a book but remembered how many people, like myself, are not verbal learners. Many of us need people to explain things and pictures to look at when learning new concepts: cue the 21st century! We now have the internet and a new medium for exchanging ideas
column6: this is how I will share my idea with you. Plus, the internet allows me to have videos within videos: videoception!

column1: The basics:

-Videos with speaker, visuals and word bank linking videos together in a web
-Ability to save videos for later, good for reference or marking your favorites
-Separate questions and comments sections for each video
-Concept map indicating efficient paths to follow in your exploration
Topics to be covered:

-The Big Bang and formation of all matter in the universe
-The formation of the stars, planets, galaxies and the elements
-The origin of life and how basic processes mixed with competition gave rise to all the life that has ever existed
-The specific events that led to our ancestors path toward building society
-The changes within the society that have accelerated progress (i.e. industrialization, internet, etc.)
You will also be able to gain insight into your body and brain as you will learn that both are just machines that work in an understandable way.
You'll be able to answer questions like:
-How do my muscles work?

-Why do we have emotions?
-How can we hear?
-Why can we think?

-Why do we like music?

-Why do we feel the need to argue?
-and many, many more (it's a Theory of Everything, after all

I could talk all day about this idea and never get sick of it. This is not an idea that I just want to share, I NEED to share it with you. I feel as though I'm sitting on some very ""hot"" information and I really have to pass it along to you. Every time I think about the theory, I forget everything else and my eyes grow wide with excitement! The only thing I can really compare the feeling to is being in love or high
column2: but the source of it is my thoughts alone!

column1: I believe that simply understanding where we come from and how your world works is enough to have this feeling and discover a plausible way to change your circumstances to improve your life. After all, if you understand your place within a system, you can alter your place

As you are probably aware, sometimes you have a thought that takes some time to put into words in order to communicate it. I'm the same way, only the thought I'm trying to put into words contains A LOT of information. I have already written scripts (or have verbal notes) for each of the >
column2: 140 videos that will be included in the website. Each of the term bubbles were examples of videos that will be in this series.

column1: If you watched the video, you might be able to tell that I created it using animations in PowerPoint and a screen recording program. It took a long time to create despite the short duration. The main purpose of the funding will be to speed up the process and improve the quality of the videos that will be on the website.

I have given the initial price of $10,000 as a rough estimate of how much I will need in order to make a fun and effective teaching tool. If, however, you decide to give more then the additional money will all go toward improved quality of the videos and website interface. (Nobody likes a clunky web platform!) I am currently working full time on this project so funding will also be used to support myself (food/rent).

This website will be specifically designed to be an educational exploration tool. The videos will be relatively short (6 min average) and the entire website will be entirely FREE to all users. Since I'm offering a free product, I don't have any goods to give you as perks, though I am happy to offer social media shout outs and a Contributor's Wall on the website with ranked names of how much each of you donated.
I have been doing this fully on my own for some time now so any suggestions for additional perks would be very appreciated. Also, feel free to ask any questions about the project
column2: I absolutely love talking about it in all contexts!

column1:
The Impact

In order to explain the impact I want to make, I'll need to first define a term:
Enlightenment - to be aware of your position within a greater context/system.

The context could be your friend group (are you the flustered one?), your workplace (maybe you always pick up the coffee), or your society (how do strangers see you?). In each of these scenarios, you are better able to navigate within the context when you know exactly what role you play.

column5: >This video series will inform you of the role you play within ALL contexts. You are made up of cells which perform specific functions to make you work. You are a member of the most intelligent species that has ever existed on our planet. You are made up of mostly carbon atoms and water and must eventually give that carbon back to the Earth. Just to name a few.
>In short, I want to enlighten the world. You are all capable of understanding the context and you are all curious enough to discover the role you play within all of it!

column1: Risks &
column2:
Challenges

I am currently working on writing scripts for the >
column3: 140 videos that will be featured within the website. I will be updating this campaign page frequently as I continue to make progress writing more scripts.

column1: The biggest challenge currently is time. Each of the scripts and videos have proven to take a huge amount of time and require me to delve into it full-time. If I am fully funded, I can hopefully be able to have the entire website ready for launch by April 2016!
I also have a spreadsheet listing my progress on the various sections. The spreadsheet only has the titles of sections but if that is of interest to you, I am happy to share it with you!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able or willing to make a monetary donation, all I ask is that you share the campaign with everyone you know, either by social media or in person. It is a theory of Everything, so I assume you know at least one person who is interested in some part of this.

Truly, word of mouth (and internet, by extension) is the most powerful tool when it comes to education. The purpose of this is the make a smarter world, one that knows the truth of how it works and where we come from. I am counting on your innate curiosity and generosity to make this a reality!
If you have any suggestions or questions, please don't hesitate to share your thoughts!

","Short Summary ""Find what it is you're good at and do that."" We've all received and even given this advice before. The thing that I am very good at is explaining things. I can take a very complex concept and make it very easy to understand.

At the end of my college career, I came up with an idea that I needed to share with as many people as possible. Unfortunately, the idea described Everything and, as you'd imagine, it's hard to explain everything in a short amount of time. I thought to write a book but remembered how many people, like myself, are not verbal learners. Many of us need people to explain things and pictures to look at when learning new concepts: cue the 21st century! We now have the internet and a new medium for exchanging ideas
column2: this is how I will share my idea with you. Plus, the internet allows me to have videos within videos: videoception!

column1: The basics:

-Videos with speaker, visuals and word bank linking videos together in a web-Ability to save videos for later, good for reference or marking your favorites-Separate questions and comments sections for each video-Concept map indicating efficient paths to follow in your exploration
Topics to be covered:

-The Big Bang and formation of all matter in the universe-The formation of the stars, planets, galaxies and the elements-The origin of life and how basic processes mixed with competition gave rise to all the life that has ever existed-The specific events that led to our ancestors path toward building society-The changes within the society that have accelerated progress (i.e. industrialization, internet, etc.)
You will also be able to gain insight into your body and brain as you will learn that both are just machines that work in an understandable way.
You'll be able to answer questions like:
-How do my muscles work?
-Why do we have emotions?-How can we hear?-Why can we think?
-Why do we like music?-Why do we feel the need to argue?-and many, many more (it's a Theory of Everything, after all

I could talk all day about this idea and never get sick of it. This is not an idea that I just want to share, I NEED to share it with you. I feel as though I'm sitting on some very ""hot"" information and I really have to pass it along to you. Every time I think about the theory, I forget everything else and my eyes grow wide with excitement! The only thing I can really compare the feeling to is being in love or high
column2: but the source of it is my thoughts alone!

column1: I believe that simply understanding where we come from and how your world works is enough to have this feeling and discover a plausible way to change your circumstances to improve your life. After all, if you understand your place within a system, you can alter your place
What We Need & What You Get

As you are probably aware, sometimes you have a thought that takes some time to put into words in order to communicate it. I'm the same way, only the thought I'm trying to put into words contains A LOT of information. I have already written scripts (or have verbal notes) for each of the >140 videos that will be included in the website. Each of the term bubbles were examples of videos that will be in this series.

If you watched the video, you might be able to tell that I created it using animations in PowerPoint and a screen recording program. It took a long time to create despite the short duration. The main purpose of the funding will be to speed up the process and improve the quality of the videos that will be on the website.

I have given the initial price of $10,000 as a rough estimate of how much I will need in order to make a fun and effective teaching tool. If, however, you decide to give more then the additional money will all go toward improved quality of the videos and website interface. (Nobody likes a clunky web platform!) I am currently working full time on this project so funding will also be used to support myself (food/rent).

This website will be specifically designed to be an educational exploration tool. The videos will be relatively short (6 min average) and the entire website will be entirely FREE to all users. Since I'm offering a free product, I don't have any goods to give you as perks, though I am happy to offer social media shout outs and a Contributor's Wall on the website with ranked names of how much each of you donated.
I have been doing this fully on my own for some time now so any suggestions for additional perks would be very appreciated. Also, feel free to ask any questions about the project
column2: I absolutely love talking about it in all contexts!

London2Calais: November Refugee Solidarity Projects
supported by rs21, Movement For Justice, London Palestine Action, Defend The Right To Protest and HaLOL
Facebook: www.facebook.com/London2CalaisTwitter: @LDN2Calais #donate2calais Email: londoncalaisconvoy@gmail.com

There are an estimated 6000 people living in 'The Jungle' refugee camp without adequate food, water, sanitation and shelter.  On recent convoys we have noticed that the camp is rapidly becoming more and more crowded as greater numbers of refugees continue to arrive. French police have cleared all additional camps which had been established in Calais Town, further increasing the density of tents and people cramped into the 'The Jungle'. We met pregnant women from Syria, young boys from Afghanistan and men from Sudan, Darfur, Eritrea, Pakistan and elsewhere based in the camp. Due to lack of medical facilities and inadequate sanitation, illness is spreading through the camp. People will struggle to make it through the coming winter months.
Our Previous Convoys
15th August 2015:
Our 7 car convoy delivered food, clothes and essential supplies to refugees in the Calais camp.
As well as distributing 400 food packages in the 'The Jungle' we also provided a generator to power a school in the camp.
On this convoy we spent £2400. The bulk of this was spent on food.
29th August 2015:
We sent 3 cars with clothes donations and 9 volunteers to help French charities with their clothes distribution. We reached over 500 people that day handing out clothes, sleeping bags and food.
We also spent £300 on a much-needed water pump for the camp on this convoy
19th September - Refugees welcome, Day of Action:

We transported over 100 people to Calais to join refugees and french organisations for a march through 'The Jungle' to the fences of the port. We packed a 50-seater coach from London and directed several cars. We did not spend any campaign funds on this action - the coach was funded entirely through ticket sales.
3rd October - 1500 parcel food distribution

We aimed for 1000 food parcels but thanks to your support exceeded this target and distributed 1500 supply packs to refugees in 'The Jungle'. Our team consisted of 70 people and 22 vehicles. The video above covers this distribution.
17th October - Open Dover: Let Them In!
We chartered 3 coaches to take activists from London to Dover where we marched with local anti-racist groups, trade unionists, students, lesbians &
column2: gays support the migrants, rs21, green party and labour party activists. We blocked the ferry port and demand the borders be open now! We did not spend any campaign funds on this action - the coach was funded through ticket sales.

column1:
24th October - London2Calais Refugee Solidarity Summit

100 people came together to discuss the refugee crisis with speeches from Wilf Sullivan of the TUC, Natalie Bennett, Leader of the Green Party, Movement for Justice activists including former Yarl's Wood Detainees, rs21, Black Dissidents, Syrian refugees and many more. This event was funded through ticket
29-30th October - Secours Catholique new warehouse
We dispatched a team to help Secours Catholique move to a new, modern and much larger warehouse
31st October - 2nd November - Family Support

We worked closely with l'auberge des migrants activists to collect shopping lists of items needed from families with young children in 'The Jungle' and bought them the supplies they need. We spent about £300 on these essential supplies.

Our projects for November:
Let Them In (Details to be announced)
We will be shifting the focus onto action which can help refugees in Calais get to Britain. Watch this space for updates. Please fund us to help make this possible...
<div>
<span style=""background-color: initial

We are aiming for our biggest distribution yet, of 2000 packages of food and other essential supplies.  Previously we have packaged these in Calais, this time we hope to pre-pack our parcels in London and involve more people in this process. 

We are expecting to purchase a large quantity of cooker gas to distribute alongside our parcels as well as other much needed supplies.
London2Calais Welcoming fund

London2Calais have established contact with refugees who have arrived to the UK from 'The Jungle'. Some of them are being temporarily housed in cheap hotels around London. Whilst they are having their applications processed, the conditions enforced on them are that they can not work and that they must reside at a specific hotel. They do not receive any money whatsoever from the state. 

As we are now in contact with refugees from Calais who are arriving and being temporarily settled in London, we want to provide them with cash to help them. Please give generously, money from this round of fundraising will also go to providing this kind of practical support for new arrivals.
We are also arranging for immigration lawyers to support them with their case work.
Political funding

In the past our funding has been exclusively for food and aid distributions. This time we want people who contribute to be aware that we may use some funds for the purposes of building a political campaign. Booking coaches such as for the demonstration in Dover, printing leaflets for our Refugee Solidarity Summit and hiring venues costs money, which we so far raised independently from the campaign.

Our aim is to break even on political campaigns through coach ticket sales and charging entrance to events, however, we would like to reserve the option of using up to 10p in every £1 of our funds towards political work. We would like to be clear that about the fact that donations to London2Calais are going to a political campaign in support of refugees.

Since this summer, our news feeds and TV screens have been overflowing with news of the refugee crisis. Lesbos has become the symbolic and de facto setting of this crisis.

On one side, Lesbos has been the setting of much cruelty: the smugglers’ boats, the flight from war, the indifference of Europe. On the other side, we have seen the beauty of humanity illustrated by the sleepless watches, constant effort and dedication of the civil society taking matters into their hands.

The people opening their arms to welcome the refugees and migrants have not been officials or authorities. The first hug, warm blanket and meal have come from the hands, hard work and effort of volunteers and locals.

These are the people Startupboat wants to support. We believe in new ways of facing crisis and the self-organised communities of volunteers finding solutions to the constantly shifting challenges have inspired us. We have pledged to give them the tools to save more lives. This is also the pledge of those who support the Lesbos Fund.

We noticed that volunteers often are faced with lack of resources that could be resolved with access to quick funding. However, fundraising requires effort and time, something that they cannot spare, especially when the amounts they are looking for are small and represent essential but humble items: socks and shoes when stocks run low, a new pair of night-vision goggles, printing expenses to put up signs, a few tents…

These might sound trivial but they immediately make a difference to many.


This is why we are launching the Lesbos Fund, the first peer-to-peer micro-grant tool for emergency zones.

The Lesbos Fund ensures the ability to adapt quickly to the changing nature of saving lives on Lesbos and means:

column5: ><span>All funds go directly to the volunteer organisations who understand the critical needs their community faces
>Enable them to immediately make purchases of equipment without having to wait for donations to come through

column1: • By-pass the effort and time required to fundraise
column5:
>Why Us?

Startupboat has been on the frontline of the crisis since August 2015, identifying patterns of crucial shared problems and working to collaboratively create infrastructure through tech &
column6:
startup solutions. We aim to overcome unnecessary barriers to support the people on the frontline.

We focus on highlighting what works around the world and applying these ideas to make smart solutions scalable in regions affected by mass migration. 


We have launched

column1: • First Contact: www.First-Contact.org launched in August and was the first information website for persons  arriving in Europe. It  launched in Samos 4 days and today used by 14,000 people per week.

• Migration Hub: Migration Hub Network (www.migrationhub.eu) growing across Germany, Greece and more that provide physical and virtual spaces that leverage the expertise of the local tech community and synergizes with the talented newcomer community to create viable solutions for the pressing challenges of mass migration.
• 2 Ongoing Startupboat Mobile Hackathons to critical frontline areas, including Samos &
column2: Lesbos: Bringing startuppers, techies and innovators to the field to raise their awareness of the crisis and engage them in building in-situ, viable solutions for logistics, coordination, information dissemination, environment with a growing partner network including  the University o Cambridge, the Lufthansa Innovation Hub, McKinsey, Stanford University and startups such as Blablacar.

column1: • We have just launched our latest project, MarhaCar (Marhacar.com), the first carpooling community for volunteers who work in crisis regions in cooperation with the International Organisation for Migration, shuttling aid deliveries where it’s critical. In our first three days, we helped 4000 people, and the service is growing from Greece to France.

Being closer to the reality of Lesbos, we have seen the work that is being done, what works and should be supported -- and taken further. 

By supporting the Lesbos Fund, you, like us, pledge to understand and support efficient, sustainable, and scalable ways to resolve the challenges these teams are facing, and the critical importance of cutting down any red tape when thousands of lives are at stake.


Join us in our promise:
• fast distribution of funds to immediately overcome roadblocks
• quick evaluation of the proposed micro-grant amount
• complete transparency with online publication of micro-grants and proof of purchases

We will act as a guarantor that these funds are spent only to help the helpers, simplify process and make sure they can focus their energy on helping refugees.


Help us help them! Donate today!

Short Summary
Hi everyone, we are
the American Institute of Chemical Engineers at the University of South
Florida, and we want to put on an amazing show for Engineering Expo in the
Spring of 2016.
If you don't know,
USF's Engineering Expo is a chance for grade school students all over the Tampa
Bay area to come get a glimpse of what Engineering, and other STEM fields are
all about.
At AICHE's
demonstration we explore some of the exciting science we get to deal with as
Chemical engineers. We explore ideas like phase change with the use of liquid
nitrogen and dry ice, show how dust explosions
happen, and why they're so dangerous, and even give participants a

chance to create their very own souvenir of home-made play-doh to bring home. With these demonstrations we attract upwards of 10,000 students over the weekend from a far away as NEW YORK  to share in the fascination with chemistry.

In past years USF has provided grant money to various organizations to provide to notch demonstrations for the public. This year though, we were informed that the grants would no longer be provided, so it is up to each individual organization to find their own shows. By the nature of our show, the supplies cost $2000 +., so we are turning to crowdfunding in an attempt raise the necessary funds.  100% of the donations will go directly to the supplies we need to light a fire of curiosity in the hearts of grade school students.
Here is a list of the 12 demonstrations:
<ul><li>AIChE's Expo
committee has come up with an ambitious list of 12 demonstrations we wish to
perform for the attendees. These experiments include:
<ol>
<li>Ping
Pong Ball Explosion- Using a 2L bottle, a trash can, and some liquid nitrogen,
we send 500 ping pong balls up to 60 ft. into the air!
<li>Make
your own play-doh- By combining household ingredients in the correct ratios, we
explore what emergent properties are.
<li>Liquid
Nitrogen freezing - Phase changes are the magic principle here. By dipping
various objects into Liquid Nitrogen, we induce phase changes that make the
objects more brittle, as evidenced by our hammer.
<li>Pickle
Lamp- Explore the wonder of electrochemistry while we pass current through a
pickle and see what happens!
<li>Ferro-fluid
- Find out the applications and materials engineering behind this material that
defies gravity in the presence of a magnetic field!
<li>Piff
Magic Dragon - Explore the science behind dust explosions while we set corn
starch on fire!
<li>Fire
Bubbles - Watch as our volunteers set fire to their hands, and somehow escape
injury!
<li>Pringles
Can Hydrogen Explosion - Witness the effect of air fuel ratio in this explosive
combustion experiment!
<li>Flaming
Gummy Bear - Explore the basic chemistry behind rocket fuel in this fiery
demonstration!
<li>Elephant
Toothpaste - What effect do different catalysts have on the rate of reaction?
Stop by this demonstration for a full explanation.
<li>Explosive
Polymerization - Explore chemical kinetics in this experiment by observing the
time it takes for this reaction to start… and how long it takes to finish!
<li>Dry
Ice Bubbles - In this hands on demonstration, students will discover what
happens to solid Carbon Dioxide at ambient conditions.
Your contributions will help provide inspiration to the next generation of college students to learn how the world works.
What We Need &
column2:
What You GetAs much as we, at AIChE want to bring the excitement of chemistry and engineering to today's young minds, we are still Ramen sucking, penny pinching, budget conscious college students, and that's where our contributors come in! Our goal is to raise $2000 for the costs associated with performing these demonstrations. These costs are associated almost exclusively with the chemicals needed to perform the experiments, as well as T-Shirts for our student volunteers.
As a contributor, you will have access to explanations of the various experiments from a chemical engineering perspective.

column1:
Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can contribute, and we certainly understand that, but you can still help! Please, spread the word as far and wide as you can so that we can make this year's expo the most memorable yet!
","Short Summary
Hi everyone, we are
the American Institute of Chemical Engineers at the University of South
Florida, and we want to put on an amazing show for Engineering Expo in the
Spring of 2016.
If you don't know,
USF's Engineering Expo is a chance for grade school students all over the Tampa
Bay area to come get a glimpse of what Engineering, and other STEM fields are
all about.
At AICHE's
demonstration we explore some of the exciting science we get to deal with as
Chemical engineers. We explore ideas like phase change with the use of liquid
nitrogen and dry ice, show how dust explosions
happen, and why they're so dangerous, and even give participants a

chance to create their very own souvenir of home-made play-doh to bring home. With these demonstrations we attract upwards of 10,000 students over the weekend from a far away as NEW YORK  to share in the fascination with chemistry.

In past years USF has provided grant money to various organizations to provide to notch demonstrations for the public. This year though, we were informed that the grants would no longer be provided, so it is up to each individual organization to find their own shows. By the nature of our show, the supplies cost $2000 +., so we are turning to crowdfunding in an attempt raise the necessary funds.  100% of the donations will go directly to the supplies we need to light a fire of curiosity in the hearts of grade school students.
Here is a list of the 12 demonstrations:

injury!

combustion experiment!

Gummy Bear - Explore the basic chemistry behind rocket fuel in this fiery
demonstration!
Elephant
Toothpaste - What effect do different catalysts have on the rate of reaction?
Stop by this demonstration for a full explanation.

Polymerization - Explore chemical kinetics in this experiment by observing the
time it takes for this reaction to start… and how long it takes to finish!
Dry
Ice Bubbles - In this hands on demonstration, students will discover what

Your contributions will help provide inspiration to the next generation of college students to learn how the world works.

Project Summary
<span>

column5:
>Be a part of bringing a therapeutic art-form for positive transformation to the World. The Research Institute for Waldorf Education is accepting tax deductible donations to fund an illustrated step-by-step guide to bare-hand knitting.  The author has graciously dedicated countless hours to see that this art form is preserved.   A clear and thoughtfully written step-by-step guide to 101 bare hand projects is well underway and in need of hundreds of hand-drawn illustrations to give it the beauty and clarity it deserves. With your help we can support a tremendous effort that is nearing completion.

A Japanese Dr. of neurology named Ryuta Kawashima has conducted experiments involving high resolution brain scans to reveal the amazing benefits of knitting and weaving with bare fingers. So how did this art-form find its way into the life of the author of the upcoming publication? Read on...

Hear more  from the  6 pm news for Jan 27th, 4 minutes into the hour

column1: jukebox.kzyx.org
About the Author

Aleshanee Bamboo Akin born in 1971 in San Francisco California, is a published author with 15 years of teaching experience and a Master's Degree in Education as well as a Waldorf Teaching Certification, each from Antioch University New England.

While working and studying in New England the integrative aspect of bare-hand knitting  proved to be  an effective treatment  in left and right brain hemisphere integration for her own daughter. She, developed many new techniques which are revealed in her upcoming book.

Studies show that activities that require both hemispheres of the brain to work together have a therapeutic effect in cases of phobia and PTSD.  A well-accepted therapy called EMDR, involves focusing the eyes on a moving image that passes from side-to-side across the midline, or listening with earphones to sounds that go from one ear to the other, or a vibration passing from one hand to the other.
And, as far as child-development goes, researchers have repeatedly shown that handwork stimulates intelligence and cognitive development.

Having grown up in Hawaii, Aleshanee spent most of her teenage years traveling to Russia and meeting with world leaders, including Premier Mikhail Gorbachev. As a member of the organization Youth Ambassadors of America she helped to negotiate world peace and global ecology action during the turn of the cold war period. While employed as a foreign youth correspondent in Moscow, for the Maui News, she also wrote articles regularly for ""The Bridge,"" a small newspaper published in Bellingham Washington.

As a young mother Aleshanee went on to become a teacher in  in one of Russia's first Waldorf schools. At that time she was regularly published in “Nash Malish"" a popular Russian parenting magazine, and went on to author a book on conscious parenting entitled “Nine Months and a Lifetime” which was published in Saint Petersburg, Russia in December of 1999 and re-published in Moscow by Genesis Publications in March 2006.

The step-by-step guide entitled Bare-hand Knitting is to be published and distributed, internationally, by Waldorf Publications out of New York. You can be a part of the next chapter in Aleshanee's life, by helping to realize this dream in its highest potential.
What We Need &
The first thing we need is for you to spread the word about this campaign.
The second thing we need is your tax deductible donation to this endeavor.
Here is an outline of our budget:
We goal is to raise $10,500
$1,200 to videographer
$2,000 for illustrator
$6,500 book tour

5% for the campaign manager

Any additional  funds that are raised over our goal will go towards providing books to after school programs and charter schools.

There is no minimum goal on this campaign - any amount will help move the project forward, even if the entire dollar goal for this campaign is not met.
Be a part of strengthening the threads that connect us to our ancestors. Make a therapeutic art-form available to those in need. Help sow the seeds of cultural enrichment by helping fund this richly illustrated book, ""Bare-Hand Knitting"".

We are not out to make a profit, rather share the many benefits that this activity creates, especially with the developing minds of our youth.
<span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0)
Please be a friend to this campaign - spread the word! Post on Facebook, tweet on Twitter, knit on Knitter (talk to your knitting circles)... and check out the Indiegogo share tools!

USING SOUND FOR LEVITATION

Ordinary sound waves can be powerful enough to cause dust to collect in a pattern corresponding to the acoustic wave's nodes. A stereo speaker in a room can cause objects to vibrate and sometimes break. 

These feats are nothing compared to the power of sonic levitation. It takes far less effort to influence where dust settles or to shatter a glass than it takes to make objects defy the laws of gravity.  Increasing the amplitude of an acoustic wave causes the sound to be louder, but it doesn't affect the shape of the waveform or cause it to be more powerful.


CREATE AN ANTI-GRAVITY FIELD THAT WOWs!

Levitating objects with sound can be done by aiming an ultrasonic sound beam at a reflector.  With a little adjustment, the desired standing wave as shown in the illustration can be achieved.  Ultrasonic levitation is a fascinating phenomenon that is fun and educational to explore.

LOUDER THAN A JET ENGINE BUT YOU BARELY HEAR IT

Precautions need to be taken when working with ultrasonic devices powerful enough for levitation.  They can produce ear shattering pressure waves beyond the range of human hearing.  Limiting long term exposure to the pressure wave or wearing earplugs is recommended.  It is because of this high power acoustic radiation that the sound pressure can become strong enough to overcome the pull of earth's gravity. An extremely intense sound is the key to acoustic levitation -- the transducers in many acoustic or ultrasonic levitation systems can produce sounds in excess of 150 decibels (dB). Ordinary conversation is about 60 dB, a loud nightclub is closer to 110 dB and a jet engine can reach sound pressure levels over 120dB.  Each 3dB increase represents a doubling of the sound level.  While the sound wave pressure is intense, it doesn't travel very far through the air.  

Find out more at: soniclevitation.com

column3:
>Sonic Levitation Machine Deluxe Lab Kit includes LCD power output display.


This Sonic Levitation Machine produces an ultrasonic wave of 28,000 cycles per second with a wavelength of 12.14286 millimeters.  Both the basic and deluxe versions produce enough power to generate an intense sound wave powerful enough to levitate objects.  The good news is that bulk the pressure wave only travels about 300mm-450mm (12-18 inches) from the transducer when in air so you and your pets are perfectly safe around the Sonic Levitation Machine.  As extra precaution, be sure to wear ear plugs when you are experimenting with this device for long periods of time.
column4:
>


ANTI-GRAVITY ON EARTH

On Earth where the air is dense, the high-pressure areas just below the ultrasonic signal's node must be large enough to support the floating object.  The object being levitated should measure between one third and half of the wavelength of the sound. The ultrasonic field isn't big enough to support objects larger than half the wavelength or around 6mm of diameter in the case of our Sonic Levitation Machine.  The higher the frequency of the sound, the shorter the wavelength and therefore smaller the diameter of the object that can be levitated.
column6:
>Basic Sonic Levitator Kit - includes 120/240 VAC power supply, 28kHz transducer, assembled basic 50 watt sonic generator PCB and reflector stand.

Deluxe Sonic Levitator Kit - includes 120/240 VAC power supply, 28kHz transducer, assembled deluxe 70 watt sonic generator PCB with power output meter and reflector stand.

column1: <h1 style=""font-weight: bold
<div>

Following up on our original crowd funded Sonic Levitation Machine, this project offers a new improved Deluxe Kit with LCD power display. This upgraded ultrasonic driver board can run for long periods of time without overheating and has a power level adjustment for maximum efficiency.
TECH SPECS
BASIC SONIC LEVITATOR KIT
<div><ul>
• Frequency range of driver circuit: 5,000Hz - 60,000Hz.
• Output Power: 50 Watts maximum.*
• Driver Circuit Voltage Input: 12VDC.
• Driver Circuit Output Voltage: 150VAC.
• Line Voltage Supply: 120/240 VAC universal laptop type power supply.
• Connector for external power (amp) meter.
• Single FET output with heatsink
<div>
DELUXE SONIC LEVITATOR KIT
<ul>
• Frequency range of driver circuit: 5,000Hz - 60,000Hz.
• Output Power: 70 Watts maximum.*
• Driver Circuit Voltage Input: 12VDC.
• Driver Circuit Output Voltage: 150VAC.
• Line Voltage Supply: 120/240 VAC universal laptop type power supply.
• Built in LCD power indicator.
• Adjustable PWM power output control.
• Four FET staged output provides stable, cool operation.

*Both the basic and deluxe kits include a 70 watt, 28,000Hz transducer. In most cases, only about 35 watts output is needed to levitate objects. It is recommended to use the minimum amount of output power so that driver circuits can run cool and efficiently.

Most of my crowd funded projects are open source so that people can learn and hopefully expand on my idea. When you back this project, you will get all the source files including any schematics and parts lists needed to build your own device.

BUILDING A WORKING HOVERBOARD!

Let's say we wanted to build some kind of anti-gravity device or even a hoverboard like we see in the movies.  In order to do that, we would need dozens or hundreds of ultrasonic transducers producing very specific wavelengths and reflected beams at precise distances.  It may not even be possible given today's technology but there is nothing wrong with experimenting and trying to see where our research will lead.
<figure style=""margin: 0px

The photo shown above is of a prototype hoverboard that we had some fun working on. It's just a simple test platform to see what would happen. The ultrasonic transducers are mounted to the bottom of the board. When a signal is applied they create a frictionless surface but not enough to lift the board.  So far, we have discovered that it will take many, many more transducers and maybe even 1.21 jigawatts of power!

There is nothing wrong with experimenting and trying to build technology that could lead to a real, working anti-gravity platform or hoverboard.  In theory, with enough power and the right transducers to create a huge amount of sound pressure, you could lift heavy objects off the ground.  The science and math required to do this is complex but it is my hope that this project gets people thinking about what would be needed to achieve that goal.  Maybe one day we will have the floating skateboard we all dreamed of ever since we saw it on the Hollywood big screen.  If not, at least we had fun learning along the way.
<div>
THIS PROJECT IS INTENDED TO MAKE YOU THINK!

Sorry, but I love creating projects where the online community is forced to use their brain.  As always, I give you the foundation but it is your job to take this project even further.  We all want to hear what you do with this technology in the future and hope you will share it with all of us.
Some of the possibilities for this technology and project could include:
<ul>
• Hoverboard
• Retail Displays
• Furniture and heavy object moving device
• Frictionless Bearings
• Transportation
• Science Fair Projects
• and more...
Find out more at: soniclevitation.com
Other projects and websites of mine that you might like:
soundlazer.com
gpscookie.com
richardhaberkern.com

We are young parents, Amrutha Preetham and Senthil Nathan, living in the city of Bengaluru, India. Red Soil Nature Play was born out of a yearning to provide a nurturing space for our new born child. We've developed it as a Social Venture to create a sustainable landscape and environment for the young children of Bengaluru. 

The environment, spread across nearly 2 acres, would consist of a Nature Play school, a Nature Play Workshop Studio, an Open-air Celebration Space and meticulously designed nature play areas set within a ‘Permaculture Ecosystem’ (Self sustainable environment).

Developed from the ground up for the past year, we have been working on its design, development and planning and have bootstrapped the project until now. The creation of Red Soil Nature Play in an urban city with high real estate prices have been a huge impediment in the progress of our project. As support from financial institutions was not easily forthcoming due to the novelty of the project, we are seeking ‘help’ from the local community and people with a deep interest in nature and forest education.

This is an important project as it will ignite a new nature play movement in Urban India. Red Soil Nature Play will be the first early childhood nature play environment in Bengaluru and will be a model of a sustainable ecosystem. Red Soil Nature Play will renew the way we see open public spaces and parks (especially children’s parks) and be a model sustainable environment to learn, live and play.

We are raising 100,000 USD to facilitate the building of Red Soil’s Nature Play Environment. During the past year we have spent around 35,000 USD towards land lease, site development, office structure, land regeneration and labor.

The funds raised through our campaign will help us build a nature play school, a nature play workshop studio and a greenhouse. The money would also go towards the development of nature play and permaculture spaces and acquiring sustainability infrastructure like solar panels, solar pumps and equipment for establishing a bio-compost system, auto-irrigation system and water and waste management system.

Please find the break-up of where the funds will be used, below.

We have created interesting and unique rewards for all our contributors. These rewards are made of natural materials and celebrate local craftsmanship that has evolved over hundreds of years.

As a part of the crowd funding campaign, we are conducting a Rammed Earth Workshop and a National level competition for young architects to Design and Build a Children’s Nature Play Pavilion at our site. This will ignite young architects to imagine and craft spaces with sensitivity towards children.

All contributors’ names would also find a place in Red Soil Nature Play's Rammed earth wall to remember the strength and love behind the environment.

Moreover, we would be delighted to show our gratitude to you through a Live Art Installation, with the names of all our contributors. The art installation post card prints will be mailed to all contributors. 

    The sense of the place is to inspire and ignite young minds to explore and experience nature in a peaceful unhurried manner. The built structures at Red Soil would be made of natural materials like mud and bamboo. The design would integrate safety as a prime factor throughout the environment. The play landscape with diverse natural elements would provide a variety of opportunities for children’s play.  Children can climb a tree, roll down a grassy hill, dig in the sand, and climb on boulders or just day dream.

    Red Soil was developed from the ground up since November 2015. To restore the land, we planted more than 100 indigenous trees of South India. We are in the process of growing a wide assortment of vegetables, grains, herbs and plants. The herb garden would also be a special forte with over 40 herbs. Farm animals like hens, ducks and goats would also find a comfortable abode in the habitat.

    The importance of Early Childhood Development and NATURE PLAY in Bengaluru

• Bengaluru is the second fastest-growing major metropolis in India and popularly known as the “Silicon Valley of India”. As a growing metropolitan city in a developing country, Bengaluru confronts substantial pollution and other logistical and socio-economic problems. This rapid growth has made Bengaluru a home to a large number of young parents and children

• The living environments for children in the city are inconsiderate and do not cater to serve their basic developmental needs. Play schools and Kindergartens are located in houses with constrained spaces. These house-converted-playschools do not offer natural and open outdoor environments

• Bengaluru has become a city of shopping malls, traffic jams, frothing lakes and waterlogged roads. The high real estate prices have shrunk the open playgrounds and green spaces in the city resulting in deprived living environments for its future generation

• The importance of early childhood development and the vital role of natural surroundings are not being recognized in the current educational ‘market’ and hence a space like Red Soil Nature Play will become a foundation stone in the future of early childhood development in Bengaluru, India.

“… nature must be seen as an essential component of the experiential world of childhood, designed into every childhood habitat, providing daily immersion in nature, putting children in close touch with the biosphere. In the urban world we live in, implementation of this right cannot be left to chance. It is a design imperative.” (Moore and Cosco, 2000)

Social objectives of Red Soil Nature Play
• To renew the way we see open public spaces and parks (especially children’s parks)
• To blend Nature Play and Permaculture together so that the future generation can lead and live in a sustainable earth
• To revitalize early childhood education in India
• To be a model sustainable environment to learn, live and play
• To be the First Nature Play environment in Bengaluru, India

We need your support.
Even if you are unable to make a financial contribution, you can still help us:
• Please share our vision! Spread the word and make some noise about our campaign.
• Act now and use the Indiegogo share tools to let your circles, your tribes, your friends and your families know about the important initiative Red Soil Nature Play is driving forward.

We welcome you to become a part of Red Soil Nature Play’s blossoming journey!

Kind Regards,

Amrutha Preetham, Senthil Nathan
Co-founders of Red Soil Nature Play
www.redsoilnatureplay.com

","We are young parents, Amrutha Preetham and Senthil Nathan, living in the city of Bengaluru, India. Red Soil Nature Play was born out of a yearning to provide a nurturing space for our new born child. We've developed it as a Social Venture to create a sustainable landscape and environment for the young children of Bengaluru. The environment, spread across nearly 2 acres, would consist of a Nature Play school, a Nature Play Workshop Studio, an Open-air Celebration Space and meticulously designed nature play areas set within a ‘Permaculture Ecosystem’ (Self sustainable environment).Developed from the ground up for the past year, we have been working on its design, development and planning and have bootstrapped the project until now. The creation of Red Soil Nature Play in an urban city with high real estate prices have been a huge impediment in the progress of our project. As support from financial institutions was not easily forthcoming due to the novelty of the project, we are seeking ‘help’ from the local community and people with a deep interest in nature and forest education.This is an important project as it will ignite a new nature play movement in Urban India. Red Soil Nature Play will be the first early childhood nature play environment in Bengaluru and will be a model of a sustainable ecosystem. Red Soil Nature Play will renew the way we see open public spaces and parks (especially children’s parks) and be a model sustainable environment to learn, live and play.We are raising 100,000 USD to facilitate the building of Red Soil’s Nature Play Environment. During the past year we have spent around 35,000 USD towards land lease, site development, office structure, land regeneration and labor.The funds raised through our campaign will help us build a nature play school, a nature play workshop studio and a greenhouse. The money would also go towards the development of nature play and permaculture spaces and acquiring sustainability infrastructure like solar panels, solar pumps and equipment for establishing a bio-compost system, auto-irrigation system and water and waste management system.Please find the break-up of where the funds will be used, below.We have created interesting and unique rewards for all our contributors. These rewards are made of natural materials and celebrate local craftsmanship that has evolved over hundreds of years.As a part of the crowd funding campaign, we are conducting a Rammed Earth Workshop and a National level competition for young architects to Design and Build a Children’s Nature Play Pavilion at our site. This will ignite young architects to imagine and craft spaces with sensitivity towards children.All contributors’ names would also find a place in Red Soil Nature Play's Rammed earth wall to remember the strength and love behind the environment.Moreover, we would be delighted to show our gratitude to you through a Live Art Installation, with the names of all our contributors. The art installation post card prints will be mailed to all contributors. The sense of the place is to inspire and ignite young minds to explore and experience nature in a peaceful unhurried manner. The built structures at Red Soil would be made of natural materials like mud and bamboo. The design would integrate safety as a prime factor throughout the environment. The play landscape with diverse natural elements would provide a variety of opportunities for children’s play.  Children can climb a tree, roll down a grassy hill, dig in the sand, and climb on boulders or just day dream.Red Soil was developed from the ground up since November 2015. To restore the land, we planted more than 100 indigenous trees of South India. We are in the process of growing a wide assortment of vegetables, grains, herbs and plants. The herb garden would also be a special forte with over 40 herbs. HELP SCALE MUBU THE MORPH'S IMPACT,

A self-sustaining fundraiser for the Museum of Disability History and a Story of Understanding and Acceptance

Go on a rhyming adventure with Mubu as he learns the importance of self-identity, friendship, sharing one’s gifts and gratitude in this Mom's Choice Award winning children's book series. Vibrant colors and a playful tone amp up the fun factor that's sure to ignite the imaginations of children and adults alike.  Written by Stephen Nawotniak, illustrated by Jeffrey Scott Perdziak and published by People Ink Press, Mubu the Morph is suitable for children in grades K to 3 and the people who love them.

 

THE PURPOSE

Mubu the Morph is about understanding and acceptance. As a Moms Choice Award-winning author, I have made a name for myself in the world of children’s literature as someone who is able to connect with young people and get positive messages across to them.

 

With my book series Mubu the Morph, I have taught all sorts of lessons about understanding, acceptance, and independence, while at the same time supporting the Museum of disABILITY History whose mission is to advance the understanding, acceptance, and independence of people with disabilities.  (http://museumofdisability.org).

 

SUPPORTING THE MUSEUM OF disABILITY
column3:
showinfo=0"">

Currently 100% of proceeds from every book sold from this campaign goes to support the Museum of disAbility and is broken down as follows: 33% directly to the Museum and 64% for further promotions, website development and advertising campaigns making this project self sustainable.  Established in 1998 by Dr. James M. Boles, president and CEO of People Inc. (Western New York’s leading non-profit human services agency) the Museum of disABILITY History has steadily expanded over the years and, in late 2010, moved to a brand new location (pictured above).

The Museum of disABILITY History is dedicated to advancing the understanding, acceptance and independence of people with disabilities. The Museum’s exhibits, collections, archives and educational programs create awareness and a platform for dialogue and discovery.  The museum has been developed with the generous support of People Inc. and the B. Thomas Golisano Foundation. We are truly thankful for their participation in this worthwhile effort.

This is the only Museum of its kind in the USA, perhaps the world.  Below is a clip about one of the museum’s recent exhibits.
column5:
showinfo=0"">
The Lives they Left Behind Exhibit

The Museum of disABILITY History is proud to host The Lives They Left Behind: Suitcases from a State Hospital Attic as a special exhibit open to the public. The exhibit honors the memories of those who packed the suitcases and hopes to inspire dialogue about the treatment of those with mental illness.

 

PERKS AND REWARDS

Check out the perks section for a detailed list of perks but the featured perks are the signed copies of the books for $25 each.  

Mubu the Morph

Go on a rhyming adventure with Mubu as he learns through trial and error the secret to being his best self. Vibrant colors and a playful tone amp up the fun factor in Stephen Nawotniak's engaging story that's sure to ignite the imaginations of children and adults alike. Illustrated by Jeffrey Scott Perdziak and published by People Ink Press, Mubu the Morph is suitable for children in grades K to 3 and the people who love them.

Mubu's Christmas

Mubu and his friend Kookoo-ah-choo live out their values of friendship and sharing talents with others in this holiday tale. Kookoo uses her gift of song to lift the spirits of people around the town. Mubu earnestly advocates for Kookoo with Santa. This story speaks to the spirit of Christmas and how we can spread it to others.

Blue Mubu

The third book in the Mubu the Morph series, Blue Mubu is a heartwarming children's book on emotions. The message is how gratitude and thankfulness help how we feel, even when we are sad. Blue Mubu encourages conversations on emotions between children and their parents, as well as teachers and caregivers.

 

ABOUT THE AUTHOR AND ILLUSTRATOR

Author,
column9: trkInfo=clickedVertical%3Amynetwork%2CclickedEntityId%3A310663226%2CauthType%3ANAME_SEARCH%2Cidx%3A1-1-1%2CtarId%3A1474910073627%2Ctas%3AStephen%20Nawotniak"" rel=""noopener nofollow"">Stephen Nawotniak, is a licensed occupational therapist and author of the books Handbook for Healthy Living with a Mood Disorder and Mubu the Morph. Handbook for Healthy Living was written to provide hope for those suffering from depression, anxiety and bipolar conditions and help for them to take back their lives. Mubu the Morph was written to share the journey of finding one's purpose in an adult relevant, child friendly format.
column13:
trkInfo=clickedVertical%3Amynetwork%2CclickedEntityId%3A174533874%2CauthType%3ANAME_SEARCH%2Cidx%3A1-1-1%2CtarId%3A1474910311472%2Ctas%3AJeff%20Perdziak"" rel=""noopener nofollow"">Jeff Perdziak illustrated Mubu the Morph. He’s a designer with more than a decade of experience as an Art Director. Jeff loves to see children affected in a positive way by his art.

 

HOW WE'LL USE THE FUNDING

We plan to use the funds of this campaign to scale up the project for website improvements, an automated email system and ads to build an author’s platform for future releases. We also plan to add some automation in the process through digital book sales. Currently we rely on face to face sales of the books and the funding from this campaign will help us break into e-commerce where we can reach a larger audience and raise even more funding for the disABILITY Museum!

 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

The nice thing about this campaign is that the perks are already published and created.  This way, regardless of the money raised, you are ensured to receive your perk. Also, since we are partnered with the Museum of Disability on this venture, there is 3rd party oversight on the campaign process.  There is no risk to you as a contributor.

Short Summary

I’m raising money for supplies and travel for students in  the Morehouse College Makerspace, a program to help college and other students from the Atlanta community, fuel their imagination and learn about engineering.
But first, I want to tell you my story, and how my uncle Troy Davis inspired me to give back.

When I was little, I always watched Dexter’s Laboratory and built things with Legos – I was fascinated with how stuff works. My mom would quiz me – how does a VCR work? What about a blender? My uncle Troy would help me with my math homework. I didn’t realize they were molding me into an engineer.

I started entering science fairs in kindergarten, and I won every science competition from the third through seventh grades. In third grade I wrote a report on sleep apnea. In fifth grade I made a presentation about the effects of tobacco smoke. In seventh grade I presented on germs in public places.
Eighth grade was the first year that I didn’t enter a science competition. I entered a social science competition instead.
My presentation was a report about my uncle Troy, titled “Justice and the Georgia death penalty.”

My uncle Troy was on death row. He had been arrested and sentenced in 1989 for a crime that he claimed he never committed. There were inconsistent statements from eyewitnesses. No gun or DNA evidence was ever found. Since the trial, nearly every prosecution witness has recanted their testimony.

Even though Uncle Troy was behind bars, with a national movement called #TooMuchDoubt building around his case, he still helped me with my homework. Even after they stopped allowing him to have a pen, he would still critique me on my presentations and encourage me. I visited him twice a month at least.
I started at Morehouse in 2013, as a double major in engineering and physics. In sophomore year my friend Tyvone Boykins and I teamed up to create the Morehouse College Makerspace Exploration Center.

The Makerspace is a cooperative laboratory workspace where students and faculty can make things, conduct research and collaborate. There are 3D printers, computers and other hands-on supplies (check out the video!). Here, students gain practical hands-on experience with new technologies, learning through building.

We teach students, and during summers we run summer programs for sixth, seventh and eighth graders from Atlanta. We give them the same lessons we give the college students. Sure, it’s rigorous, but they always end up learning how to do what we teach them.
I learned from my uncle to always live with a “Reach one, teach one” mentality – I make sure to give back since so many people helped me get to where I am.
Now I’m asking for your help to keep the opportunities in the Makerspace going.

I just started senior year at Morehouse, and I want to make sure the Makerspace is going strong when I leave. I would like to raise $20,000 to go toward supplies, trips to engineering conferences (like the NASA Space App Challenge), and more summer programs for kids from Atlanta.This will go a long way in giving students a chance to experience what I have in the Makerspace.
Thank you for your help.
The Impact

The impact is simple but powerful because this space is created to directly help young black engineers along with other science and math majors, to become as strong as possible in the hands on aspect of engineering and project creation. The larger the program is the more students can learn the adequate skills needed to prepare them for a strong engineering careers in the future.
Other Ways You Can Help
Contact information :
Email: AntoneCorreia12@gmail.com
Website: http://morehousemakerspace.org/

RoboTex is a K-12 robotics team that competes in the BEST ( Boosting Engineering, Science, and Technology) robotics competition which lasts 6 weeks every fall. This competition challenges our team to create a model company that produces and markets a robot designed to complete a series of specific tasks. On Game Day we compete against about 20 other robotics teams. The teams all race against a 3 minute time limit to collect specific game pieces to score points. We are raising funds to buy materials that we will use to build our robot, show booth, and buy marketing supplies.

column1:
Who Am I?

I am a long time Libertarian, Secretary of the Oklahoma Libertarian Party, former Independent candidate for Oklahoma House District 46, Co-Director of Oklahomans For Ballot Access Reform, founding member of the Entertainment Consumers Association, and potentially your US Congressman.

I have been an Independent voter since I was 18 and a Libertarian since I started voting. Since 2006, I have been involved in Oklahomans For Ballot Access Reform fighting Oklahoma's legislature to reform our repressive ballot access laws. This effort lead me to run for the Oklahoma House with ballot access reform as a chief issue. Through this, I also got involved in the Oklahoma Libertarian Party and became their Secretary in 2012.

For the first time in over 30 years, the Oklahoma Legislature reduced the ballot access laws and thanks to that, the Libertarian Party is an official party in Oklahoma for the first time in 16 years. To celebrate this momentous occasion, I have decided to run for office as an official Libertarian candidate for US Congressional District 5.

What I Need

To officially run for office, I need to raise $750 to pay for my candidate filing fee. Oklahoma requires this of all people who want to run for US Congress. This is what I need. If I don't get this, I can't run for office. So That is what I need.
Anything more than this will go towards campaign materials such as cards, fliers, stickers and signs. The more I raise, the more of these I can get for my supporters.

What You Get

So what do you get by supporting my run for US Congress? The big thing is that you get a Pro-Freedom, Pro-Peace, Libertarian candidate running against Steve Russell. You will get a candidate who supports the following Pro-Peace, Pro-Freedom issues:
<ul>
<li>
End all military conflicts that are not in direct defense of the US. This includes reducing the military budget by ending boondoggle programs and graft that plagues our budget.
<li>
End The War On Drugs and all parts of it including mandatory minimums, bans on industrial hemp, civil asset forfeiture, and more.
<li>
Balance the Budget by shutting down all Federal Programs and Agencies that are not directly authorized by the US Constitution.
<li>

End The Federal Income Tax by eliminating unconstitutional programs and agencies, reducing the military industrial complex and more, we can eliminate the income tax and return that money to the American people.
<li>
End The War On Terror by revoking the PATRIOT Act and all other programs that violate the constitution and the rights, privacy, and liberty of the American People.
<li>

Bring US Law Into The Digital Age by establishing and expanding fair use of copyrights, trademarks and patents, eliminating cronyism in copyright, trademark and patent law, and getting the US out of treaties that lock us into these unjust laws.
<li>
And So Much More.
Risks &
column2:
Challenges

Running for elected office is no easy task. It takes time and money. Since I am not a professional politician, I don't have the same amount of time my professional politician competition will have. Since I am not a professional politician, I will not have the high roller funders my professional politician competition will have.

column1: What I do have is you. The individuals who feel that the US needs more freedom and more peace for our people. The more money I raise, the better my chances are.
Yet, even if I don't win, I will have accomplished several things:
<ol>
• I will have promoted those values and solutions listed above.
• I will have given voters a choice that they can believe in.
• I will have shown that the Libertarian Party is a real option for Oklahoma voters and for all the US.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't back me here, I highly recommend that you share my campaign with other voters who are looking for an alternative to the big government candidates and parties on the ballot.

You can still donate via Paypal.

Who Am I? I am a long time Libertarian, Secretary of the Oklahoma Libertarian Party, former Independent candidate for Oklahoma House District 46, Co-Director of Oklahomans For Ballot Access Reform, founding member of the Entertainment Consumers Association, and potentially your US Congressman.

I have been an Independent voter since I was 18 and a Libertarian since I started voting. Since 2006, I have been involved in Oklahomans For Ballot Access Reform fighting Oklahoma's legislature to reform our repressive ballot access laws. This effort lead me to run for the Oklahoma House with ballot access reform as a chief issue. Through this, I also got involved in the Oklahoma Libertarian Party and became their Secretary in 2012.

For the first time in over 30 years, the Oklahoma Legislature reduced the ballot access laws and thanks to that, the Libertarian Party is an official party in Oklahoma for the first time in 16 years. To celebrate this momentous occasion, I have decided to run for office as an official Libertarian candidate for US Congressional District 5.   What I Need To officially run for office, I need to raise $750 to pay for my candidate filing fee. Oklahoma requires this of all people who want to run for US Congress. This is what I need. If I don't get this, I can't run for office. So That is what I need.
Anything more than this will go towards campaign materials such as cards, fliers, stickers and signs. The more I raise, the more of these I can get for my supporters.

What You Get So what do you get by supporting my run for US Congress? The big thing is that you get a Pro-Freedom, Pro-Peace, Libertarian candidate running against Steve Russell. You will get a candidate who supports the following Pro-Peace, Pro-Freedom issues:
End all military conflicts that are not in direct defense of the US. This includes reducing the military budget by ending boondoggle programs and graft that plagues our budget.
End The War On Drugs and all parts of it including mandatory minimums, bans on industrial hemp, civil asset forfeiture, and more.
Balance the Budget by shutting down all Federal Programs and Agencies that are not directly authorized by the US Constitution.

End The Federal Income Tax by eliminating unconstitutional programs and agencies, reducing the military industrial complex and more, we can eliminate the income tax and return that money to the American people.
End The War On Terror by revoking the PATRIOT Act and all other programs that violate the constitution and the rights, privacy, and liberty of the American People.

Bring US Law Into The Digital Age by establishing and expanding fair use of copyrights, trademarks and patents, eliminating cronyism in copyright, trademark and patent law, and getting the US out of treaties that lock us into these unjust laws.
And So Much More.

Risks & Challenges Running for elected office is no easy task. It takes time and money. Since I am not a professional politician, I don't have the same amount of time my professional politician competition will have. Since I am not a professional politician, I will not have the high roller funders my professional politician competition will have.
What I do have is you. The individuals who feel that the US needs more freedom and more peace for our people. The more money I raise, the better my chances are.
Yet, even if I don't win, I will have accomplished several things:
I will have promoted those values and solutions listed above.
I will have given voters a choice that they can believe in.
I will have shown that the Libertarian Party is a real option for Oklahoma voters and for all the US.

Other Ways You Can Help Even if you can't back me here, I highly recommend that you share my campaign with other voters who are looking for an alternative to the big government candidates and parties on the ballot.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Edmond, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/elect-zachary-knight-to-district-5/pica

column2: >When you were young, what kind of changes were you looking for in your life

column1: <span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column2: >Give young people the chance to start exploring already early in life who they are and who they want to be. Our youth gatherings have helped hundreds of young adults to
column3: >get to know themselves a little bit better. Can you help us to reach even more?
column7: >The project: DARE to CARE Youth Gathering
column9:
>

My name is Yara Vrolijks and I'm the coordinator of the DARE to CARE Youth gathering. This project is an initiative by the Tenzin Gyatso Institute. We are honoured that our speakers are willing to speak for free to the youth: Stanford University neurosurgeon James Doty, Professor of Clinical Psychology Paul Gilbert, President of 'Courage for Care Coalition' Brooke Lavelle and international peace-maker Scilla Elworthy. They believe it is worthwhile to invest in young people, in the form of education that  not only educates the mind but also the heart.

column1: As students we are often given the message that life is all about money and good looks. We're told that success depends on having a career and a great social network. Is this really what it's all about? Or is there more?

Most of us ask ourselves these questions, but often we’re not given the space to fully explore them. We learn about mathematics, grammar and economics, but the basic questions about our fundamental search for meaning often go unaddressed. Why not reflect on this early in life, as part of our formal education?
The benefits of empathy and compassion

There is growing scientific evidence that empathy and compassion for oneself and others are important sources of happiness and psychological well-being. By cultivating these qualities we build resilience and stability of mind, equipping us with skilful tools to face the difficulties of daily life.
Research has found that:
• training in compassion improves physical health and makes people more resilient to stress: it lowers stress hormones in the blood and strengthens the immune response

• compassion makes better friends: studies of college friendships show that when one friend sets the goal to support the other compassionately, both friends experience greater satisfaction and growth in the relationship
• compassion enhances creativity at the workplace and in school
Goals and Objectives
We believe it is important for every young adult to explore the qualities of compassion and empathy and that such exploration is an essential component of personal development.
Objective #1 Connect young people with like-minded peers.
Objective #2 Encourage reflection and discussion on fundamental questions.
Objective #3 Inspire young people by introducing them to new perspectives and giving them the chance to meet respected scientists, policy makers and other change makers.
Objective #4 Inspire teachers to focus more on the development of empathy and compassion in the school environment.
The DARE to CARE Youth Gathering: Its Success and Benefit

Since 2012, revered scientists and other change makers volunteer to speak with young people about the role of empathy and compassion in society at the ""DARE to CARE"" Youth Gathering. 

The Youth Gathering provides young people with tools to find their own perspectives, develop the courage to choose their own path in life, and ultimately to better realize their potential.

Over the past four years, we have reached more than 700 young people from the UK and the USA. This year we want to expand our reach even further. For the first time, we are streaming the event around the world for FREE.
To do this, we need your support!

We need to raise only 2800 dollars (2500 euros) to make the web streaming of ""DARE to CARE"" available to universities and schools across the globe. Your support can make it possible for us to offer this streaming for FREE so that thousands of young people can join and, ultimately,  be a catalyst for change in the world.
The funds will cover the organisation of the streaming of the event.

Even if you cannot support us financially, we would love to have your support via Twitter (#DaretoCareyouth) and Facebook. Help us spread the word to everyone around the globe! May we inspire a movement of kindness and care among young people, educators and the broader global community! 

Meet the Team!

Yara Vrolijks is the Coordinator of the DARE to CARE Youth Gathering and connected to the Tenzin Gyatso Institute, one of the founding partners of the Youth Gathering. Besides this, Yara is an instructor of meditation and compassion practices and she is regularly asked to speak or lead workshops.  She takes part in discussions on the role of empathy and compassion in education and shares advices on how to implement these qualities in an academic context.

Ashley Kendall is the Communications Officer for the Tenzin Gyatso Institute. In this role she has helped with communications for the Empathy and Compassion in Society conference, a project of the Tenzin Gyatso Institute, as well as with the Youth Gathering. Ashley also works as a clinical psychologist in Chicago, Illinois, where she conducts research on HIV transmission in juvenile offenders and sees clients in a private practice.


ABOUT THE TENZIN GYATSO INSTITUTE
column3:
/>

 The ""DARE to CARE"" Youth Gathering is an initiative of the Tenzin Gyatso Institute. Named after the 14th Dalai Lama of Tibet (his given name is Tenzin Gyatso), the institute was established with the mission of serving and advancing the Dalai Lama's vision, principles and values. His message of compassion, religious harmony and universal responsibility has touched the hearts and minds of millions of people from all walks of life and spiritual traditions, who recognize its truth, its urgency and its extraordinary potential.
