Connect Slovenia

Connect Slovenia is a week-long international youth gathering for students about to finish high school, creating a safe space for them to explore themselves, meet and exchange, learn about our current world challenges and become active global citizens. From 27 April to 2 May 2018, young adults from all around the world will gather in Ljubljana for a week of cultural exchange, inspiration, action and celebration. 

In a rapidly changing and complex world, our aim is to empower and strengthen youth, to make them feel that they can choose and act for what they truly believe in, take initiative and cause a ripple effect of creativity for future generations. We want to encourage youngsters to ‘be the change they wish to see in the world’. 

Throughout the week, not only will we be tackling different topics of today’s societal challenges, but also inspirational individuals will give lectures sharing their experience of working towards positive social change, embodying the example that even the smallest action can have an impact on today’s complex society. There will be various workshops and conversation groups to dive deeper into certain topics, and evening activities to celebrate. Participants will be invited to co-create the event, with presentations, performances or anything they want to bring up and share. 

For more information take a look at the full week program on our website: https://www.connectslovenia.org/

Who we are 

We are a group of young, energetic and passionate entrepreneurs from Slovenia, Germany, Belgium, Croatia and Israel, working voluntarily for Connect. Combining the work which brings us joy and purpose with our own lives and activities, our project is one hundred percent made out of love and fire in our hearts. 

We have been working together since March 2017, and we won’t hide that we feel proud seeing how much we’ve done so far. We’ve had countless meetings, met with numerous schools and contributors, designed a program, received support from various foundations and organisations, and we feel excited about what still needs to be done.

Your support

A big part of what makes Connect a rich experience for everyone is its cultural diversity. To make a real intercultural exchange, we want to bring as much diversity among the participants as possible, creating a mini-society and bringing different cultures, religions, and social classes together, in order to break down the prejudices and barriers that we have in our minds. 

And that’s where you can help us! 

A group of 13 students from Tanzania, Uganda and Laos – that we’re hearing much enthusiasm about – would love to join us to co-create. However, they can’t afford the travel costs. We want to give them the opportunity to come to Connect Slovenia to broaden their perspective and the perspectives of others.

We need your generous support, so that together, we can give these promising students the chance to participate, create diversity and inspire.

 

Thank you :) 

 

Katharina, Nives, Ori, Hagar, Lea, Jappe, Kristien, Floriaan and Theodore.

Dots is challenging the old ways of learning languages. We bring linguistics expertise, databases, algorithms and visual design to your learning experience. You spend less time and less effort to learn a foreign language with Dots. You will also find the visual designs of Dots cute and playful.

We are competing in the Duke Startup Challenge http://www.dukestartupchallenge.org/ . We need your support to build Dots and make it available to all language learners! Please help us raise $5,000 to get into the final round of the challenge!

While our web app aims to strengthen people’s language ability, it can also facilitate intercultural communication and collaboration to make the world better connected.

Dots is perfect for international students because it can help them adjust to a different culture.

Dots is also a great teaching tool for teachers. 

If you are interested in Dots (want to join us/ have suggestions for us/be posted on Dots), don't hesitate to reach out to us at  kx19@duke.edu (Coco Xu 's personal email address).  We value your opinions and we need your help to make Dots better! 

 

Translation/翻译：

Dots正在挑战传统的语言学习方式。我们将语言学知识，数据库，算法和视觉设计融入到语言学习中，这样一来，使用Dots学习语言会更加高效。我们可爱的视觉设计也会为语言学习添加更多乐趣。

我们正在参加杜克创新大赛。我们需要你的帮助来继续开发Dots, 我们希望让所有的语言学习者都能够使用Dots！请帮助我们筹集到5，000美元，进入到比赛的决赛轮！

我们的产品致力于帮助人们更好地学习语言，同时它也可以促进跨文化交流和合作。我们希望看到一个真正互联的世界。

Dots是留学生的好助手，Dots可以帮助他们融入到新的文化当中。对于语言老师，Dots是一个极佳的教学工具。

如果你想加入我们或者给我们建议，请发送邮件至kx19@duke.edu   让我们一起把Dots做的更好！

Our Story
Hello! My name is Dr. Eve Ekman. I'm a researcher and emotional trainer. I'm here to ask for your support in funding an Atlas of Emotions designed specifically for children.

In 2016, my father, Dr. Paul Ekman, and I worked with a team of design experts to create an online Atlas of Emotions to help society become more aware of their emotions. This free, online tool lets visitors explore the inner workings of emotions: how they are triggered, what they feel like, and how we respond to them. This atlas, funded by the Office of H.H. the Dalai Lama, currently receives over 35,000 hits per week and is available in both English and Spanish. (Please feel free to check it out here: www.atlasofemotions.org)

Extending the wishes of H. H. the Dalai Lama, we would now like to create an Atlas of Emotions for Children! The goal of this project would be to create a free, online interactive tool to educate children and parents about their emotions and how to work with them. We feel confident that this atlas of emotions will be effective in helping children (and the young at heart) feel more understood and capable of expressing themselves in peaceful, constructive ways.
Why an Atlas for Children?

The Children's Atlas of Emotions  will focus primarily on the social and emotional learning needs of children from ages 8-12 years old. This age range is a precious time in development of connection and relationships- where the fundamentals of emotional communication can be formed for a lifetime.

Our current Atlas of Emotions has reached hundreds of thousands of people and we hope our Children's Atlas will exceed even these numbers. To maximize our impact, we are developing partnerships with universities and educational institutions to provide the greatest reach and breadth for this project.
This Atlas for Kids will be fundamentally different from the adult Atlas in two ways.

1. This Atlas will be an interactive and engaging platform where in addition to learning new emotion vocabulary kids can safely share emotional experiences to build empathy and connection. For example, if a kid using the Atlas is feeling worried about starting a new school year or excited about a family trip they can share this and see how many others are feeling the same this day or week or month represented in visually engaging info maps.

2. The Atlas of Emotion for Kids will include relational activities for kids to use with peers,  and parents. This pair activity will show us the differences in how we share and interpret the emotions of those around us. Sometimes we misread emotion signals, or are missing them all together, the atlas provides a language for expressing emotions and activities to decode what they mean.
Content of the Children's Atlas of Emotions
Our Atlas for Children will feature the same taxonomy of emotion words from the current atlas but will add in new content specific to the social and emotional learning goals of children ages 8-12.
Here's what we are looking forward to:
<ul>
• Examples of Emotional Episodes on topics common for kids such as bullying/ harassment, feeling pride/ accomplishment, unfairness
• An Emotion-O-Meter which uses different colors and textures to explore our internal emotional state
• A parent- child relational tool that allows kids to describe how they witness their parents emotions and vice-versa
• Global mapping tool that allows kids to report their emotions that day and see what other children are feeling all over the world
• Media offering simple ways for children to work with hard emotions based in mindfulness
Our Team
Our team for this project has a proven track record in developing impactful educational content.

1) Dr. Paul Ekman is best known for his work studying facial expressions and emotion. In 2009, Dr. Ekman was named one of the 100 most influential people in the world by TIME Magazine. In 2014, Dr. Ekman ranked fifteenth among the most influential psychologists of the 21st century. Dr. Ekman has written more than 14 books and 170 published articles. He as well worked as a key advisor for Pixar's ""Inside Out"".

2) Dr. Eve Ekman is a researcher at UCSF and emotional trainer among her multitude of experiences designing and developing live and online trainings in mindfulness for health care and the private sector. Eve is also a founding teacher trainer for Cultivating Emotional Balance, an evidenced-based program drawing on Western Scientific and Eastern Contemplative teachings to develop constructive emotional behaviors for a meaningful life.
What We Need
We are looking for $150,000 in funding.
<ul>
• $90,000 for product design including ideation, prototyping, A/B testing, iteration, buildout, testing, deployment, and Internationalization to translate our written content into other languages.
• $60,000 for content creation from experts in Social Emotional Learning and Education, Developmental Psychology, and Children's Illustration and Design
Other Ways You Can Help
• Share this campaign page with others
• Start a fundraiser at your school or local community center

This Atlas for Kids will be fundamentally different from the adult Atlas in two ways.

1. This Atlas will be an interactive and engaging platform where in addition to learning new emotion vocabulary kids can safely share emotional experiences to build empathy and connection. For example, if a kid using the Atlas is feeling worried about starting a new school year or excited about a family trip they can share this and see how many others are feeling the same this day or week or month represented in visually engaging info maps.

2. The Atlas of Emotion for Kids will include relational activities for kids to use with peers,  and parents. This pair activity will show us the differences in how we share and interpret the emotions of those around us. Sometimes we misread emotion signals, or are missing them all together, the atlas provides a language for expressing emotions and activities to decode what they mean.
Content of the Children's Atlas of Emotions
Our Atlas for Children will feature the same taxonomy of emotion words from the current atlas but will add in new content specific to the social and emotional learning goals of children ages 8-12.
Here's what we are looking forward to:
Examples of Emotional Episodes on topics common for kids such as bullying/ harassment, feeling pride/ accomplishment, unfairness
An Emotion-O-Meter which uses different colors and textures to explore our internal emotional state
A parent- child relational tool that allows kids to describe how they witness their parents emotions and vice-versa
Global mapping tool that allows kids to report their emotions that day and see what other children are feeling all over the world
Media offering simple ways for children to work with hard emotions based in mindfulness
Our Team
Our team for this project has a proven track record in developing impactful educational content.

1) Dr. Paul Ekman is best known for his work studying facial expressions and emotion. In 2009, Dr. Ekman was named one of the 100 most influential people in the world by TIME Magazine. In 2014, Dr. Ekman ranked fifteenth among the most influential psychologists of the 21st century. Dr. Ekman has written more than 14 books and 170 published articles. He as well worked as a key advisor for Pixar's ""Inside Out"".

2) Dr. Eve Ekman is a researcher at UCSF and emotional trainer among her multitude of experiences designing and developing live and online trainings in mindfulness for health care and the private sector. Eve is also a founding teacher trainer for Cultivating Emotional Balance, an evidenced-based program drawing on Western Scientific and Eastern Contemplative teachings to develop constructive emotional behaviors for a meaningful life.
What We Need
We are looking for $150,000 in funding.
$90,000 for product design including ideation, prototyping, A/B testing, iteration, buildout, testing, deployment, and Internationalization to translate our written content into other languages.
$60,000 for content creation from experts in Social Emotional Learning and Education, Developmental Psychology, and Children's Illustration and Design
Other Ways You Can Help
Share this campaign page with others
Start a fundraiser at your school or local community center",4.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","San Francisco, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/help-create-an-atlas-of-emotions-for-children/pica

¿QUÉ ES BLOXIE SCHOOL?

Bloxie School es una comunidad de expertos que inspira y potencia el talento de las personas a través del conocimiento práctico.

Para hacerlo, nos apoyamos en la tecnología. A través de nuestra nuestra plataforma https://www.bloxie.co las personas pueden acceder a cursos, eventos, contenidos y oportunidades profesionales en mercadeo, negocios, habilidades y tecnología.

 

¿CÓMO LO HAREMOS?

A través de un programa de formación que hemos creado, llamado PATH (Programa Avanzado de Tendencias y Habilidades). Con este programa, buscamos empoderar (de manera práctica) a 2000 jóvenes con habilidades digitales altamente relevantes en el mercado laboral actual, con la finalidad de impulsar sus carreras, proyectos y emprendimientos.  

El programa cuenta con 5 áreas de formación: Marketing Digital, Negocios, Finanzas, Ventas y Habilidades. Al finalizar el programa, los beneficiarios contarán con:  un oficio altamente demandado local e internacionalmente, certificación avalada por expertos y empresas altamente reconocidas en el país y acceso a numerosas oportunidades profesionales dentro de una comunidad de +200 empresas aliadas y +4000 estudiantes que pertenecen a la comunidad Bloxie.
 

 

 

¿A DÓNDE VA TU APORTE?

Nuestra intención es formar a 2000 jóvenes a través de 6 cohortes del programa PATH, distribuidas a lo largo de un año. Tu aporte va a ir dirigido a financiar las becas de cada uno de los beneficiarios que van a formar parte de cada PATH.

Nosotros visionamos un país que trabaja en equipo, una sociedad empoderada para lograr los cambios que necesita y que participa en pro de las necesidades de su prójimo. De gente con propósito, apasionada con lo que hace y de fuertes principios. Formando a estos 2000 jóvenes, estamos convencidos de que aportaremos las semillas necesarias para que esa visión se haga realidad.

 

¿CÓMO APOYAR?

A través de tu donación. Cada donación marca la diferencia y suma un granito de arena a este sueño que queremos hacer realidad.

 

AGRADECIMIENTOS

Queremos agradecer enormemente a EPIX y al Impact Hub Caracas por ser aliados clave para la realización de esta campaña.

 

PREGUNTAS

¿Tienes alguna duda adicional? escríbenos a info@bloxie.co y nos pondremos en contacto contigo a la brevedad posible. 

¡Muchas gracias!

• Unique School Fundraising Program

Our company's mission is to develop a school fundraising program that educates, inspires, and empowers students to approach positive change and personal growth from the Inside Out! We are so excited, with your help, to breathe life into this much-needed program.

Our products include simple everyday items such as water bottles, lanyards, pens, and wooden signs which are enhanced with powerful positive messages that promote self-confidence, self-control, and self-worth as well as our unique ""Power of I AM... Collection""

Outside Change is an Inside Job, I Believe in Myself, and  I AM... Worthy, Successful, Healthy, and Focused are just a few examples of the messages our children will be exposed to on a regular daily basis.

The crisis that parents and children are currently facing with children's anxiety, cyber-bullying, teen suicide, and the opioid crisis is overwhelming, to say the least. My personal heartache took me from why is this happening to what can I do to help. This began the journey of creating INSIDE OUT! Our company's products work as a constant reminder to shift to a more positive mindset,

We believe in spreading this important message, ""Outside Change is an Inside Job"", meaning your true power lies within you, will encourage our youth to define and empower themselves from within, rather than allowing others to influence their self-confidence and well being.
The Problem:
<ul>
<li><h3><span style=""font-family: benton-sans, Helvetica, sans-serif
column5: >Children need to be deep-rooted in self-confidence, self-worth,  and self-control to effectively process the ongoing negative impact of today's society.

column1: •  To develop, launch, and market a ""School Fundraising Program"" that is geared specifically to educate, inspire, and empower our youth to approach change and personal growth from a positive internal mindset.
• Funds are needed to hire a professional photographer, videographer, web designer, graphic designer, and marketing team.
The Solution:
<ul>
• Your campaign donation will allow Inside Out to breathe life into a much-needed School Fundraising Program that will enhance and positively impact the lives and minds of many.
• Hiring professionals to assist in each stage of development.
• Purchasing power
• All printed materials (brochures, mailings, informational packages, and postage)
<h3><span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
You have the power, with your contribution, to potentially save the life of a child.

Imagine being part of a positive movement where your donation promotes individuals to become more confident and empowered through conscious internal growth. To get our positive message to become a mainstream mindset, we need your help as campaign backers to support the growth of our company. Although our passion and message are strong, our funds are limited. Your contribution has the potential to help all those who interact with our brand. Please join us on our journey and mission to put this message in the hands of our schools and the hearts and minds of our youth.
Other Ways You Can Help
<ul>
<li><span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column2: >Follow, share, and like us on Facebook and Instagram.

column1: <li><span style=""font-family: benton-sans, Helvetica, sans-serif
column3: >Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the message of our company and campaign.

Short Summary

Six years ago we launched our first Indiegogo campaign to raise funds to start one of the first, kids-focused maker labs in North America. Today, we are excited to launch our second campaign to help fund our design, make, play curriculum development and to help fund additional locations in Vancouver and Hong Kong.
<h3>What We Need &amp

We have some great perks at amazing discounts whether it is our popular STEM/STEAM spring and summer camp, our PD days or in-school programs. We will be using funds raised to further develop out our project kits and a digital maker software platform. We will also be using 10% of funds raised to contribute towards our Access2Innovate foundation that help kids who face various barriers to accessing quality technology programs.
The Impact

More than 5000 students have participated in our maker programs and we are proud to see kids that were just eight or nine years old when we started blossom into amazing inventors, creators, artists, engineers and entrepreneurs in their teenage years. We have brought our maker programs to numerous schools, libraries and other places in the community.

If you aren't able to contribute directly to our campaign, we appreciate any help spreading the word through social media or word of mouth! Thanks for your support!

10 years after its inception, it’s time for the Keefak mobile application to grow up and go beyond what we can do as a benevolent unfunded team. This has been thoroughly analyzed over the course of this year
column2: here's what motivates it and the roadmap ahead.

column1: As you may know, we developed Keefak as a solution to a desire felt by Lebanese abroad, like myself, to preserve and transmit our dialect to our children and companions. I had the idea when my first daughter was born in 2009. The project was then brought to life in 2012 thanks to my brother Joseph El Khoury and an awesome benevolent crew mainly composed of: Pascale Aoudé, Tony Asmar, Antoine Fleyfel and Rawad Rahmé who spent countless hours and days on the project
column2: without forgetting all those who helped and assisted here and there, in one way or another, along the road.

column1: Keefak allows for French, English, Spanish and Brazilian Portuguese translation into Lebanese and it works through phonetic transliteration with no need to know the Arabic script. For example, the word Keefak? is the translation of ‘How are you?’ and is written in Latin letters.

The hundreds of testimonials we’ve been getting from our users tell an ever growing story of a solid bridge being built between Lebanon and its diaspora around the world: “My grandfather came from Lebanon to Brazil and I’m rescuing my roots by learning Arabic”, “Mes séjours réguliers à Beyrouth seront encore mieux grâce à vous”,  “Une super appli pour que les enfants n’ayant pas grandi au Liban comprennent la langue maternelle de leur maman ou papa”, and many more.

Along the way, we discovered that Keefak has also been used as a ‘language passport’ by foreign expats working in the Middle East. We have a lot of American, European and South Asian testimonials showing how much Keefak helped them integrate and enhance their career advancement in the GCC countries. In fact, Lebanese is a dialect largely understood in the Arab world.
We also were approached to derive a Keefak version for migrant domestic workers in Lebanon. By bridging the language barrier, we believe that the employer-employee relationship gets healthier.
Keefak, which now counts more than 100 000 downloads worldwide, is totally free and shall remain free of charge on all platforms, namely the Apple App Store and the Google Play Store.
Keefak has always been bootstrapped and supported by its ever-growing worldwide users. We have never had any external support whatsoever.

The excellent feedback we’ve been getting from our users along the fair expectations they’ve been expressing: more content, more multimedia, more supported languages, addition of Arabic script, ... brought us to decide to reach out to Lebanon lovers out there and raise up to 100 000 € through crowdfunding.
We particularly love this funding channel because it’s inclusive, it has a worldwide reach and it’s tailor made to each individual’s or organization’s financial capabilities.
The collected funds will be used to:
<ul>
• Add new content and courses to the app, along with their translation into French, English, Spanish, Portuguese and German
• Add multimedia to the different courses, thus enhancing the learning experience
• Rethink the application’s front end and back end
• Make the app kid-friendly
• Develop a social media “chatbot” to make the learning experience even more interactive
• Launch a global and sustainable marketing campaign to reach new potential users worldwide.

If you’re a Lebanon lover, if you share our aim to bring the Lebanese diaspora closer to the homeland, if you want to preserve and transmit our Levantine dialect to the upcoming generation, if you simply want to put “Lebanity” in one single app, please share the word and support our campaign.
Thank you from the heart!
Hadi El Khoury

Short Summary
My name is Katalin and have a PhD in cartography. I spent more than 5 years in research of 3D cartographic representation methods and how to create 3D interactive maps.

I think I have nice results, but it is not used in everyday life. After university I couldn't continue my research, and create real products out of my maps. It makes me sad, that many years of hard work was for nothing and could not be used for any purposes.
Therefore I decided to create my own project, a mobile application. I can accomplish here the results of my research and I'm motivated so much now.
<h3>What We Need &amp

I need 30,000 USD to create the project without compromise. With this money I can create all maps of the 6 continents: North and South America, Europe, Asia, Africa and Australia. All the maps will have many thematic layers.

I created the demo application myself, but I'm not a developer. I have to pay for an experienced programmer to create a bug free and good working application for IOS and Android. I'd like to pay for the design to my cousin, as right now he is working for me but for free.
The user have to download the maps and print them to use the app. All the maps can be downloaded from a website, so I need a website too. I have to pay for IOS store, and for the tracking SDK Vuforia
I guarantee the domain for 5 years of the website and the stores, and the updates if its needed..

If I don't reach my goal, I still make the application. I pay for obligatory costs even if nothing will be left for me. This project is important to me, I want to create it. It is a big help if I don't have to pay the costs on my own.
If my project is over-funded I will create more thematic layers, and all the maps will be avaiable  at Elsa""s website with interactive layers and create a globe map with thematic layers.
You support is really important for me, because the app will be free to use. I won't make any money on it later. This project is pre-funded.
The Impact

These maps can be used for educational purposes. Nowadays it's really hard for teachers to attract children’s attention. My interactive maps will help to teachers at school but they will be able to be used at home too.
My maps are supporting expanded learning, they are interactive which is a better form of learning than frontal education.
Knowing the world, the continents, the geography is the base of environmentally conscious thinking. I think I can help with my maps.
The app would be available worldwide, also in 3rd world countries, where the quality of digital curriculum is low. This app makes equal circumstances of learning for all.
<h3>Risks &amp
I have the knowledge to create the apps. I know the developer who has experience in AR application and ready to work with me. We have all the knowledge, we only need help with the funding.
Other Ways You Can Help
I'm really thankful if you can share my project. You can share indiegogo project, but you can find also in facebook (https://www.facebook.com/elsa3dmap)

We're bringing to life a new ""inquiry-based"" middle school in Victoria... and to do so, we need your help!


To help prepare our youth for the coming era of innovation we need to think differently about education and learning. Instead of testing and measuring knowledge, we need to develop the skills and character traits that matter more tomorrow - creativity, collaboration and critical thinking.

$220,000 will launch the next inquiry school in Victoria BC.
​The funds raised will go towards providing:
• salaries for specialized inquiry educators
• location upgrades for a suitable venue for youth
<li>tools &amp
column2: equipment to allow the exploration of what matters to them

column1: • Initial development of custom inquiry software

Our perks are designed to furnish the school with the basics, allowing students to begin their inquiries on Day 1 of school this September 2018. This includes allowing families who are first on board to apply their support of this campaign directly toward a significantly reduced tuition cost at the school--now that is a perk! 

In the unlikely event that our complete goal is not reached, our school will still open it’s doors with less of the non-essential amenities for students to have access to on day 1.

 

 

 


Asking questions — not just any questions, but ones that kids honestly care about — is at the heart of inquiry-based learning. The teacher’s role is to guide learners in finding the answers themselves, through research and connecting with experts in the community, and to encourage them to ask new questions along the way. In pursuing the answers to their questions, kids expand their grasp of the issue by drawing in ancillary content that then broadens their understanding of the topic under study.

Project-based learning (where students complete complex tasks that result in a realistic product or presentation to an audience), problem-based learning (where students use complex problems and cases to actively build their knowledge) and design-based instruction (where students create products that require understanding and application of knowledge) are all forms of inquiry-based learning.

Inquiry-based learning is a way of constructing meaning that is driven more by a learner’s questions than by a teacher’s lessons. Through the stages of inquiry, this constructivist approach to education imparts the skills of how to learn rather than simply learning for learning’s sake. Now doesn’t that sound like a better way to learn?

What’s the same and what’s different?
Let’s start with what’s the same: you’ll still be able to attend an inquiry high school or a traditional high school, you’ll still be able to receive a BC Dogwood Certificate, regardless of the path you choose
column2: and you can go to college, university, or into any other career path after an inquiry based program, just as you can with most other traditional schools.
column5: >We're so excited to share this interview we captured with Rethink School's FIRST pre-registering family, Christy &amp
column6:
her child Simon, who are SO excited about having this school available that they're actually registering Simon EARLY EARLY! Given their super-keener nature, we asked if they'd be game to talk about their decision. Enjoy, and if you feel so compelled, your SHARES are greatly appreciated!

 



download this comparison chart here!
 

 


Increasingly, young people are graduating from high school — even from college and university — vastly unprepared to cope with the challenges presented by the real world. Anxiety rates have shot up as young people grapple with a shifting job market, the responsibility of living independently and managing their finances, loneliness and isolation, insecurity in face-to-face interactions, the relentlessly high bar that social media represents, and a lack of self-awareness that ultimately leads them down unfulfilling career paths.

column1: <li>School based on 5-year proven inquiry model identical to <u><a href=""http://www.learningstorm.org"" rel=""noopener nofollow"">Pacific School of Innovation &amp
• For the last two years, Rethink Thinking has planned and hosted successful events focused on inquiry learning for students and educators.
• 250 youth attended the inaugural Rethink Thinking Summit where 21 inquiry projects were spawned by youth from the region.
• 150 educators from all over BC attended a Pro D Day on “Bringing Inquiry into the Classroom.”

• Partnering with Royal Roads University, Real English Victoria, and Pearson College, Rethink has organized an immersive summer residency program for international students called the “Global Explorers Program.”

Opening a school is challenging and we believe to successfully achieve our goal, we will require people with varied expertise. Educational knowledge and know-how is key but so is understanding of organizational structure, development of a sustainable business model and collaborative integration into the community. Rethink Thinking has a team of people with the unique combination of business and education skills and background to make this work for our community for generations to come.

One of the challenges is finding the best-fit team with the values and experience necessary to be successful educators within the inquiry learning model. There’s an inquiry mindset that our hiring process needs to incorporate to find the right teachers, principal, and administration that can adapt to the unpredictability and ever-changing needs of learners in this model. 

Another challenge is securing a location that is not a traditional institutional school with a large building filled with rooms stuck away in a suburban area. Our school needs to be closer to the community, businesses, and nature, where real life happens.

 

 

 

 

 

What if I want to get a refund for tuition while the campaign is going on?
Purchasing tuition through the crowdfund campaign is showing your commitment to the education model and community that we’re bringing together. We understand that family situations change and there may be a situation where you need to ask for a refund. Our refund policy allows this to happen up to July 1, 2018. There will be no questions asked and we respect the reasons you have. We may be curious and ask why to learn from each family’s situation.

What would happen if our child couldn't/didn't attend next fall - could we transfer our pre-registration to a future year, or a different family for their child?  Or  request a refund?
We appreciate your consideration to purchase tuition in advance. The “Super Keeners” registration option is a one time fee and can be applied for any future year, such as September 2019. Your tuition payment would be held in trust and utilized the first year your child attends. If your child is unable to attend, as in you have left the city or changed your mind, your tuition fee would be paid back in full. Or optionally, you could recommend another child receive the tuition and they would be enrolled based on our pre-registration process for that intake year.

 

 


What are the basic details about this middle school?
Our middle school will be welcoming learners entering grades 6 to 8 (typically ages 10-14) for kids in the Victoria area, will be located within 10 minutes of downtown Victoria and will have a maximum capacity of 100 learners. A principle of the inquiry methodology is that learning is not linear, age or grade specific with this in mind we are applying as a middle school with the BC Ministry of Education.

Is it possible to learn more by connecting with the team in person?
Yes! We are hosting ongoing parent information sessions to answer your questions. Sessions will have Jeff Hopkins from PSII to explain inquiry learning and the Rethink Thinking team to share additional details about the school. Spaces are limited - RSVP for the next info session here!

Is Jeff Hopkins opening this school? Is this a second PSII?
No, this Victoria-based middle school is being started by Rethink Thinking. Like us, Jeff simply wants more inquiry learning in the world! As a mentor and supporter to this project, Jeff provides his complete inquiry methodology and consults on the delivery of the education model, including the hiring and training of teachers.

Why is the school only 100 students maximum?
This unique inquiry methodology maximizes student-teacher relationships by limiting the size to a maximum of 100 students. This allows each teacher to help guide each student's inquiries.

How does body movement and being in nature get incorporated?
Physical movement, social time, and body breaks are very important, even more so for middle schoolers. We have an Education Team of some of the brightest teachers in Victoria designing the ""Day in a Life"" at the next inquiry school and nature/body movement/morning walks are an integral piece to the culture and curriculum. More details on this coming soon.

What learner-to-teacher ratio are you intending for Rethink School?
Following in the well-documented footsteps of Pacific School of Innovation &
column2:
Inquiry, this school will have maximum 13 learners to each guide (teacher). The point of the school having a maximum of 100 kids is to allow each teacher to touch and know what each child is working on.

Who is Rethink Thinking?
Rethink Thinking is a Canadian non-profit foundation that began two years ago with the Summit, Canada’s 1st inquiry-led youth summit with Sir Ken Robinson which hosted 250 kids in the first year. The non-profit was co-founded by Rebecca Kirstein, Tom Hudock and Jeff Hopkins.

Short Summary

Teodoro Rios Jr has been in healthcare for 16 years.  During his career in healthcare Teodoro has on boarded and trained many professionals. One consistent issue he observed was that many times individuals were inadequately trained during their initial coursework. This led to a need to retrain the healthcare professionals on the basics and department specific regulations and tasks.

During his time in healthcare academia, he realized the probable cause to the lack of knowledge by healthcare professionals was due to the outdated approach to teaching and learning. Subsequently, Teodoro wanted to open his own organization focusing on the quality and need of qualified healthcare professionals.

The campaign is to gain startup capital for Rios Health Academy, LLC. This will be a vocational school specializing on providing quality education to healthcare professions. Individuals who contribute to the campaign will assist in developing a more innovative way to educate quality healthcare professionals to improve overall healthcare needs in Pennsylvania.
<h3>What We Need &amp

We will need a total of $65,000 for startup costs. These funds will go to working capital to allow for the organization to purchase supplies, equipment or obtain necessary instructional software. We will provide any contributor with a discount on our programs when they attend the Academy. Individuals that contribute $500 will receive a 5% discount on the tuition of any program. Individuals that contribute $1000 will receive a 10% discount on the tuition of any program. Individuals that contribute $5000 will receive 25% discount on the tuition of any program.
If the campaign does not reach its entire goal we will be utilizing the funds that are received for working capital still.
The Impact

Individuals who contribute to the campaign will allow for the Academy to begin its work in Pennsylvania. Teodoro has instructed students in his career focusing on quality of education. During his career he has successfully run a program that has resulted in a 95% pass rate on certification exams, and 95% employment rate for graduates. Teodoro will be bringing this same effort and mindset to Rios Health Academy as its owner &
column2: CEO building each program from the ground up focusing on the quality of education to provide quality healthcare professionals to health care faculties throughout the state.

column1: <h3>Risks &amp
If the campaign does not obtain the necessary funds it will be limited in the programs it will be able to provide. Other risks are limited supplies, equipment, and reference materials for students.
Other Ways You Can Help

For those individuals who are unable to contribute to the campaign please feel free to speak about it to your friends, families, and coworkers. Please put the word out and direct them to use Indiegogo. When spreading the word to others please ensure you use the Indiegogo share tools.

Teodoro Rios Jr has been in healthcare for 16 years.  During his career in healthcare Teodoro has on boarded and trained many professionals. One consistent issue he observed was that many times individuals were inadequately trained during their initial coursework. This led to a need to retrain the healthcare professionals on the basics and department specific regulations and tasks.

During his time in healthcare academia, he realized the probable cause to the lack of knowledge by healthcare professionals was due to the outdated approach to teaching and learning. Subsequently, Teodoro wanted to open his own organization focusing on the quality and need of qualified healthcare professionals.

The campaign is to gain startup capital for Rios Health Academy, LLC. This will be a vocational school specializing on providing quality education to healthcare professions. Individuals who contribute to the campaign will assist in developing a more innovative way to educate quality healthcare professionals to improve overall healthcare needs in Pennsylvania.
What We Need & What You Get

We will need a total of $65,000 for startup costs. These funds will go to working capital to allow for the organization to purchase supplies, equipment or obtain necessary instructional software. We will provide any contributor with a discount on our programs when they attend the Academy. Individuals that contribute $500 will receive a 5% discount on the tuition of any program. Individuals that contribute $1000 will receive a 10% discount on the tuition of any program. Individuals that contribute $5000 will receive 25% discount on the tuition of any program.
If the campaign does not reach its entire goal we will be utilizing the funds that are received for working capital still.
The Impact

Individuals who contribute to the campaign will allow for the Academy to begin its work in Pennsylvania. Teodoro has instructed students in his career focusing on quality of education. During his career he has successfully run a program that has resulted in a 95% pass rate on certification exams, and 95% employment rate for graduates. Teodoro will be bringing this same effort and mindset to Rios Health Academy as its owner & CEO building each program from the ground up focusing on the quality of education to provide quality healthcare professionals to health care faculties throughout the state.
Risks & Challenges
If the campaign does not obtain the necessary funds it will be limited in the programs it will be able to provide. Other risks are limited supplies, equipment, and reference materials for students.
Other Ways You Can Help

My name is Megan Ott and I am pursuing a Masters of Vocal Performance degree at North Park University in Chicago.

I have been selected to participate in an intensive 3 week performance workshop in Orvieto, Italy. The program is comprised of daily musical coachings, lessons, master and Italian classes. I will also have the opportunity to perform and share music with the people of Italy in several historic locations in the region. 

Donations of all sizes are greatly appreciated! Thank you so much for all your love and support.

From makers to makers.
We love electronics and especially Arduino
based projects. We tried many different prototyping boards and shields and
weren't satisfied.
If you try to use newer SMDs in your project
you'll realize those components are not supported the right way. You might end
up using adptares like these
But there is smarter way to use the space in

your prototyping board.
It's called proto-e.
Imagine plenty of soldering places for
different types of SMDs. Combine it with places for good old Through Hole (TH)
components and here is how idea about proto-e was born.
And we are trying to turn our idea into a
product which will help makers and Arduino lovers to shrinkify their projects.
Featured on Graycut
Still thinking to support us?

column5: >Soldering those tiny parts is not easy and

column1: this board is here to help you with it.
Are you passionate about new Arduino project?
We have more good news for you. Proto-e's layout is fully compatible with
Arduino UNO R3 and Leonardo boards.
Top side                                                               Bottom
side
It means you can use proto-e for making your
Arduino project... or your own Arduino shield.
And the now the real challenge - make your

Arduino compatible board using
proto-e. Yes it's possible.
Let's take a look on specs and details:
Dimesions 5.5 x 6.5 cm - Arduino UNO R3 compatible layout (pinout)
And the next question is probably What can I
possibly do with it?

Many things. Many Arduino things.

Start from soldering. Not that hard if you have right PCB. Trust me.
Let me show you one simple Arduino project,
suitable for education.
Whole project with coding is described on our

blog at:
http://proto-electronics.net/blog-en/6-using-proto-e-for-education
And if you're thinking about
projects with proto-e - we are ready to offer you:
Simple math: more you buy - the cheaper it gets!
Al orders will be processed and
shipped on time, no risks, no extra charges.
Is this the end of the story? Big

NO!
This project is beginnig of a small bussines which will be support for makers
community and fast growing IoT.
We are listening... if you have something to say... suggest some improvements,
modifications to make this project better.
After this campaign is over proto-e will be available for sale on our website http://proto-electronics.net
We welcome every contribution and
any other help.
We welcome any new IoT project.
Thank You,
Proto-Electronics team

Short Summary

The TWDK team was put together by a British rocket scientist who helped Europe to land on a comet, and includes scientists and writers with backgrounds in different branches of science. Their mission? To explain the questions scientists are trying to answer right now, how they're doing it, and why we haven't been able to do so already.

Now the team wants to help high school teachers to engage their pupils with the STEM*  curriculum, by showing how the lessons they're being taught relate to real scientific research happening today. For free.

Our first set of lesson plans are on a topic that we think it is vital for young people to understand - climate change. The decade from 2000-2010 was the warmest on record, and this warming is contributing to sea level rises, loss of ice in the arctic and antarctic, and changes in weather patterns all over the globe. Climate change is something that will affect all of us over our lifetimes, so it is important that young people understand not only what we do know about the subject, but also what our limitations are in understanding it.

*Science, Technology, Engineering and Maths

column1: Frank Stark is the graphic artist responsible for creating those poor bears and spearing the Earth with a stick. He's awesome, and promises no bears were forced to learn differential equations for our project. He hasn’t apologised for freezing and stabbing our beautiful planet, though.

We’re also working with Agnes Becker from We Are Stardust to create a unique greetings card designed exclusively for this campaign. We are stardust is an online shop for the curious-minded, specialising in handmade cards inspired by scientific discovery and the mysteries of nature. All items are made from sustainable materials: The cards are Forestry Stewardship Council certified, so you can be sure you are not contributing to the destruction of the world’s forests, the envelopes are made from recycled paper and the cellos are biodegradable. Here's a preview of the artwork:

Thomas Egense is a mathematician with an ""evil fractal laboratory"", in which he creates stunning artworks using mathematical (fractal) equations and prints them onto canvas or glass. He's given us permission to offer a number of his biology-themed Fractal Flames prints at a significant discount from their retail price. Each piece is visually stunning, and a powerful reminder of the link between mathematics and nature.
<i><div style=""text-align: center
column6: >Be sure to tell us which image you want. Names from left to right (top row): seaweed, seahorse, jellyfish, (bottom row): turtle, trilobyte, octopus.

column1: We're looking for 2,000 of your finest Sterling pounds, which we shall use to finance our evil volcano lair safe from the rising flood waters pay our team for the necessary research and writing expenses (everybody needs to eat, after all), plus the costs of the artwork.
The Impact

We believe that science should be taught the way it actually happens - as a set of questions and unknowns that people are working to understand. Science is a process, not a set of facts, and getting this across is vital when trying to inspire the next generation of scientists. The UK curriculum (key stage 4) even states that:
""Pupils should be taught ... that there are some questions that science cannot currently answer, and some that science cannot address""

We want to give teachers a way of covering this element of the curriculum whilst still building on knowledge and understanding in other areas of their subject. To achieve this, we will create a set of interrelated but stand alone lesson plans, to help teachers to approach the topic of climate change in different subject areas. They will link into topics specified in the curriculum, and build on this knowledge. This gives teachers maximum flexibility to use a single lesson, or several as an interdisciplinary series spanning multiple subjects.

We believe that these lesson plans will allow students to think about both climate change and science in a new way. By covering the topic in several different subjects, they will realise that the different branches of science are interconnected, understand the importance of collaboration, and the practical applications of science. They will also begin to understand that scientists don’t always have all the answers to a problem, and that the point of science is to continue to ask questions and seek evidence. We hope that by humanising the process of science we will encourage young people to become more engaged in the subject, and inspire more of them to consider a career in science, technology, engineering or maths (STEM).
Risks &

At Things We Don’t Know, we don’t shy away from taking a risk. Climate change is a contentious topic in some circles, and one some teachers may find difficult to approach. We mitigate these risks as much as possible by taking a strictly neutral approach to the subject material, explaining the phenomena but placing no blame and pointing no fingers, and by working closely with teachers to ensure our materials are as useful as possible by matching the content of the syllabus that they need to teach.

It’s possible we won’t reach our goal, but the modular nature of our plan means we can cut down on the number of topics we cover without sacrificing quality of those we do. If we don't reach our goal, then we’ll have some tough decisions to make about which topics we can’t afford to cover, but it won’t stop us entirely.

It’s also possible we’ll smash our goal, and we have a list of extra topics for us to cover if this should happen. With the extra cash we’ll also be able to add more supplementary materials (like videos) to accompany the lesson plans.
Other Ways You Can Help
We understand that not everyone is in a position to donate money to make this project happen, but there are other ways you can support us

This gives teachers maximum flexibility to use a single lesson, or several as an interdisciplinary series spanning multiple subjects.

We believe that these lesson plans will allow students to think about both climate change and science in a new way. By covering the topic in several different subjects, they will realise that the different branches of science are interconnected, understand the importance of collaboration, and the practical applications of science. They will also begin to understand that scientists don’t always have all the answers to a problem, and that the point of science is to continue to ask questions and seek evidence. We hope that by humanising the process of science we will encourage young people to become more engaged in the subject, and inspire more of them to consider a career in science, technology, engineering or maths (STEM).

At Things We Don’t Know, we don’t shy away from taking a risk. Climate change is a contentious topic in some circles, and one some teachers may find difficult to approach. We mitigate these risks as much as possible by taking a strictly neutral approach to the subject material, explaining the phenomena but placing no blame and pointing no fingers, and by working closely with teachers to ensure our materials are as useful as possible by matching the content of the syllabus that they need to teach.

It’s possible we won’t reach our goal, but the modular nature of our plan means we can cut down on the number of topics we cover without sacrificing quality of those we do. With the extra cash we’ll also be able to add more supplementary materials (like videos) to accompany the lesson plans.
Other Ways You Can Help
We understand that not everyone is in a position to donate money to make this project happen, but there are other ways you can support us

Hope - Feed the Youth // Keep them in School

Hope was started as an idea to try and raise funds for the less fortunate youth in Bulacan, Philippines giving them Hope for a better future. I will personally be visiting these communities and the families that we are going to give a brighter future.

We have partnered up with an organization that provides a holistic approach that aims to end poverty. 
Many children from a young age leave school to work as they do not have adequate nutrition and would rather work to make sure they have just enough food to sustain themselves. If these children had enough nutrition in them we hope to keep them in school and give them a basic primary education.
Proceeds raised will go directly to a fund called Kusina ng Kaligna ~ which directly translates from Tagalog as Kitchen and Shelter.
Every approx 100SGD will be able to feed 1 child for an entire year.
Every approx
column2:
>10,000SGD will allow us to build another kitchen in a local school and feed 100 children for the year.
GK tries to adopt a holistic approach where food from the kitchen comes from nearby local farms where families under the GK program are given a livelihood through farming and feeding their children.

WHY WE DO IT
Many poor children, 7 out of 10, are unable to enjoy studying, cannot focus on class or are unable to attend school because they have to scavenge for food or work very early in life to help their families. They become too tired or sickly and most often cannot afford to receive quality education because of poverty. 

We believe that every child has the right to learn how to read and write, to be taught the right values that will equip them for a better life. 
 
GK’s Child and Youth Development program or CYD seeks to provide a values-based early childhood education for young children in GK communities.  The youth are also helped by developing their potentials through a values-based formation program. Through the arts, sports and other technical and academic skills trainings, values are taught to every child in the community.

<span style=""background-color: initial
column2: >We are De Nieuwe Universiteit. We are a collective dedicated to the creation of a democratic university.

column1: <span style=""background-color: initial
column2:
>
Het Maagdenhuis was the place where we gathered and where we manifested this ideal. Unfortunately police and government force took us over on the 11th of april and disabled the ongoing of our planned Festival of Humanities and Sciences.

column1: <ul>
But! We have found a new location for our festival: the Felix Meritis on the Keizersgracht in Amsterdam. The festival will take place on the 3rd of May from 10.00 until 22.00.
In different rooms we will focus on the themes of diversity, the role of the university in society, and civil disobedience through lectures, workshops and panel discussions.
With this gathering we aim to further develop and share our ideals and ideas for the future.

To realize this festival we need your help! We must raise funds for the location, for the staff of Felix Meritis (ushers, technicians, cleaners), and for production costs so that we can create flyers, banners, red squares, signs, and dress the rooms of Felix Meritis.
Let's create this educational event together. Our gratitude runs deep!
In case you cannot help in the form of a donation, you can help by sharing this page!
Thank you very much, and we hope to see you on the third of May!

","We are De Nieuwe Universiteit. We are a collective dedicated to the creation of a democratic university.

Het Maagdenhuis was the place where we gathered and where we manifested this ideal. Unfortunately police and government force took us over on the 11th of april and disabled the ongoing of our planned Festival of Humanities and Sciences.
But! We have found a new location for our festival: the Felix Meritis on the Keizersgracht in Amsterdam. The festival will take place on the 3rd of May from 10.00 until 22.00.
In different rooms we will focus on the themes of diversity, the role of the university in society, and civil disobedience through lectures, workshops and panel discussions.
With this gathering we aim to further develop and share our ideals and ideas for the future.

To realize this festival we need your help! We must raise funds for the location, for the staff of Felix Meritis (ushers, technicians, cleaners), and for production costs so that we can create flyers, banners, red squares, signs, and dress the rooms of Felix Meritis.
Let's create this educational event together. Our gratitude runs deep!
In case you cannot help in the form of a donation, you can help by sharing this page!
Thank you very much, and we hope to see you on the third of May!
*please sign up by sending an e-mail to DNUfestival@gmail.com, with in the subject your name+last name+amount of places*
www.newuni.nl
~You can also transfer directly to NL24 ABNA 0625 3783 34~

Zoals je waarschijnlijk hebt vernomen is het Maagdenhuis op zaterdag 11 april ontruimd. Hierdoor heeft ons Festival der Wetenschappen niet plaats kunnen vinden in geplande vorm. Maar! Hiervoor hebben we een nieuwe locatie gevonden: De Felix Meritis op de Keizersgracht in Amsterdam.
Het festival zal plaatsvinden op 3 mei van 10.00 tot 22.00.

In verschillende zalen zullen de thema’s diversiteit, de rol van de universiteit in de samenleving, en burgerlijke ongehoorzaamheid worden aangekaart door middel van lezingen, workshops en paneldiscussies.

Dit festival is voor ons een manier om te laten zien dat we de idealen van De Nieuwe Universiteit op een constructieve manier kunnen tonen op een andere locatie dan het Maagdenhuis. Met deze samenkomst willen we onze idealen en ideeën voor de toekomst verder delen en laten ontwikkelen.

Om dit festival te realiseren hebben we jouw hulp nodig! We moeten kosten opbrengen voor de locatie, de werknemers van Felix Meritis (zaalwachters, technici, schoonmaak), en productiekosten voor de DNU om te zorgen voor flyers, banners, rode vierkantjes, bordjes, en het aankleden van ruimtes.
Laten we hier samen een prachtig en leerrijk evenement van maken. Onze dank is diep!
Als je niet kunt helpen met een donatie, kan je nog steeds helpen met het delen van deze pagina!
Hartelijke dank, en hopelijk zien we je op drie mei!
*aanmelden op DNUfestival@gmail.com, in onderwerp: naam+achternaam+aantal plaatsen*
www.newuni.nl
~Je kan ook rechtstreeks overmaken op NL24 ABNA 0625 3783 34~",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Amsterdam, Netherlands",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/festival-of-sciences-de-nieuwe-universiteit/pica
0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""> <h4>
The Problem:

Most Ghanaian children share these challenges on a daily basis:

“I wish our school was closer. Walking several miles each day is tiring.”
""I feel lost in the classroom but I can't ask questions because there are
so many of us in the classroom.""
""I don't know how long I can stay in school for because my parents need me
to bring home money.""
Their reality reflects a broken education system that makes it difficult for Ghanaian children to
receive a quality education, consequently making it impossible for them to fully

realize their dreams. The statistics paint a grim picture: despite the fact that most school age children in Ghana are enrolled in primary school, the quality of teaching and learning is so poor that many don't go to secondary school, and of those that go to secondary school many can't even read and write when they finish (WASSCE scores give evidence of this, also correlated with the region where students went to school), and only about 5% make it to the tertiary level<span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column2: >. In essence, very few are able to pursue their aspirations to become teachers, engineers, entrepreneurs, etc.

column1:
Ghana's educational system is in crisis and this is why Teach For Ghana was formed.

We are a group of dedicated Ghanaians who believe in the power of every single child to learn and make a difference if provided with the chance to achieve regardless of their socioeconomic background.
column6:
>Our Solution: 

The Teach For Ghana model provides a holistic solution to the current educational challenge in Ghana. Our solution starts with capable young Ghanaians who are passionate about educational reform.  We recruit recent college graduates, train and place them in classrooms in deprived rural communities for two years with on-going support to effect sustainable change in the form of:

  • Increased number of committed teachers in rural areas

column1:
• Quality teaching because our fellows will be fully accountable for their classrooms
  • Better community involvement because our fellows will live in the communities they serve

Our solution engages all major Ghanaian stakeholders and provides the motivation to build long-term solutions to the problem of educational inequity in the country. This comprehensive approach will ensure that challenges facing Ghanaians are addressed sustainably.

The image below paints a picture of how our fellows will enact and champion change in Ghana.

column5:
>Our Impact:

Our goal is to expand our presence to more than 105 schools impacting 15,000 students by the year 2021. Figure 2 below shows our expansion plan for the next three years.
column11:
>In 20 years, a prospering Teach For Ghana will have established an effective program that directly impacts the rural poor while transforming the national educational landscape.  Figure 3 below depicts how the Teach For Ghana fellows will be instrumental in that journey.



Fundraising Goal:

column1: Our target is to raise $60,000 by August 30, 2015. This will help
support the following key program elements:
i. Recruitment and matriculation
of 30 fellows for our first year
ii. Training program for our fellows
iii. Support 1,170 students for the 2016 academic year
By
raising $60,000, we will be much closer to meeting our 2015-2016 academic
year budget. This will enable us <span style=""background-color: initial
column2: >to introduce our fellows and school children to the best

column1: pedagogical approaches and help them develop into great future leaders.
<span style=""letter-spacing: 0px

In 2014-2015, we made great strides and experienced some exciting milestones. Below, we provide you unique insight into some of those moments from establishing government support of our program to receiving the Pershing Square Foundation Grant.

receive a quality education, consequently making it impossible for them to fully

realize their dreams. The statistics paint a grim picture: despite the fact that most school age children in Ghana are enrolled in primary school, the quality of teaching and learning is so poor that many don't go to secondary school, and of those that go to secondary school many can't even read and write when they finish (WASSCE scores give evidence of this, also correlated with the region where students went to school), and only about 5% make it to the tertiary level. In essence, very few are able to pursue their aspirations to become teachers, engineers, entrepreneurs, etc.

Ghana's educational system is in crisis and this is why Teach For Ghana was formed.We are a group of dedicated Ghanaians who believe in the power of every single child to learn and make a difference if provided with the chance to achieve regardless of their socioeconomic background. Our Solution: The Teach For Ghana model provides a holistic solution to the current educational challenge in Ghana. Our solution starts with capable young Ghanaians who are passionate about educational reform.  We recruit recent college graduates, train and place them in classrooms in deprived rural communities for two years with on-going support to effect sustainable change in the form of:Increased number of committed teachers in rural areas
Quality teaching because our fellows will be fully accountable for their classroomsBetter community involvement because our fellows will live in the communities they serve

Our solution engages all major Ghanaian stakeholders and provides the motivation to build long-term solutions to the problem of educational inequity in the country. This comprehensive approach will ensure that challenges facing Ghanaians are addressed sustainably.The image below paints a picture of how our fellows will enact and champion change in Ghana.

Our Impact:Our goal is to expand our presence to more than 105 schools impacting 15,000 students by the year 2021. Figure 2 below shows our expansion plan for the next three years.In 20 years, a prospering Teach For Ghana will have established an effective program that directly impacts the rural poor while transforming the national educational landscape.  Figure 3 below depicts how the Teach For Ghana fellows will be instrumental in that journey.Fundraising Goal:
Our target is to raise $60,000 by August 30, 2015. This will help
support the following key program elements:
i. Recruitment and matriculation
of 30 fellows for our first year
ii. Training program for our fellows
iii. Support 1,170 students for the 2016 academic year
By
raising $60,000, we will be much closer to meeting our 2015-2016 academic
year budget. This will enable us to introduce our fellows and school children to the best
pedagogical approaches and help them develop into great future leaders.
Progress-To-Date:

In 2014-2015, we made great strides and experienced some exciting milestones. Below, we provide you unique insight into some of those moments from establishing government support of our program to receiving the Pershing Square Foundation Grant.
Spread the Message:
Please join us to put a smile on the face of a Ghanaian child!  Consider using the following phrases as you share our work with your family, friends, and colleagues:
One day, all Ghanaian children will have access to an excellent education. Support TFG""
I give...they teach... Support TFG""
Developing leaders for Change. Support TFG""
Thank you for your support!",4.0,1,"1 Campaign

1. Our Mission

Poor children get poor education and so stay poor.  They are often forced into low paid, sometimes hazardous jobs at home or abroad.  Most village children in Southeast Asia have not learned to speak English and do not know how to use computers and the internet as a way to learn.  These children never get the chance to reach their full potential.
Openmind Projects - a Thai non-profit organization
Openmind Projects was launched in 2002 with the objective of improving education opportunities in poor Thai villages with the help of IT.
In Southeast Asia a divide exists between those with access to education resources and those without.  It is most obvious between the rich urban areas and poor, isolated villages.
More here: www.openmindprojects.org/about-openmind-projects.html
2. What do we do
Student camps and educating the young

Every year we organize two student camps with children from the Isan area of northeastern Thailand, the poorest region of the country. They range from 9 to 18 years of age and are generally from the poorer families in the region. Volunteers come from abroad to OMP and teach these children anything they themselves are good at, from medicine to engineering, English, IT and so on. Kids realize that education could be a way to improve their current situation. Needless to say they are open and eager to learn!
Each camp lasts for a week, and we receive about a hundred students a year.

Besides the knowledge, a valuable secondary benefit is that through our overseas volunteers students come into contact with a variety of foreign cultures and being exposed to different ways of thinking at an early age can open their minds to a whole range of new possibilities.  They will grow and plant the seeds for the future.
More here: www.openmindprojects.org/holiday-camp-volunteer.html#overview
Thailand and other countries
Besides our main Center in Nong Khai we have similar facilities in the West and South of the country. A total of 3 Centers in Thailand.
Aside from these we run projects in a host of neighboring countries such as: Laos, Cambodia and Nepal.

We usually rely on the volunteers donations to run these facilities and pay our personnel, but this depletes most of the allotted resources and any upgrades and improvements are made impossible.  This has been the situation for years and we would need to attract outside help to better our infrastructure.
More here: www.openmindprojects.org/volunteer-asia.html
3. Why we need your help
Our Training Center

Our Center is the heart of Openmind Projects.  This is where we reach out and invite young people from rice farming villages and factories to stay and learn for FREE for shorter or longer periods.  Many of our trainees have over the years gone on to study further, to better jobs or have gone back to help their friends and families at home.
The Center is where our staff work and some live too.
Here we arrange several holiday camps around the year.  They are free for poor, local students from Thailand, Laos, Cambodia and Myanmar.  Currently about a hundred student attend per year.

At the Center we also train our overseas volunteers before they go to join their assigned projects.  We carry out twelve 3-day training sessions per year.

Our Center is located in Nong Khai, Thailand, the gateway to Laos.
column5: >Ideally, we want to invite more trainees, volunteers and children to these camps.

column1: More here: http://www.openmindprojects.org/about-openmind-projects.html
Repairs and improvements needed

Our Center has served us well.  However, as time went by termites, camps, monsoon rains and other factors took their toll on our building.  Computers are old and the bedrooms, toilets and showers need repairs.  Ceilings are leaking and the roofs and windows need replacement.  Our outdoor kitchen needs better cooking and storing facilities.

And we need more room.  Several of our trainees and volunteers (sometimes 6 or more) sleep in each room, on floor mattresses or in bunk beds.  With additional space we can invite more trainees, volunteers and children to these camps and fewer people need to share a room.

Last but certainly not least, we need more and up to date IT equipment.  Many of our computers are now in deplorable state and definitely aren't the fastest ones on the planet.  It can be hard to teach children about computers when they are slow and unresponsive.  This too is an issue we want to address.  Part of the donations we receive will go to new hardware/equipment.
4. What we can do with your support
Our top priority right now is repairing and upgrading our main Center in Nong Khai.  With your support we’ll improve the following things:
<ol>
• 2 more bedrooms with 4 fans, 4 beds and 4 mattresses will cost us 60,000 Baht
• Improved and repaired showers (one for males, one for females), one more toilet will cost 50,000 Baht
• 12 more PCs and one more router for Wi-Fi will cost us 190,000 Baht
• Our outdoor kitchen needs one more stove, 2 new fridges and 2 more cabinets that will cost 65,000 Baht
• New ceilings (termite problems and leaking) for 5 bedrooms, our office and the hall will cost 60,000 Baht
• Awnings outside bedrooms (to keep bedrooms cooler and save energy) will cost 35,000 Baht
• Overall, long time termite protection will cost 30,000 Baht
<li>
Total 490,000 Baht, about $15,500 US
<div>
<div>
<h3 style=""font-weight: bold
<div style=""font-weight: bold
<div>
<b style=""font-weight: bold
column2:
>

5. Why we're crowd funding

Ever since we launched our NGO in 2002 we relied heavily on volunteer donations to sustain our activity. We also managed to expand but at a very slow pace since most of our resources went in keeping things going.

column1: Obviously, this is very uncertain territory and getting the necessary funds has proved to be a month to month challenge for years.
Fortunately, with sites like Indiegogo and Kickstarter we can now talk to people who want to help but can’t necessarily come to Thailand.
We believe in the good nature of people, their desire to help others, and have witnessed it time and time again with our volunteers. You can still help even if you’re far away.
<div style=""font-weight: bold
<h3 style=""font-weight: bold
<div>
<span style=""font-weight: bold
We’re not looking only for financial help but any kind of material donation is welcome.  You can contact us here: www.openmindprojects.org/contact-us.html
Lastly, you can tell your friends and family and help us get the word out!  Use the Indiegogo share tools and post on social media.
On behalf of the children in Thailand:  Thank you so much for your support!

column2: >A $10 donation will cover the cost to send one Liberian child to school for an entire week.

column1: A New Dimension of Hope
A New Dimension of Hope is a nonprofit organization
that addresses the issues of poverty and illiteracy as it pertains to less
fortunate children around the world.
Our mission is simple:
To give children in less fortunate countries unlimited
opportunities to improve their reading, writing and computer skills through education.

In 2012, A New Dimension of Hope received two acres of land from Troyah Town, and began construction immediately on a fully equipped school that would not only help the local children of Troyah Town, but hundreds of the children of neighboring villages.
School Project In Troyah, Town Liberia

Construction of the school was ultimately a success, and the school was completed in early 2014. However, due to the devastating outbreak of Ebola in West Africa, it was never able to open. The outbreak shut down schools for over 6 months and ultimately left over 5000 people dead. So now we need your help. With little infrastructure, remarkably low literacy rates, very high unemployment, and a massive amount of orphaned children, Liberia is in desperate need for people like you to offer support in any way you can.
Our Goal:

As things return to normal in Liberia, a New Dimension of Hope aims to have the school up and running by July 2015. And this means several things have to be done. With our 15,000 dollar goal, we will be able to not only open the school, but guarantee that over 350 African students have access to school supplies, meals, and an education they would not otherwise be provided, ensure that the teachers are paid reasonable wages.If we reach our goal, it not only opens the school, but keeps it operational for an entire year.

Initially the school will enroll 100 students for the first year. Eventually the school is projected to enroll more than 350 students. This will require six salaried teachers, an acting principal, and basic school supplies to all be established before the school can open its doors.

OUR MISSION
In our ongoing effort to promote education, this month

we traveled to Payita in Nagua, Dominican Republic, we will organize a three-day two-night visit. We will be renting a car and will reduce overall fees by staying at a volunteer’s house and pay for our own bags.
Located on the north of the Samana Peninsula, Nagua is
a small town that lies on the highway leading from Puerto Plata to the city of Samaná in the north coast of Dominican Republic.
During our current visit we had the opportunity to meet with
officials and group of parents and we were able to understand their needs and how
we can help.
In Payita, approximately 85 children between
ages of 5 and 13 years old are currently going to different schools around
the town.

Short Summary
Hello, everyone! My name is Keyona Cooper. I
am a rising senior at Shaw University, originally from Washington, DC. This
campaign was created to help me pay for summer classes at Shaw University. I am
enrolled at Shaw through the Durham C.A.P.E. program (an adult degree program
for nontraditional students) majoring in Social Work. I am a full time student
and have just completed an 18-credit hour semester with a 3.0 while working
full time. So that I can<span>meet
the qualifications to graduate May 2016,I am preparing to take a full course
load this summer! The only problem is that I do not have enough financial aid
to take a full course load. This is where your support is needed!
What
We Need
I
am asking for donations to help me pay for my summer classes by <b>June
12th, 2015. My summer bill is $2,959 but I only have $1,650 in student
loans to pay toward that cost. That leaves me with a balance of $1,326. <b>I
am asking for your help to raise $2,000 to cover the cost of my
remaining summer balance and needed textbooks.
The
Impact
Receiving
my Bachelor of Social Work has been a goal of mine since aging out of foster
care at age 21. My pursuit of higher education has been one of many starts and
stops, due to many life obstacles.
Nevertheless,
I have always remained determined to complete my education! If  I take on extra classes this summer, my dream
of earning a B.S.W. will finally be a reality in May 2016. But I can only do it
with your support.
Other
Ways You Can Help
Any
donation towards helping me reach this goal will be greatly appreciated.
However, I know that not everyone can donate. If you are unable to donate you
can still help me reach my goals by sharing the link to this page with as many
people as possible. Thank you so much for taking the time to read my story and
donating and/or sharing this page with others. For those that donate and leave
an email address I will send updates and personal e-cards announcing my

graduation in spring 2016!!!! 

You can view my current academic progress in the ""gallery"" tap
Thank
you, again!
Campaign Note
This campaign will be accepting donations after the
deadline of May 23<sup>rd</sup>. The deadline was created to ensure that all
funds raised will be distributed in time for me to use towards my summer

bill by June 12th.

am a rising senior at Shaw University, originally from Washington, DC. This
campaign was created to help me pay for summer classes at Shaw University. I am
enrolled at Shaw through the Durham C.A.P.E. program (an adult degree program
for nontraditional students) majoring in Social Work. I am a full time student

full time. So that I canmeet
