Short Summary
The Nowans Community Trust is a family run orphanage in
Oyugis, Kenya. 'Project Kenya' is a community Trust set up in 2010 to raise
money for the orphanage and local school,
The trust supports the children’s welfare and education
food, accommodation and school fees to provide them with basic needs throughout
their upbringing, thus ensuring a more secure future for the kids. All proceeds
will be going into aiding the construction of new classroom as currently, it
cannot support itself through the seasons. This classroom will greatly benefit
many children from Oyugis. Currently there are 250 students but this will be
able to increase with better facilities.
<h3>What We Need &amp
<div>
<span style=""background-color: initial
column2: >There are three of us that are heading out to Oyugis this summer to teach and to aid with the construction of the classroom. We are aiming to raise £1000.

column1: <div>£1000 would do so much for the school. It will not only lead to the completion of a solid classroom,<span style=""background-color: initial
column2: > but will also help to create self sufficiency within the conjoined Orphanage. The school and the orphanage are both in desperate need of funding, there are hundreds of children within Oyugis who are being supported by this organisation and these numbers will continue to grow.

column1: Our aim is to increase the well being of the children living within the orphanage and from the local area. It is also to create an environment that will allow for continual self support. Last year the group that headed out were able to put their donations towards livestock. This purchase has become invaluable as it creates an opportunity for trade, therefore food has become more readily available throughout the year.

If we do not hit our target of £1000 all of our funding will still be going towards the construction, but will not allow for completion. Regardless it will still be a huge aid for the school.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

The Nowans Community Trust are currently doing such a great thing out there and will continue to. They have  been an active organisation for around 5 years now and within that time they have provided and cared for many children, who without the trust would not have had anything.

The impact that your donations will have, is that it will continue to allow the Trust to spread it wings and grow, therefore increasing the amount of children to receive food, shelter and education. 

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks &

There are not really any risks that we will encounter as it is an ongoing project. But saying that if we where to reach our target, it would greatly help within the construction as we will be there to put the money to great use.

Other Ways You Can Help

The Nowans Community trust is a very small charity and would benefit greatly from general awareness.

It would be incredible if you where able to hit the share button. Other ways to help us would be to head to the website to see all the projects they are currently running and to tell everyone about it!!
http://nowanscommunitytrust.org/

Celebrating Palestinian Life and Culture!
<div>2 weeks to go. <span style=""background-color: initial
Palestine Unlocked: Oxford's first festival celebrating Palestinian history and culture will be held from 4th-21st June 2015 in Oxford, UK!
After months of planning, organising, and fundraising, we have amazing events lined-up! http://palestineunlocked.com/events/

We are a community group of volunteers who have been working hard on getting together this wide-ranging, enjoyable program of events and have managed to squeeze almost £4,000 of donations from our own pockets and personal contacts but these have now run dry.
<div><span style=""background-color: initial
<div><span style=""background-color: initial
column2:
>

Please help us make this festival a success, and make sure we can carry out our full program of events in order to bring enjoyment and understanding of Palestine to Oxford and beyond!

column1: Please help us make sure this festival will be the great success it deserves to be!
The Impact
<ul>

We will be sharing Palestinian history, life and culture with the people of Oxford and beyond. We feel that a celebration and enjoyment of this wonderful history and culture can go a long way in informing and educating people about the Palestinian cause.
<div><span style=""background-color: initial
column2: >It is only through the love and support of people like you that will enable us to share Palestine with Oxford.

column2: >Each and every donation helps, no matter how big or small.

column1:
Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you feel unable to contribute financially, please share our details on social media and with anyone you feel able and willing to contribute!

Rohingya Refugees Fund 

What A Relief is raising funds for the Rohingya Refugees that are now in Aceh, Indonesia. There are an estimate of 1500 refugess in 3 camps in Aceh. Their harrowing journey from Myammar nearly took the lives of the men, women and children on a sinking boat that was saved by the local fisherman.

We are working with RUMAN ACEH, a local NGO in Aceh that works with the refugees in the area of Trauma Healing. We are also working with a local NGO, Red Pencil to work on art therapy for the children and women of the refugee camp. The funds will go towards the trauma healing programs that will be implemented in October.
We have use first part of our funding effort for:
1. Building a community engagement house.
2. Providing Relief Items to the Refugees.
3. Sanitation and Water Program
4. Hygiene and Hair Cutting Programs
5. Bedding Items

We are a group of volunteers who are heading to the refugee camps on the 4th of June and we are looking at raising $10,000 for the needs of the refugees. This is the time that we come together as one to be of service to the people the world has somewhat forgotten. 

What We Need 

We will be utilizing the funds for the daily necessity of the refugees such as food, proper mattress for sleeping, books for children, medical supplies as well as items that will help to bring relief to the refugees. Our main programs will be in trauma healing and social enterprise that will help the community to rebuild their shattered life. As there are 1500 refugees in the 3 different camps, we will be needing more funds to sustain them indefinitely. As we will not know when the situation will get better for them and they are able to return home. As such, we are starting with a target of $10,000 for this trip. 

The Impact

This campaign will help elevate the misery of the refugees as well as provide the road to recovery. We are looking at sustainable farming that will help the refugees to grow their own food as well as providing basic education for the children.
Risks &
column2:
Challenges

Our challenge is to see that the project is sustainable and able to continue as long as the refugees are in need of help and support to get them back on their feet. We will look at other programs and work with local NGOs such as Ruman Aceh to ensure that help and support is provided for them.

column1:
Other Ways You Can Help

We are also looking at volunteers who are able to support us in medical mission, therapy for the children as well as expereicne humanitarians who are willing to share their expertise.

Wait, what are you doing?

So glad you asked! Our family has been supporting some families in Uganda, through Africa Family Rescue (AFR), for about a year. AFR shares Jesus with families in extreme poverty, through providing hope and dignity in the form of sponsorships that provide for health care, education, and the development of small businesses.

As we've become close friends with the founders of AFR (Ben and Melody Pahlow), we've become more and more convinced that our resources are going to the most worthy of causes. We have the opportunity to receive letters regularly from the families we sponsor, and their stories are so moving! Now, this June, Eden and I have the opportunity to go to Uganda, with the Pahlow's, and spend time with these precious families in person! There will be time to work with them, play with their kids, bring needed supplies, go to church with them...share life with them!

At the bottom of this page is a video from AFR, that I highly recommend. Their work, that we get to partner in (and you can too by donating for this trip), impacts some of the most desperate and impoverished of our fellow human beings on the planet. AFR works with villages where not a single other relief organization operates - none of these starving children are on the radar of Compassion International or World Vision. None of these abused and forgotten women have another shelter reaching out to them. Helping them into a better situation, that they can sustain, fits right into the core of the ministry of Christ
""Religion that God our Father accepts as pure and faultless is this: to look after orphans and widows in their distress and to keep oneself from being polluted by the world.""

What do you need to get  you there?

Frankly, we need your tax deductible donation. Our goal is to raise $6,000 to cover our air fare, lodging, etc. AFR is a non-profit, faith based organization, so you'll get a receipt for the full amount you donate, to use as a tax right off next year.
What difference does it make?

Well, seeing our smiling faces won't provide an ounce of nourishment, or a shred of clothing or shelter, of course, but our hope is that an in person visit will go a ways toward showing these families in Uganda that Jesus loves, and cares deeply for them. We'll also pitch in with labor where we can, for families that are building houses. While we're there, we'll for sure be inspired to continue our own financial and spiritual support of them, and we'll share their stories back home in hopes of getting others involved.
<

column3: >UPDATE 06/02/15: We have raised enough to award our first scholarship to Julianna Huerta of McBee Elementary. Congratulations Julianna!
column5: >UPDATE 05/25/15: Now that our studio has FLOODED from all the heavy rain in Austin, we are adding a $25 donation option for donors to receive a small 4.5 x 8.5"" print for every $25 donated to go towards repairing flood damage so the children have a safe and dry studio to come to! If you can donate more, please do, and specify if your donation is going towards the flood or towards scholarships. A special thank you goes out to Diana Simms who sent us a $300 check! THANK YOU! So whatever we have raised so far, +$300 goes to the official total!
column9:
>As mentioned in the report above by Shannon Murray of KVUE News, Pignotti Music Studios is a teaching studio founded by pianist Ruth Pignotti, who has been teaching piano for over 80 years. I am Ruth’s grandson Arlo Pignotti. The studio is having difficult times. Since 2008 fewer and fewer parents have been able to afford private music instruction. It's gotten to the point to where we're on the trajectory toward having to sell our instruments and no longer keep our home studio. My grandmother has already sold her bassoon and my mother has sold her cello. I can't let this continue. So I have a plan. To save Pignotti Music Studios AND provide private music instruction to talented students free of charge, we are awarding scholarships to 4th to 9th grade students based on need and merit.

Our family is a family of musicians and artists. My mother Lisa has taught voice, flute, and guitar for almost 40 years, and my wife Gundega Pignotti and I are graphic artists. To raise money for scholarships, my wife and I are giving a signed print of our work for every music lesson you sponsor as a show of thanks for your support. So if you support an entire semester of lessons, that's 16 signed prints of art. You'll have quite a collection. Cover a year of lessons and I will give you an ORIGINAL!

I'm really excited about this plan. Art to save music! It gives our art purpose, it saves Pignotti Music Studios, it refines the skills of young talented musicians, and gives them an excellent experience.

Our goal is to raise $24,000 in scholarships because this would fill our schedule with 30 students. We believe such a successful result of our fundraiser would get attention of potential regular donors to make this an ongoing program, ensuring Pignotti Music Studios keeps its doors open to future scholars. And if we can raise more than that, it means having more students for both teachers and making use of our smaller cozy side studio, and continue the program for additional semesters. And raising less, hey, if we receive just one donation a day, that should average enough to pay for a couple of summer scholarships, which would be very valuable as a pilot scholarship program.

Please share this message with others. To learn more at PignottiMusicStudios.com. Feel free to contact us with any questions. We thank you for your support!

<h3><strong style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0)
Why we are asking for support?

Uplift Comics was founded six years ago with the mission to encourage children to do their best in school, to be “Winners” that reach their potential, practice healthy lifestyles of nutrition and exercise free from drugs and other harmful substances and activities, and to “Be a Buddy and Not a Bully” to encourage children to refrain from hurtful words and actions and to report instances of bullying. Our educational programs have reached thousands of children in Texas and in the last two years we have extended our reach into Southern California.

Uplift Comics is a children’s entertainment and educational company that provides live interactive shows with Live-Action Mascots: The Baby Isaac Crew. These characters perform 30-60 minute shows of dancing, singing, and dialogue that cover a variety of themes including elementary basics conforming with Common Core Standards in Math, Language Arts, and Creative Arts, doing your best in school, anti-bullying, test preparation, business sense, self-esteem, anti-drugs and more. Each show is tailored to the needs of the school or organization and are currently being developed into DVD’s and on-air production.

With measured success in the elementary schools we have expanded our program to middle and high school students. We provide assembly programs for the older grades to talk about entrepreneurship and hidden opportunities in technology and the performing arts. We also provide a  3 month apprenticeship program where students learn all aspects of creation to production including drawing original sketches, vectorizing artwork, scriptwriting, creating characters, music production and show production, filming and editing.
Our programs provide:
<ul>
• Assemblies that are inline with nation wide Common Core Standards,
<ul>
• Reinforcement of positive messages toward school and learning,
<ul>
• Memorable songs and catchy themes that help children retain these messages,
<ul>
• Support and guidance for older children in business and entrepreneurship,
<ul>
• Apprenticeship and mentoring opportunities.

Our funding request is for $20,000.00 to provide computers and software, filming equipment, office space, and production costs to continue to produce shows and offer them at no charge to schools and other children’s organizations for the advancement of sustainable changes in the lives and attitudes of today’s youth toward education and their success.

column7:
>About UPLIFT COMICS

Uplift Comics was founded by Charles &
column9:
father who’s desire is to teach children to succeed by using basic skills and principles. Their intent was to create live action mascot characters that offer an educational, interactive experience through illustration, animation, and live mascot character musical performances.

Our Mission

Our Mission at Uplift Comics is to give children the opportunity to become successful by giving them open doors of opportunity to build personal character, emotional balance and spiritual knowledge. We do this by using cartoon illustration, animation, and live action mascot presentations that assist them in character building. Our operation is basic, and that is what we use to make it all work. We teach children the basics and allow them to grow from there. We do this by using what we have to create a lifestyle that leads children to success no matter what direction life takes them.

Our Philosophy

Our Philosophy is at the heart of all we do, teach children new ways to inspire and interact with others. We are currently creating developmental, age appropriate products for children 1 to 12 years of age. Our desire is to teach them how to use play as a medium of education.

Objective

Make a positive impact in schools, throughout the community, with students, and parents!

","Why we are asking for support?

column1: Uplift Comics was founded six years ago with the mission to encourage children to do their best in school, to be “Winners” that reach their potential, practice healthy lifestyles of nutrition and exercise free from drugs and other harmful substances and activities, and to “Be a Buddy and Not a Bully” to encourage children to refrain from hurtful words and actions and to report instances of bullying. Our educational programs have reached thousands of children in Texas and in the last two years we have extended our reach into Southern California.

Uplift Comics is a children’s entertainment and educational company that provides live interactive shows with Live-Action Mascots: The Baby Isaac Crew. These characters perform 30-60 minute shows of dancing, singing, and dialogue that cover a variety of themes including elementary basics conforming with Common Core Standards in Math, Language Arts, and Creative Arts, doing your best in school, anti-bullying, test preparation, business sense, self-esteem, anti-drugs and more. Each show is tailored to the needs of the school or organization and are currently being developed into DVD’s and on-air production.

With measured success in the elementary schools we have expanded our program to middle and high school students. We provide assembly programs for the older grades to talk about entrepreneurship and hidden opportunities in technology and the performing arts. We also provide a  3 month apprenticeship program where students learn all aspects of creation to production including drawing original sketches, vectorizing artwork, scriptwriting, creating characters, music production and show production, filming and editing.
Our programs provide:
Assemblies that are inline with nation wide Common Core Standards,
Reinforcement of positive messages toward school and learning,
Memorable songs and catchy themes that help children retain these messages,
Support and guidance for older children in business and entrepreneurship,
Apprenticeship and mentoring opportunities.

Our funding request is for $20,000.00 to provide computers and software, filming equipment, office space, and production costs to continue to produce shows and offer them at no charge to schools and other children’s organizations for the advancement of sustainable changes in the lives and attitudes of today’s youth toward education and their success.

The Healdsburg Education
Foundation (HEF) is raising funds to bring the Healdsburg Elementary School
(HES) library into the 21<sup>st</sup> Century. Following previous renovations
of the Healdsburg High School and Jr. High School libraries, HEF is
capitalizing on its strong partnership with the Healdsburg Unified School
District (HUSD) and our generous community to bring much-needed modernization
to the Healdsburg Elementary Library. HEF is working with the Healdsburg community to raise $85,000 to transform the space

into a dynamic, multifunctional “Learning Commons.”

The library will undergo
substantial physical renovations, including new carpet, paint and lighting and
a full technology upgrade. Furnishings will include a whiteboard wall and movable,
comfortable furniture that is flexible and easy to re-configure to create a
collaborative and participatory learning environment for Healdsburg’s youngest

students.

As
HES Principal Stephanie Feith explains
an innovative space for students and teachers to “think out loud”, investigate
ideas and successfully collaborate. The physical space will be able to adjust
to the group size
column3: and to the learning objective. We are

column1: extremely excited to redesign this area for our school  and appreciate the
community support.”
The 21st Century
Library/Learning Lab at HES will be an integral part of the K-12
Library/Technology program and the expansion of technology throughout the
District. The work is expected to be completed this summer.
The Healdsburg Education
Foundation (HEF) fundraising efforts received substantial help from both the
Healdsburg Rotary Club and the Healdsburg Sunrise Rotary Club, who joined
forces to fund 100% of the technology upgrades for the renovation. Other
donations have come in from generous community members committed to sustaining
the role of Healdsburg’s school libraries as innovative learning centers for

Healdsburg’s students.

Short Summary
We are Sofia, 20, and Elin, 23. Project leaders for the genius project GeniusRAP - rapchoirs to strengthen girls. GeniusRAP is a community and movement with 3 different alignments.
column2: >This is a project created and is being led by young people - for young people.

>We are creating the global platform needed to give girls the opportunity to meet each other and use music as the transformative tool. We cross boarders and through intercultural meetings we eliminate all preconceptions we have against each other. We believe that differences reinforces the similarities and perspectives complement our view of the world. The more perspectives, the stronger the message. We just completed our first rapchoir in Stockholm and the inquiry is larger than we could ever imagine and to meet these needs we need financial support to give more girls the opportunity to grow.

column1: What will we actually be doing?

column2: >We are passionate for girls rights, well being and have for as long as we can remember
column3: >dreamt of international cooperations based on GeniusRAP’s values. We believe in the power of
column4: >changing the society through music as a young woman.

column1: 1. We will have 10 week courses where we inspire young girls to take the place they need to grow in their potential, learn how to rap regardless previous experience and afterwards have the courage to raise their voices in a male-dominated music industry. The course contains freestyle, songwriting, rapping in a choir, dialogues for example about highs and lows of the past week, inspiring workshops with well known artists.
2. Rapquiors open for all people who define themselves as women in every city, not only in Sweden but all over the world. We learn how to rap, stick together as women and have a blast together.
3. We, Sofia &
column2: Elin, are often asked to lead workshops and lectures at schools to share our experiences regarding how we've always been thinking outside the box, how we can challenge ourselves and pursue our dreams, be proud of ourselves and the responsibility we all have in the way we act.

It is hard as a young and non-proft worker to fullfil our visions, due to the limitations of our wallets

column1:
What about your money? - Every penny counts

If we would receive money from You, you would help us with our preparation costs and travels during 6 months. 

1. We want to create a standard course plan in cooperation with very talented artists and it will give us the chance to start more choirs out there and make it easy for anyone to lead a GeniusRAP choir. We provide the tools and they provide energy and music to their choir.  

2. Pay the people who leads the choirs and the 10 week courses. 

3. We will also have more time preparing our workshops and reach out to schools who need to give their students the extra energy-push and see the future with new eyes. 

4. We would have money to take the train and a place to rest our heads while going to new cities to help them getting started with the choir.

To accomplish this, we need time. Time does not exist without money and without money GeniusRAP will never reach its full potential. There is so much worth to society getting young girls to feel confident in themselves despite all the pressures of today's society about how to be, act and look like. Imagine that freedom... We’re working so hard for this and we get answers such as ""wait till next year”, ”apply next year”. We can not wait until next year. 

More
young girls than the 10 that participated in our rapchoir this spring should
have the opportunity to grow in themselves, spend time in a safe environment,
learn how to rap in a choir and express themselves through rap.
Give young girls this opportunity
by helping us in any way you can to connect us with the right people who does
not expect millions in profits in 3 years, but people who think that
everyone has the right to take part in a platform where one can grow through
rap regardless previous experience, changing a male-dominated music industry
and approaching the future and dreams with a new energy. Share this and make
this reality for all young girls out there! We are here waiting for you. Hugs!
","Short Summary

We are Sofia, 20, and Elin, 23. Project leaders for the genius project GeniusRAP - rapchoirs to strengthen girls. GeniusRAP is a community and movement with 3 different alignments. This is a project created and is being led by young people - for young people.

We are creating the global platform needed to give girls the opportunity to meet each other and use music as the transformative tool. We cross boarders and through intercultural meetings we eliminate all preconceptions we have against each other. We believe that differences reinforces the similarities and perspectives complement our view of the world. The more perspectives, the stronger the message. We just completed our first rapchoir in Stockholm and the inquiry is larger than we could ever imagine and to meet these needs we need financial support to give more girls the opportunity to grow.
What will we actually be doing?

We are passionate for girls rights, well being and have for as long as we can remember dreamt of international cooperations based on GeniusRAP’s values. We believe in the power of changing the society through music as a young woman.

1. We will have 10 week courses where we inspire young girls to take the place they need to grow in their potential, learn how to rap regardless previous experience and afterwards have the courage to raise their voices in a male-dominated music industry. The course contains freestyle, songwriting, rapping in a choir, dialogues for example about highs and lows of the past week, inspiring workshops with well known artists.
2. Rapquiors open for all people who define themselves as women in every city, not only in Sweden but all over the world. We learn how to rap, stick together as women and have a blast together.

3. We, Sofia & Elin, are often asked to lead workshops and lectures at schools to share our experiences regarding how we've always been thinking outside the box, how we can challenge ourselves and pursue our dreams, be proud of ourselves and the responsibility we all have in the way we act.
Why help us?

It is hard as a young and non-proft worker to fullfil our visions, due to the limitations of our wallets and circle of contacts abroad. We have to be in immidiate contact and create genuine relationships to be able to develop long-lasting cooperations. We all have to work together nationwide, since it is in those contexts we all will develop our approach towards women in the musicindustry and make the real change. The more perpectives the stronger the message. The more girls who dare to take more place, the stronger and bigger the ripple effect will be.

We want to raise girls creativity, perspectives and experiences to be able to write girls stories together. We use music, rap in particular, to lift girls creativity, perspectives and experiences to write girls story together.

What about your money? - Every penny countsIf we would receive money from You, you would help us with our preparation costs and travels during 6 months. 1. We want to create a standard course plan in cooperation with very talented artists and it will give us the chance to start more choirs out there and make it easy for anyone to lead a GeniusRAP choir. We provide the tools and they provide energy and music to their choir.  2. Pay the people who leads the choirs and the 10 week courses. 3. We will also have more time preparing our workshops and reach out to schools who need to give their students the extra energy-push and see the future with new eyes. 4. We would have money to take the train and a place to rest our heads while going to new cities to help them getting started with the choir.To accomplish this, we need time. Time does not exist without money and without money GeniusRAP will never reach its full potential. There is so much worth to society getting young girls to feel confident in themselves despite all the pressures of today's society about how to be, act and look like. Imagine that freedom... We’re working so hard for this and we get answers such as ""wait till next year”, ”apply next year”. We can not wait until next year. More
young girls than the 10 that participated in our rapchoir this spring should
have the opportunity to grow in themselves, spend time in a safe environment,
learn how to rap in a choir and express themselves through rap.
Give young girls this opportunity
by helping us in any way you can to connect us with the right people who does
not expect millions in profits in 3 years, but people who think that
everyone has the right to take part in a platform where one can grow through
rap regardless previous experience, changing a male-dominated music industry
and approaching the future and dreams with a new energy. Share this and make
this reality for all young girls out there! We are here waiting for you. Hugs!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Stockholm, Sweden",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/pop-up-rapchoirs-for-girls/pica

The
advantage to knowing your strengths is you are more effective in
everything you do and more successful in achieving your goals. Strengths Finder gives you an accurate picture of the things
you can do to become stronger daily and grow exponentially.
I
do personal and professional coaching and I am also a business
consultant.  My clients are transformed by something
that is so simple and genuine they immediately embrace it.  It's made my work rewarding and helps me make a
difference where I am most passionate
column2: understanding why we do what we do and how we can be better.

column1:
A great example of this is Greg in Orlando.  He went to college, graduated and began to work in a field that he was passionate about.  When he had an opportunity to meet with someone who could impact his future by helping him achieve his goals with advice you only get from someone in such a position, Greg relied on what he learned in coaching and had an authentic conversation that was built around his strengths.

The VP of this Theme Park instantly recognized something different and is still having an ongoing conversation with Greg. He has also taken an interest in his future.  This is something that does not come from the usual Q&
column2:
A you might have when you are given an opportunity like this.  It is the result of Greg knowing what his strengths are and how to tilt the world out of balance towards those strengths.

Greg is continuing to discover further success and understand more specific goals with confidence because he knows who he is and has the tools to move forward.  The process Greg has been through has produced confidence, clarity and an identity he believes in because it is genuine.

column1: This is a real possibility for all of us.  As a father of six, I want nothing more than for my children to have that confidence in life so they will recognize the imposter in the world and identify with the right choices.  It
begins with a strengths based approach to our activities
and includes an accurate look at personality that is amazingly
fresh and revealing.
Please help me receive the training and
certification from Gallup in their Strengths Finder
program.  I live in SW Florida and there is an opportunity to go to
Atlanta to receive a four day training that will help me achieve significantly more and give me a platform that is broader.
In
the event I am unable to reach my financial goal during this campaign,
it is important for me that you know your contribution
will remain earmarked and exclusively for the purpose of this particular training.   I would continue
to raise the money and upon reaching the necessary funds take the next
available training.
I
have several people I am working with and things are at critical mass.
In the last three years I have seen the most consistent and encouraging
things take place.  There are some who even suggest I wait
and take this next step alone, but if there is a chance to bring people
together any sooner and acquire what I need now I must find out.
Please also pass this along by using the ‘Share Tools’.

Short Summary

We are the International Baccalaureate Diploma Students (IBDP) of Singapore International School Hong Kong (SISHK). For the past 3 years, our school has been going to Cambodia for our Community, Action and Service (CAS) trip. While in Cambodia we helped the community by building new toilets and also teaching at a school. This year we are still doing so. However, this year is different because we will be spltting into two groups, half of us going to Cambodia and the other half going to Nanning, China. In Nanning, we will be staying at a Leprosy Rehabilitation Village. In this rehabilitation village, the villagers are put under social stigma by the government, the public, and even their own families. People are unaware that after you have been cured from leprosy, you're cured. It's gone and you're fully cleared of it, but because of the deformations that leprosy has caused to your body, people are afraid of them. Our school will be going to the village, interacting with the villagers, following them around in their day-to-day lives, showing them love and care, and helping to repair/improve the facilities that they have in the village since they don't get any funding from the government, but most importantly, we are there to reduce the social stigma between them and the rest of the country, in order to unite them with neighbouring villages and make them feel more a part of where they are.
Our Goal &

column2: >In our campaign we hope to raise 5,000USD. This money will greatly help us in funding the items that we will be purchasing for the villagers. We will be purchasing simple but fundamental household items that the villagers don't have the rightful luxury of having. If our goal is not reached, the money raised would still be used to buy the same items however it would just mean that we may not be able to buy as many of the items as we are intending to.

column1: By getting the funding that we need, we are able to help the villagers in reducing the social stigma cause by the government and the locals that are unaware about leprosy. The villagers in the rehabilitation village see the same few people day-in day-out and by our school going there we can really make a difference in their lives as well as put a smile on their faces. When the locals around the area see us foreigners in the village interacting with the villagers they will realise that it is fine to be about the cured leprosy patients and that  they can help too.
Risks &

Through the course so far of organising this trip, there are many risks and challenges that are being taken. For example, we have a group that is learning to cook food for us for our entire journey while we are there. There are also people who are taking a first-aid course in order to make sure everyone going will be kept safe. The main challenge that we are facing now, however, is fund raising. Hence this IndieGoGo page being created, we are hoping that this will help shed light on our cause and help us earn the sum of money we need.
Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate, that's absolutely fine! You can still help us by spreading the word to your peers,colleagues and family about our cause. Please pass the message around about our campaign.
Thank you all for helping us in out your support is much apprieciated.
","Short Summary

We are the International Baccalaureate Diploma Students (IBDP) of Singapore International School Hong Kong (SISHK). For the past 3 years, our school has been going to Cambodia for our Community, Action and Service (CAS) trip. While in Cambodia we helped the community by building new toilets and also teaching at a school. This year we are still doing so. However, this year is different because we will be spltting into two groups, half of us going to Cambodia and the other half going to Nanning, China. In Nanning, we will be staying at a Leprosy Rehabilitation Village. In this rehabilitation village, the villagers are put under social stigma by the government, the public, and even their own families. People are unaware that after you have been cured from leprosy, you're cured. It's gone and you're fully cleared of it, but because of the deformations that leprosy has caused to your body, people are afraid of them. Our school will be going to the village, interacting with the villagers, following them around in their day-to-day lives, showing them love and care, and helping to repair/improve the facilities that they have in the village since they don't get any funding from the government, but most importantly, we are there to reduce the social stigma between them and the rest of the country, in order to unite them with neighbouring villages and make them feel more a part of where they are.
Our Goal & Where the money goes to

In our campaign we hope to raise 5,000USD. This money will greatly help us in funding the items that we will be purchasing for the villagers. We will be purchasing simple but fundamental household items that the villagers don't have the rightful luxury of having. If our goal is not reached, the money raised would still be used to buy the same items however it would just mean that we may not be able to buy as many of the items as we are intending to.
The Impact

By getting the funding that we need, we are able to help the villagers in reducing the social stigma cause by the government and the locals that are unaware about leprosy. The villagers in the rehabilitation village see the same few people day-in day-out and by our school going there we can really make a difference in their lives as well as put a smile on their faces. Risks & Challenges

For example, we have a group that is learning to cook food for us for our entire journey while we are there. Hence this IndieGoGo page being created, we are hoping that this will help shed light on our cause and help us earn the sum of money we need.
Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you all for helping us in out your support is much apprieciated.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

Ten girl babies rescued from female infanticide in India want to attend school. You can help. 

Our names are Kelly Warner and Allison Baltzersen. We're mutual friends for almost a decade of
column9:
>Russal Raj and Kumari Russal of Chennai, Tamil Nadu, India. Russal and Kumari frequently travel throughout rural India speaking out against female infanticide in secluded villages, where the practice of killing infant girls to avoid the burden of dowry and other social hardship still exists.

Russal and Kumari have rescued and continue to raise 14 infant girls in a quality loving home, operating as a charitable trust in India called ""Destitutes Charitable Trust,"" registration number 2278 dt.23-06-2006. Their oldest 10 girls (Grace, Angel, Erika, Kelsey, Jennifer, Blessey, Hannah, Trisha, Sharon, and Jessica) have grown and are now school age, attending the Alwin International Public School where they are learning English and thriving academically.  The school tuition for these girls is a financial burden on Russal and Kumari’s small non-profit so Allison and I are raising funds to help these girls attend school.

For every $75 contributed, one girl will be able to attend the Alwin International Public School for a
column13: >full month.  For every $899 contributed, one girl will be able to attend a full year.  Our goal is to raise
column17:
>a full $8,984 to cover the cost of an entire year of tuition for all ten of the girls.  Your help is essential and provides value that is beyond measure for these young survivors.

Please watch our video at https://vimeo.com/134099254 to learn more about the grassroots efforts of
column21: >Russal and Kumari through their non-profit, Destitute Charitable Trust, a home for rescued female
column25: >infants, formed in 2006. In the last nine years, Russal and Kumari have rescued fourteen girls from
column29: >imminent death and are raising them in a joyful, Christian home that views girls as a blessing, not a
column33: >liability.  Russal and Kumari are rescuers. They are parents.  And you can help them right now by
column37:
>giving what you can toward education costs of the girls.  

Your money goes directly to Russal and Kumari from Indiegogo, with nothing in between.  So make a
column41: >difference and help end the practice of female infanticide by sharing this video with your friends. You
column45: >can also continue to follow and support the work of Russal and Kumari at their website
column49: >at
column56:

","Ten girl babies rescued from female infanticide in India want to attend school. You can help. Our names are Kelly Warner and Allison Baltzersen. We're mutual friends for almost a decade of husband and wife team Russal Raj and Kumari Russal of Chennai, Tamil Nadu, India. Russal and Kumari frequently travel throughout rural India speaking out against female infanticide in secluded villages, where the practice of killing infant girls to avoid the burden of dowry and other social hardship still exists.Russal and Kumari have rescued and continue to raise 14 infant girls in a quality loving home, operating as a charitable trust in India called ""Destitutes Charitable Trust,"" registration number 2278 dt.23-06-2006. Their oldest 10 girls (Grace, Angel, Erika, Kelsey, Jennifer, Blessey, Hannah, Trisha, Sharon, and Jessica) have grown and are now school age, attending the Alwin International Public School where they are learning English and thriving academically.  The school tuition for these girls is a financial burden on Russal and Kumari’s small non-profit so Allison and I are raising funds to help these girls attend school.For every $75 contributed, one girl will be able to attend the Alwin International Public School for a full month.  For every $899 contributed, one girl will be able to attend a full year.  Our goal is to raise a full $8,984 to cover the cost of an entire year of tuition for all ten of the girls.  Your help is essential and provides value that is beyond measure for these young survivors.Please watch our video at https://vimeo.com/134099254 to learn more about the grassroots efforts of Russal and Kumari through their non-profit, Destitute Charitable Trust, a home for rescued female infants, formed in 2006. In the last nine years, Russal and Kumari have rescued fourteen girls from imminent death and are raising them in a joyful, Christian home that views girls as a blessing, not a liability.  Russal and Kumari are rescuers. They are parents.  And you can help them right now by giving what you can toward education costs of the girls.  Your money goes directly to Russal and Kumari from Indiegogo, with nothing in between.  So make a difference and help end the practice of female infanticide by sharing this video with your friends. You can also continue to follow and support the work of Russal and Kumari at their website at http://www.girlbabyhome.com/.Please share the link to our video and this IndieGogo page with your friends on social media using the hashtag #girlbabyhome to raise awareness of the continuing dangers of infanticide and how we can all help by supporting Russal and Kumari.  Thank you for your love and support for this incredible grassroots project. The girls will appreciate the lifelong value provided by your financial gift. Note that money raised in addition to the $8,984 will go to the Raj family for future tuition and educational needs for the rescued girls.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

Our Mission
Y-Apply, Inc. is a 501(c)3 tax-exempt nonprofit
organization dedicated to educating high-achieving public school students from
diverse backgrounds and their families about financial aid options and the
application process to top-tier colleges and universities.
Our Difference
Y-Apply is the
only national college access program that includes students and
families as an integral part of its program model. Students and families
consistently credit Y-Apply as being a key factor in
gaining admission to a highly selective college or university.
Our Impact
Students and
parents leave our program as partners in the college
application process with a strategic plan in place for success. <b><i><u>98% of
our attendees have gained admission to top-tier universities and we
have helped students and families negotiate over $46M in financial aid.
Our Vision
When students
from underrepresented backgrounds are applying and being accepted
to highly selective institutions at a rate comparable to their counterparts,
the work of Y-Apply will be complete.
What We Need
We need to
raise $50,000 to fund the production costs of our programs this fall. Your
tax-deductible contribution will help us encourage bright and talented students to
pursue their dreams and apply to the America’s top colleges and universities
with the full support of their families.
Due to the intimate and interactive nature of our program, the number of
student participants is limited to twenty in each city. Each student is allowed to invite only one parent/guardian to attend with them. A gift of $250 will
cover the cost of one program participant.
Sadly, the lack of
information, encouragement and support provided by programs like Y-Apply can
make all the difference in the future of these promising, young minds. If we are
unable to reach our fundraising goal, the opportunity to help a gifted student
successfully apply to the college of his or her dreams may be lost…
Other Ways You
Can Help
While we are
grateful for any and all financial contributions made, if you are
unable to make a contribution at this time, there are other ways you can help:
Help us get the
word out!  Use your social media or Indiegogo share tools to tell your
friends about the critical work we do.
On behalf of
our board and the students and families we serve and will continue to serve,
thank you for your time and attention.  And thank you for your support

The Social Teahouse is a social entrepreneurial idea from Varna, Bulgaria. We want to create a space where young people, rased in orphanages can start their proffessional path and receive the mentorship and support, which they need to overcome the lack of good education, social skills and trust towards society. Our team has developed a 3-year mentorship program and we convinced the Municipality of Varna to provide us with a buidling in the hearth of the city so we can open. Now we are currently looking for public support so our idea and the dreams of the many children and young people we work with, can actually come true.
